name: Just south of Knobby Head
description:
An idyllic beach with easy access from the road.

Comment: North Knobby Head is still open for camping for 72 hours at position -29.653724, 114.965622

name: British Off Road
description:
Independent Land Rover Specialists. Sales, parts, servicing.
Open Mon - Fri 08:00 to 17:00
Sat 08:00 to 12:00
Ph:54451094
Workshop direct: 0754766077

name: Rodds Bay/Turkey Beach
description: Wild camp next to beach. 4x4 access only. 2 x small grass sites. Not for big rigs. Looks like the site will be developed in the near future.

name: Waverley Creek Rest Area
description: Nice rest area with toilets, bins, big rig parking, grass areas to pitch tents, picnic tables and sun shades. Also public telephone, no mobile coverage.

name: Platypus Bush Camp
description: Camping $10 pp pn, covered cooking area, fire pit, wood available. Huts also available. Toilets, showers (some times even hot)

name: Estuary Wild Camp
description: Sandy track near mouth of Estury/mud flats. Bring bug spray for the midges.

name: Blue water creek
description: Offical RV friendly spot. Toilets, grass for pitching tents and play ground.

name: Wallam Fall Road, viewpoint
description: Level parking area with good view looking back to the sea. Picnic bench. If this site is full, there is another just up the road.

name: Drew Park/Rest stop
description: Overnight parking/camping along main road. Tiolets, covered seating, bbq, grass for tents and playground.

name: Boulders Camp Ground
description: Free campground next to the Boulders river area. about 8 camping areas, with 5 people max per site. Max stay 72hrs or 3 nights. Toilets and cold shower. no drinking water. arrive early and go for a swim and or walk

name: Bramston Beach, Rocky Point
description: Picnic area/car park next to creek and beach. Picnic tables and drinkable water tap. Grass and sand areas to pitch tent.

name: Babinda Rotary Park
description: Free campsite. Large area for big rigs. Tiolets, hot showers $2, bins, black water dump point. Grass for tents. Next to creek. 4G mobile coverage.

name: Ayton Beach
description: Wild camp right next to beach. Trees for shade, plenty of fire wood. Big rigs might strungle with low trees. Areas to pitch tents.

name: Eddie's Elim Beach Camping
description: Nice camp area with trees for shade, right next to the beach.

name: Hann Crossing
description: National park campground right next to river. Sites next to the (dusty) road. Little shadow. Drop toilets down the road. Large sites, easy for big rigs. AUD 6.55 per person.

name: Bramwell Station
description: New campsite. Hot/cold showers tiolets. Big grass area for camping. Easy access for big rigs. $10 pp pn Bar on site $6 a can.

name: Mute Point
description: Official wild camping spots along estuariy. Small sand areas along beach front. 4x4 access only and deep sand on track. Good fishing.

name: Horse creek road diggings
description: Big flat area based around big holes from road works. Easy for big rigs. Great view of the stars.

name: Gulf Country Caravan park
description: No frills caravan park in Karumba. Hot showers, tiolets, powered/unpowered site. Drinking water. Small pool. Free Wifi around office only. Good Telstra 4G coverage.

name: Adeles Grove
description: Nice camp area along creek 12km from Lawn Hill gorge.

name: SW of Borroloola
description: Bush camp off of Carpentaria highway. Not great for tents because of grass stubble. But good for everything else.

name: Munbililla Campground
description: Nice campground by river. Good hot showers, toilets and wash basins. Ranger onsite to book in.

name: Katherine Gorge campground
description: Nice campground at gorge entrance. Free Wifi around pool area 200mb limit. Hot showers, washing machines (4x$1 coins). $16 pp pn

name: Creekside along road to Edith Falls
description: Flat dirt/grass area among trees along creek. Established fire spots. Easy 2wd dirt access track from road.

name: Gunlom campground
description: National park campground with showers and tiolets. Close to falls and swimming pools. (steep rocky 1km walk) Fire pits and picnic benches. $15 pp pn paided onsite.

name: Litchfield Safi camp
description: Ok place, bit run down. Campsites set between shady trees. Tiolets and showers are in one block and work ok. Pool is a deep pond.

name: Wangi Fall campground
description:
I didn't stay here but looks great compaired with the Safari camp.
Swim in the falls pool. Free wifi at picnic area with good speed.

name: Surprise Creek
description: Limited to 6 spots with fire pit and bench. Drop toilets. Nice set of swim holes/falls nearby. Adults $3.30, kids 5-15 years $1.75, families 2A + 4k $7.70 pn

name: Dicks creek
description: Sandy/dusty area along creek 80m from bridge and road. Plenty of fire wood, but hard ground to get pegs into. Can take 1 large rig and 2 -3 small vehicles.

name: Lake Argil
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because wild camping in the Park is illegal.

name: Rest stop
description:
Rest stop with 24hr stay allowed. Drop tiolets, bins and picnic benchs. Hard ground/gravel so hard to pitch a tent. 1 bar of Telstra coverage.
Sanitation dump station, toilets. About 150 m from road. Flat terrain with little shade.

name: Spring Creek Rest Area
description: Free overnight camp / Long drop toilets, picnic tables, bins and bbqs. Not great for pitching tents but you can find spots. One bar Telstra coverage.

name: Mother Earth wild camp
description: Great spot for 3 x 4x4's amoungst amazing rock formations. Bring firewood with you. Dusty hard ground can be hard to pitch a tent. Rocky access track but ok for 2wd if you take it easy. There is also a few single vehicle spots on the way in.

name: Broome Caravan Park
description:
Great pool and showers. Friendly and help staff. The unpowered grass pitches lack much grass though. $22 pp pn unpowered.
3 bars of 4G Telstra coverage.

name: Quondong Point Wild camp
description: Follow Cape Leveque rd then turn off Manari rd to Quondong pt. Its sign posted. There are many wild camp spots dotted all around the area along the coast. 4G Telstra coverage in some spots.

name: 80 mile beach caravan park
description: Set right behind the dunes on the beach it makes for a nice location to watch the sun go down. Hot showers, tiolets, bbq area and 1 bar of Telstra 4G coverage. $35 for unpowered site.

name: Dales Gorge Campground
description: Stoney sites and drop tiolets only. Gas bbq available. So not suitable for tents that need thier pegs to hold shape. Optus coverage only.  $11 pp pn + $15 Park entry for vehicle (only pay once)

name: Hamersley Gorge Rest Stop
description: Just short of the carpark to walk into Hamersley gorge there is a rest area with drop tiolets coverage picnic table and free wifi (limited data and time) 1-2 bar of telstra 4G

name: Barradale Rest Area
description: Big rest area with many tracks leading to camp spots. Head towards to back closest the creek to get away from the road and road train niose. 1-2 bar Telstra 4G coverage. Barbecue, toilet, 24 hrs max. Free.

name: T-Bone, Ningaloo Reef
description: None bookable camping area of 3 pitches right next to the beach and about 1km from the visitor centre. So you have to drive down check a spot if free, then return to the visitor centre to book. The is no mobile signal.

name: New Beach wild camp
description: Legitimate wild camping area. Many different spots. Hard dirt track access then sandy pitches. ok for 2wd/vans. 1-2 bars of Telstra 4G coverage.

name: Steep Point National Park Campsite
description: Campsites just around from Steep Point. Effectively wild camping so bring everything with you. Track in reduces to sandy single track with steep climbs and decents. 4x4 access only. 1 bar 4G coverage from some spots.

name: Denham Seaside Tourist Park
description: Campground with all facilities. Good wifi around office and camp kitchen. Supermarket opposite. Right next to beach. Good Telstra mobile coverage. $30 for one person camping, unpowered.

name: Bottle Bay Campground
description: Well spaces sandy bays arranged in 3 circular groups. Access is via soft sandt tracks so 4x4 only. Drop toilets. Beach access. White coral sand to blue (cold) water. No mobile signal.

name: Big river ranch
description: Camping $15pp pn nice spot on a horse ranch.

name: Caves caravan park
description: Decent campsite on the edge of town close to caves, pub and post office. Cheaper than the beach front one especially if you on your own. $12.50 off season. $15 mid season. pp pn.

name: Prevelly Caravan Park
description: Nice grassy camp ground close to surf breaks. 4G coverage.

name: John Rate Lookout carpark
description:
10km West of Walpole on the South West Highway. It a loop track just off the main road with a few level parking bays. The road is quiet at night. Drop toilet and bin. 
No camping allowed. 
Weak Telstra signal.

name: Sussetta River Rest Stop
description: Road side rest stop with no facilities. Not actually on the river. Follow track towards to back of the rest area to find more secluded sites. 2wd accessable. 1bar of 4G Telstra signal drops in and out. Quiet main road at night.

name: Fanny Cove Campsite
description: 3 Large compacted sand sites. Close to beach and headland. Access track has soft sandy patches so a 4x4 is best. No phone coverage. Drop toilet.

name: Lucky Bay National Park Campsite
description:
Very popular site, which was being expanded when I was here.
Close to white sandy beach with blue water. Flies were a pest during the day. Warm solar shower and flushing toilets.

name: Israelite Bay Camp area
description:
No facilities. No fires Nov -April.
POI Ruins of old telegraph station.
The access track is rough and slow and 4x4 is needed. Could be impassable after heavy rain. I wasn't amazed by the beach. Lots of flies during the day.

name: 24hr Rest Area West of Yalata
description: Lots of spots to camp as you follows tracks away from the road. All accessible by 2wd. There is also a disused quarry with access ramp, if its windy and you seek some shelter. No phone signal and no facilities.

name: Point Brown Wild Camp
description: A couple of tracks leading to different camp spots in the area. This point SE from a sandy cliff top with beach and ocean below. 1 bar on/off of Telstra 4G. Access tracks are compacted sand/grave ok for 2wd.

name: Drummond Point wild camp
description: Wild camp in dune bowl, set back from cliffs. Plenty of other spots in the area. 2wd access on graded dirt road. No phone coverage.

name: Rest area wild camp
description: Only bin and picnic table by road side. But lots of camping spots as you follow the track away from the road. 1-2 bar Telstra 4G signal.

name: Pekina Creek Wild camp
description: Nice grassy sit next to dry river bed. Fire pit. 2wd access from road. 1-2 bar 4G Telstra coverage.

name: Langhorne Creek
description: Toilet, bins and tables provide in this grassy tree covered area. Numbered sites. Pub 500m down the road. Quiet at night - not much traffic on road. Good Telstra 4G coverage. 72hrs max stay. Sleep with the sounds of frogs. Some mosquito's but not excessive. 1/10/2020 $5 per site per night. Put Correct change in box next to big sign see photos.

name: Mt Cowley
description: 2wd grade dirt access through forest. Grave parking area by tower and plenty of grass around to pitch a tent. 5 bars of Telstra 4G. Quiet a night.

name: Berrys Beach Carparkmm k
description: Small car park at top of cliffs. 2wd sealed road access. No facilities. Ok fot one night. 1 bar 4G Telstra signal.

name: Tidal River Campground
description: All the facilities you can image for a 5 star campground. Shop, takeaway, hot showers, washing machines etc. Even a cinema in summer. However price is per pitch at $54 unpowered for up to 8 people. So if you have a group this is ok. Good 4G Telstra coverage.

name: Suggan Buggan Free Campground
description: Gravel parking area with a couple of picnic benches and a drop toilet. Next to a river. No mobile phone signal.

name: Jacobs River Campground
description: Nice camp spot right next to river good to swim in. Pinic tables and fire pits at different pitches. One drop toilet and covered picnic table. No mobile signal.

name: Clay Pits Park
description: Plenty of spots to pull up along the lake. Sleeping in vehicle is best. Quiet spot over night but a boot camp fitness group operates in the park from 05:30! Good Telstra 4G signal.

name: Mission Beach Camp Area, Paul Smedley
description:
Ideal for tents and campervans.
Cheap
Almost on the beach, with a super view.

name: Maculata Trail N Bermagui
description:
Wild camp in the woods North of Bermagui. Only space for 2 vans or I car and tent. But there are several spots along the track.
1bar 4G Telstra cover, with 3bars of 2G Edge.

name: School overflow carpark - Vincentia
description: Two large speed bumps mean you have to have a high clearance vehicle to get in here. It a clear natural rock area with bushland surrounding close to the school. No good for pitching tents but find for sleeping in vehicles. 2 bars of Telstra 4G coverage. Shopping area just down the road.

name: Free Pool and warm showers
description:
Free Salt water pool with changing rooms and free warm (solar) showers.
Open from 08:00 to 17:30 (19:30 summer)

name: South Beach Car Park
description:
Over night parking and sleeping in vehicles is no problem. Toilet block is locked at night. 17:30 winter 19:30 summer to 05:30. Outside cold shower.
Rubbish bin available. However it can be nosey until late because of hoons driving up and down the road.

name: Sutherland Leasure Center
description: Swim $6.50 A number of different pools both 25m and 50m. Hot showers and basen/mirror for a shave.

name: Vale of Al reserve
description: Carpark with dog park and playing fields around. Close to river. Toilets and gates locked at night but sercurity are cool with you sleeping in vehicles overnight.

name: The Expedition Centre
description: Daniel specialises in pop top camper roofs for Land Rovers plus other overland kit. He loves meeting other overlanders. M: +61438183507

name: Newnes Free Camp
description: Multiple camping areas. Grassy areas with fire pits and drop toliet. Take all rubbish with you. No phone coverage. Does get busy at weekends and holidays.

name: Indian Visa Application Centre
description: Not the embassy. This is where you can apply for you Indian visa. Note you have to book a appointment and fill in the application form on line.

name: Free Parking for access to Echo Point
description: There is free parking at Silver Mist Reserve which is only a short walk from Echo Point and the Three Sisters viewing platform.

name: Settlers Arms Inn
description: Free camping in the park. Great oldy worldy pub right across the road. Public tiolets, BBQ and picnic benchs. No mobile signal. But pub has free wifi in main bar.

name: Branxton Rest Area
description: Nice rest area with tiolets, covered picnic tables and grass areas. 4G Telstra mobile coverage.

name: Devils Hole, Barrington Tops NP
description: Rough stony track with three different camp areas. Not good for pitching tents. Ok for sleeping in vehicle. 2wd access ok. Drop tiolet over road at view point. $6 pp pn. No mobile coverage.

name: Copelands Res free campsite
description: Big grass area with covered picnic tables, fire pits, bins and drop tiolet. No mobile coverage.

name: Ryans cut Picnic Area
description: A designated picnic area with no facilities. There is multiple spots left and right of the track on the way in to pull off and camp. Good overnight spot. But locals to come and go to deploy crab pots in the creek. No direct beach access. 2 bars of 3G Telstra mobile coverage.

name: Ballina Library - free wifi
description: There is free wifi available. Plus other computer services like printing and scanning etc.

name: Crummunda Park
description: Quiet car park by creek with Picnic benches , play ground, toilets and bbq's. There is also a cold shower near the carpark. Arrived after dark and woke at dawn. The park gets busy quickly in the morning with runners and dog walkers.

name: Parry Beach Recreational Area
description: Nice campsite near a beautiful beach.  There is a height restriction of 2.7m. If you are above this as we are there is an overflow parking area 100metres back down the road. We paid A$15.

name: St Mary's Inlet
description: Nice camping area just back from the beach in Fitzgerald River NP.  Only facilities are gas barbecue and long drop toilets.  Entrance fee of $12 per vehicle and the. $7 50 per adult to camp.

name: The Breakaways
description: Pretty roadside point of interest with 5 basic campsites under gum trees. The breakaway is a rock formation, a little like the more famous wave rock at Hyden, yellow with red streaks. The sites have a picnic table, grill and a pit toilet. No water. No bin. Free. Just west of these coordinates.

name: McDermid Rock
description: Small camping area beneath the rock. Nicely set back from the road.  Toilet,and fire rings are the only facilities. No water or rubbish bins. Free.

name: Baxter Rest Area
description: There are lots of places to camp for the night along the Eyre Highway as you drive across the Nullarboor.  Some have slightly more facilities than others.  This one has a toilet, a dump spot and a Telstra stick will work.  You can also drive down a track to get further away from the road.  Free

name: Cactus Bay
description: Camping in amongst the dunes behind a famous surf beech. $12.50 per adult.  Basic but clean facilities.  Worth the drive from the Eyre Highway.

name: Perlubie Beach
description: Camping directly on the beach in a nice bay.  Need to watch the tides and soft sand.  No real facilities other than a toilet.  Honesty box $5 per night.

name: Yangie Bay
description: Campground in Coffin Bay National Park.  Basic facilities.  $10 one off entry to the park and then $11 per night per vehicle.

name: Aroona Campground
description: Lovely campground in the gum trees in the beautiful Flinders NP.  Close to the start of a number of walks. $14 per night per vehicle for camping. $10 one time entry fee for the vehicle to the NP.

name: Trezona Campground
description: Camping in Flinders NP.  Well situated for some nearby walks. $14 per night per vehicle. $10 one time entry fee to the park per,vehicle.

name: Cape Bridgewater Camp
description: Campsite overlooking Cape Bridgewater Beach.  This is a schools camp but they also have camping.  Plenty of facilities.  No school trips while we were there so it was quiet. $20 per night for an unpowered site.

name: Big Hill Campground
description: Camp in the Great Otway NP. Pleasant setting in amongst the trees.  Only facilities are toilets and firepit. Need to book a site on the park's web site.

name: McKillop Bridge
description: If you are inspired by the film "The Man from Snowy River" then this is Snowy Mountain NP.  Beautiful gorges and rivers.  Camping near the river.  No facilities other than fire pits and pit toilets.  Free camping and free entry to park.  Narrow twisting road down gorge to river.

name: Anglers Rest
description: Pleasant camping by a river with fishing. No facilities other than fire ring and pit toilets.  Free.

name: Raspberry Hill
description: Lovely basic camp spot high in the Alpine NP.  Only facilities are pit toilet and fire area.  Free

name: Pioneer Bridges
description: Nice spot next to river with sandy banks.  Only facilities are pit toilets.  Free.

name: Anderson Mill
description: Free camping down a lane on the woods.  Used by people on horses too.  No real facilities except fire pit and pit toilets.  Free

name: Cosy Corner South
description: One of a number of campsites just behind the beach in the Bay of Fires.  Stunning beach.  Basic campground.  Busy in holidays.  Free.

name: Swimcart Beach
description: There is a long strip where you can camp on top of the dunes with great views over the ocean and the beach.  If you can get one of these spots it's well worth it.  We moved here from Cosy Corner as there were more spots directly on the beach.  No facilities other than pit toilets.  Free.

name: Friendlies Beaches
description: Campsites set in the dunes next to a beautiful beach. In Freycinet NP so park fees $12 per vehicle apply but camping is free.  No facilities other than pit toilets.  Busy in holiday season.

name: Hobart Showgrounds
description: Camping at the Showgrounds just outside Hobart.  Easy transport into the city. $20 for a powered site.

name: Bethune Park
description: Free campground overlooking dam.  Not much to write about.  Only facilities were flush toilets.

name: Ocean Beach
description: Parking area overlooking the beach.  Great spot for sunsets.  Can be quite busy but quiet once the sun goes down.  No facilities.  Free

name: Lake Mackintosh
description: Lovely camp spot on the side of the lake.  Great views.  No facilities. Free

name: Lake Gardiner
description: Camping by a small river at the end of a lake.  No facilities. Free

name: Lake Rowallan
description: Camping by the side of the lake in a large gravel area.  Lots of other spots nearby.  No facilities. Free

name: Slaty Creek
description: Campground in the forest. Only facilities were a toilet. Free.

name: Christies Beach
description: Lots of spots here along the Murray River.  No facilities. Free

name: Edward River Campground
description: Lovely campsite beside the river in Murray River NP.  Large flat spaces set in red gum forest.  Only facilities pit toilets.  Free.

name: Wilks Park
description: Featureless free camping area but convenient for town.  Nicer places outside town but if you need the services of Wagga Wagga its ok.  Quite busy and some road noise.  Gas BBQ, flush toilets, portable water and a dump station. Free. Good reception

name: Exhibition Park
description: Camping area at the exhibition grounds conveniently located to visit Canberra.  Bus stop outside I to town.  Lots of facilities, laundry, showers, water dump etc.  $28 for an unpowered site for 2 people. $5 per extra person.

name: Bendeela Recreation Area
description: Great grassy camping area next to a large dammed river.  Some facilities Inc water and toilets. Good fresh water swimming in summer. Wombats wander around in the evening.  Free. See link for details of opening times for overflow camping area or emergency closures. Book online see link. $6 per visit max 6 persons 2 cars and 7 days. Gets full on weekends.. Book ahead

name: Blackheath Glen Park Reserve
description: Simple camping area in the forest.  No real facilities but pleasant enough spot although some road noise.  Free.

name: Boyd River Camping Area
description: Pleasant camping spot in amongst the gum trees.  No facilities other than pit toilet. Free.

name: State Forest
description: Lots of tracks in the State Forest.  No facilities. Free.

name: Evans Lookout Picnic Site
description: It appears you can stay at the picnic spot near Evans lookout. Only facilities are toilet and fireplace.  Free.

name: Grey Gum Cafe
description: Free overnight parking on the grass at this cafe in the middle of the forest.  Toilets also showers for $5.

name: McNamara Park
description: Free camping just outside Broke in amongst the trees.  Convenient for local wineries.  Only facilities pit toilets.

name: Banksia Green
description: One of a number of campsites in the Myall Lakes National Park.  Wild beach on one side and lakes on the other.  This campsite was quiet when we visited and just behind the beach. Only facilities are fire places and pit toilets. Cost $8 per adult outside peak times plus $8 per day for the vehicle.

name: Racecourse Headland
description: Lovely camping spot just behind the beach in the National Park.  $11.50 per adult. $6 for children.

name: Tully Memorial Park
description: Ok overnight stop for self contained campers.  Nice grassy area, no facilities. Free.  Entrance is from around the back not from the day use area.

name: Blue Pool And Services
description: Public showers and toilets. Parking area. Oceanside swimming hole. But NO overnight parking. Near town park in center of town there is camping.

name: Lilydale Falls Reserve And Camping
description: Free camp area with toilets and picnic tables. Short hikes to falls. Alongside a stream. There is a kitchen shelter with a fire stove. Many tables. Shade. Very quiet. Perfect for small vans and trailers or tents such as bicycles or motorcycles.

name: Poyungan
description: One of the official "wild camping spots on Fraser Island.  Lovely string just back from the beach.  No facilities.  Normal Queensland park rates apply of $5.60 per adult.

name: Wyuna
description: Camping behind the dunes in one of the official wild camps along the coast of Fraser Island.  No facilities. $5.60 per adult.

name: Eli
description: Another official camp spot just off the beach on Fraser Island.  No facilities. $5.90 per adult.

name: SS Dorrigo
description: Camping just near the beach on one of the many campsites on the Inskip Peninsular.  Choose site carefully as lots of soft sand.  No facilities.  $5.90 per person.

name: 1770 Campground
description: Lovely campground right on the beachfront overlooking the estuary. $44 for 2 adults in a beachfront site.

name: Takarraka Bush resort
description: Camping near Carnarvon Gorge.  Nice campsite in rustic area with good facilities.  Wifi slow and does not always work. $45 for a powered site for 2 adults and 2 children. Lots of kangaroos and wildlife.

name: Isaac River Rest Area
description: Free overnighter place.  Quite noisy from the road.

name: Broken River
description: Campground in Eungella NP near the Platypus viewing platform.  Nice grassy area with fire ring and pit toilets.  Need to book camping permit online in advance as no phone reception. $5.95 per adult.

name: Big Crystal Creek
description: Campground in the Paluma National Park besides a lovely swimming hole.  $5.95 per adult.  You need to get a permit in advance online as their is no reception at the campground.

name: Koala Daintree
description: Lovely camp in the rainforest just set back from the beach.  New owner so slowly been done up.  Pool and other facilities.  Busy at Easter but quiet outside of holidays.  Gorgeous beach a few metres away $35 for powered and $25 for unpowered for 2 adults.  Children an extra $5 each.

name: Archer Point
description: Lovely camping area by the sea with great views.  Can camp down on the beach or on small hills overlooking the ocean.  Landscape has changed from the rainforest and there was a great breeze to cool everything down when we were there.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Mirabee Drive In
description: Cool place to spend the night.  At a drive in just south of Mirabee.  Only open Friday and Saturday this open air drive in lets you stay over after the showing of the 2 movies for the night.  Cost for 2 movies plus "camping" is $14 per adult.  Fast food available.  A must do!

name: Gravel Patch
description: Gravel patch by the side of the road.  Ok for an overnight stop.  No facilities. Close to road so noise from traffic although there is very little of that. Free.

name: Firey Creek
description: Spot next to the creek on a flat bit of ground.  Still close to road but very little traffic. Ok for overnight spot.  No facilities. Free

name: Lawn Hill National Park
description: Campground right next to the gorge.  Lovely park with picturesque gorge, great for canoeing and swimming.  $5.95 per adult.

name: WWII Memorial Rest Area
description: Large rest area next to the main road.  You can get quite a bit of a way back to get away from the road noise.  Toilets and a dump spot. Free

name: Dinner Camp
description: Lovely camp spot on the Georgina River just outside Urandangi.  Must go to the pub in Urandangi.  Really friendly lady running it who cares for orphaned joeys which she will show you.  A real outback experience without any tourists.  No facilities at the camp area.  Free.

name: Tobermorey Station
description: Camping on nice grassy area at a Station just off the Plenty Highway.  Clean toilet and shower block.  Some noise from he generator that ru s but it's the Outback and the only source of power.  Fire pits and free wood. $25 per vehicle.

name: Jervois Station
description: Camping on the station.  Fire pits and wood provided.  Clean toilets and shower a short walk away.  $15 per vehicle.  There is a free camp opposite the entrance about 1km away.

name: Zircon Fossicking Area
description: Camp area about 9kms off the Plenty Highway in area where you can go Fossicking for Opals and Zircons.  Only facilities are fire pits and a dunny.  Free.

name: Sandy Way Rest Area
description: You can get back off the road behind the 24h rest area.  If you climb the dunes you get views of Ulhuru. No facilities.  Lots of flies.  Free. Overnight camping allowed.

name: Parana Hill
description: Tracks lead away from the road to lots of camping opportunities not too far from Kings Canyon. Lots of room for fires, otherwise no facilities. Free.

name: Morris Look Out
description: Look out over the nearby ranges.  No facilities. Free.

name: Ridgetop Camping
description: Camping in the West Macdonall NP with a nice view over the ridges and a short walk from the gorge walk.  Fire pits and pit toilets.  $5 per adult.

name: Finke River Two Mile
description: Plenty of camp spots along the river bank.  Some are sandy so may require 4wd.  No facilities. Free.

name: Neil Hargrave Look Out
description: 24 hour camping permitted at the look out point.  Bins, fire rings and a water tank.  Great views with a nice breeze.  Free.

name: Hugh River
description: Plenty of campsites down by the dry river bed.  Just follow the track in.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Devils Marbles Campground
description: Camp spot right next to the Devils Marbles.  Fire pits and drop toilets.  $3.30 per adult.  Family $7.70. Busy when we were there.

name: Gravel Pit
description: Large gravel area set well back from the road.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Daly Waters Pub
description: An Outback institution.  Camping next to the pub.  Small swimming pool. $18 unpowered for 2 adults.  Kids under 12 free.

name: Merl
description: Campsite in Kakadu NP near Ubirr and Cahills Crossing.  Large campsites in natural setting with fire pits.  $15 per adult plus park entry fee.

name: Malabanjbanjdju campsite
description: Basic campground in Kakadu NP.  Next to nice billa bong.  $6 per adult.

name: Ward River Bridge
description:
Bush camping with plenty of room next to a tree lined river. Turn off at Boat Ramp sign.  No facilities except rubbish bins provided. Dry weather access only. Fires allowed. No cost.

There is a goat farm across river with some dog noise, other than that a very pleasant camping spot.

name: Cooper River, Windorah
description: Bush camping with plenty of room next to a tree lined river. Camping allowed on both side of Copper River..  Toilet near road on East side, also rubbish bins provided. Fires allowed. No cost.

name: Judah Caravan Park - Council Run
description: Council Run site, with plenty of room on the edge of town. Brand new toilet and shower block, also a new outdoor eating area.  Cost powered site $15, unpowered $10, tent site $5. There are pub meals next door.

name: Gungurul
description: Campsite that is effectively a car park with spots off it in the south of Kakadu NP. Adults $5 each plus park fees.  Fire pits and pit toilets.  Not the nicest of the camps in the park but functional.

name: Edith Falls
description: Camping adjacent to the falls with good swimming options.  Busy when we were there.  $12 per adult.

name: Saddle Creek
description: Rest Area set back a bit from the road.  Ok for an overnight. Free.

name: Walardi
description: Campground in the Bungle Bungle NP by a dry river bed.  Basic facilities $13 per adult. 4WD only and no twin axle caravans or trailers. Water crossings ~0.4m in late July.

name: Kurrajong
description: Campsite in the fantastic Bungle Bungle, Purunululu Np.  Nice sites set amongst trees.  $12 per adult.  Need to book online in advance.

name: El Questro
description: Large camping area near the river with swimming.  $20 to camp per adult  plus permit to see all the gorges and fishing holes (another $20 dollars per adult valid for 7 days.  This is for unpowered.  The scenery is spectacular but it was busy when we were there.

name: Home Valley
description: Choice of 2 camping areas.  One near the pool and main building and one down by the river.  Quieter and more relaxed than El Questro. $88 for 2 nights for 2 adults and 2 children.  Third night was free.

name: Ross Creek
description: Nice camping spot about 300m down a track from the Gibb River Road.  No facilities. Free.

name: Manning Gorge
description: Campground next to a swimming hole and a walk from the swimming hole at Manning Gorge.  Pleasant set amongst trees with fire rings.  $22.50 per adult which includes a pass to visit. Cheaper for second and subsequent nights. Potable water at roadhouse

name: Silent Grove
description: National Park campsite a few kms from lovely Bell's Gorge.  $12 per adult plus park entry fees unless you have a pass.

name: Windjana Gorge
description: Camping next to the gorge with pools full of freshwater crocodiles.  No swimming.  Pleasant campground with views of the Devonian Reef.  $12 per adult plus park entry fees.

name: Kooljaman
description: Camping on the tip of the peninsular.  Great views from the unpowered sites.  Lovely bush style resort with great beaches. Not cheap but a long way from anywhere. $45 for 2 adults for unpowered.

name: Cape Keraudren
description: Lovely ocean side camping spot in a nature reserve.  Can choose spots over the rocks for the sunset or down by the beach.  $10  per adult per night plus a $20 one off vehicle entry fee.

name: Dales Overflow Camp
description: Area that is used when Dales camp is full.  Near the visitor centre but not as near the gorges.  Was free when we were there.

name: Karajini Drive Rest Stop
description: Rest stop.  Ok but lots of rubbish around. Free. No facilities.

name: Osprey Bay
description: Camping by the side of the ocean at one of the many National Park campsites in Cape Range National Park with the Ningaloo reef right outside.  $11 per adult plus park entry fees.

name: Quobba
description: Camping on a station by the wild ocean.  Powered or unpowered sites. $15 per adult for unpowered.  Great views and sunsets and supposedly excellent fishing.

name: Eagle Bluff
description: Lovely spots on the top of sand dunes overlooking Shark Bay.  No facilities.  You need to collect a per,it from the Visitor Centre in Denham which coasts $15. Also I think you are limited to just a one night stay.

name: Pademelon Park
description: Free site in the Forrest.  Rain water tank and toilet provided. Plenty of room for groups or larger vehicles. No mobile phone reception.

name: White Rock camping area
description: Forrest camp spot by the side of the track, next to river.  Toilets provided. No mobile phone reception.

name: Bowling Alley Point Reserve
description: $5 donation per night. By the side of a lake.

name: Glen Riddle Recreational Reserve
description: Nice spot by the river. Mobile phone reception.

name: Wells Crossing
description: By the side of a river. Mobile phone reception.

name: Broadwater / Sundown National Park
description: By river with fishing. Mobile phone reception. Park has a few walks. Lots of friends Roo's. Camping fee is $5.95 pp per night; family rates available.

name: New Norcia
description: Camping for self contained vehicles on a nice grassy area at this Benedictine town.  No facilities. $10 per vehicle payable at the visitor centre, roadhouse or hotel.

name: Neil Turner Weir
description: Free camping by the side of a river. Nice 4km walk into town. 3G Mobile phone reception. Very large site, can still get busy.

name: Lake Bindegolly
description: Opposite side of the road to the National Park. Nice camping on sandy ground overlooking lake. Lots of spots along the track for a few km.  Mobile phone reception.

name: Dig Tree
description: Near Innamincka, on Cooper Creck.

name: Wilson River Camp
description: Free camp spot along the river. Flushing toilets, shower etc at the Pub, 300 meters walk. No phone reception.

name: on Cameron Corner Road
description: Bush camp between sand dunes.

name: Wanaaring
description: Free roadside camp. On the eastern side of town, just by the bridge. Road is quiet, nice location by the river. No mobile phone reception.

name: May's Bend
description: Free bush camp, lots of spots along the river. Mobile phone reception.

name: Durack River
description: Camping along Durack River. Pull in opposite the truck stop on the east side of the river, track goes in a few hundred metres and there are a number of camping spots above the river with great views.

name: Pentecost River - East Bank
description: From the east there is a track on the right just before the river crossing, you can drive down for about 10-15km and there are camping spots all the way along the river. Larger vehicles will need to camp closer to the Start as the track gets sandy and a bit rough.

name: Buttons Crossing
description: Driving from Kununarra take the next right after the Black Rock Falls turn off, drive down about 1km to the boat ramp then turn right. Follow the track for about 1.5km, there are camping spots all the way up the river.

name: Burrum Heads Caravan Park
description: $27 for 2 adults at an unpowered campsite per night. Small Grassed site with some trees. Very popular with grey nomads and was almost full. Supermarket and takeaway next door. Good clean facilities. Located right on the river month = awesome sunset!

name: TyreRight
description: Had a nail in our tyre, these guys fixed it straight away for $25. They also Checked our tyre pressures and sprayed the wheels making them look nice and clean! Great service, friendly people.

name: Butterfly Springs
description: Located in the Limmen National Park, Butterfly Springs is one of the only places you can swim safely within the park. The water hole has water most of the year but drys out later in the dry season. Plenty of camping spots in a well laid out area with trees for shade. Each with its own fire pit.

name: 6 Km West Of Dimboola On Dukes Highway
description: Rest area toilets

name: Fort O Hare
description: Plenty of sites on the river beautiful spot to stay a few nights

name: Genoa North Side Of Town Rest Spot On The River
description: Heading south turn right before you enter bridge a few hundred metres before Genoa grass lots lovely with toilets

name: Free Camp
description: Big free camp, no toilets, no showers but not bad

name: Ellendale Pool
description: Campsite at Ellendale Pool. 5 nights maximum stay.

name: Fig Tree Crossing
description:
A campsite run by The Shire Of Chapman Valley. 
there is plenty of shady areas to camp, a toilet, covered picnic tables, dump point l and a designated shower area (BYO water). 
$7 per person per night. Maximum 24hr stay. Pay by honesty box.

name: Hamilton Campground
description: A great campground with tables and drinking water by a small creek. Toilets washing machines and bbqs up the hill. All for a ridiculously low price of $5/car/night

name: Cockle Creek
description: Free camping just before entry to National Park entry at Southern most point of Tasmania. Long drop toilets only. No showers. Water available.

name: Roxy YHA
description:
Hippie Hostel with fantastic view. Accomondation: Camping, dorms,tiiples
+ pool

name: Danny and Hayley's Place
description:
If anyone is travelling by bike and wants a place to set up their tent away from the road and amongst the gumtrees, we have a flat area down from our house. 
Spending a year as iOverlanders in South America ourselves, we love the app and would like to meet ioverlanders travelling through Australia. 

Unfortunately there is no access or parking for cars but with a bicylce or motorbike it should be fine. 

Please text us in advance - 0481211656.

name: Alfred Tongnalini rest area
description: This place it up 870m over See level. Nice 360 view down the mountain. Some fire spots. Super little Telstra service.

name: Black Rocks
description: NSW National Park Campground; behind dunes on the beach. Amazing Black Rocks for 4 km and Jerusalem Creek, for paddling; walking tracks etc

name: Cockle Creek Campground.
description: Open grassed area, toilets, drinking water nearby. Can be busy over holidays.

name: Fingal Roadside Rest Area
description:
Small park in the middle of town with toilets, hot shower (2 dollars), picnic, playground and exercise equipment, covered electric BBQ (20 cents in the slot) and two 15 amp outlets and water taps for the free use of campers. Please share the power though. Motorhomes, campervans, car campers and tenters welcome. Dump point in the carpark. Please keep vehicles on the paved area and leave the lawns for the tents and the powered sites for vehicles that can use them. NO DOGS. Train tracks immediately behind the site, but apart from that, well off the street and nice and quiet. Fast food across the road, internet, coffee shop and supermarket one block east.  Ticks all of the boxes.

DOGS PROHIBITED

name: Moulting Lagoon Game Reserve
description: Primitive campground set between thick bushland and estuary with flat spaces and fireplaces. Strictly no dogs and no collecting firewood (although ranger said that pulling reasonable amounts of dead and down wood out of the bush was not a problem, but toilet paper and fires left burning were) . About 10 sites some with shade. Access in is OK for bigrigs. Few minor branches overhead and narrow winding track in. Entrance off min road is not signposted.

name: Mt Blaxland Camping and Picnic Area
description:
Free established camping area with toilets, bins and firepits. There is some non drinking water available near toilets

Also called Mount York on Google maps

name: Bullocks Freightmasters International
description:
Excellent agent for vehicle transport (RoRo or in containers), AQIS clearance, customs issues.
Works well organised and with system, no chaos like other ones ..

Contact:
Anthony Paratore 
a.paratore@bullocksfi.net.au

Telephone: +61 8 9431 9000
Facsimile: +61 8 9431 9088

Address:
Suite 37, 1st Floor, Fremantle Malls,
27/35 William Street, Fremantle 6160
PO Box 861, Fremantle, Western Australia 6959

name: Car park
description: Just an overnight spot. During the day park at the pier to enjoy the beach, park and shops, then move to this spot after 8pm.

name: Coles Carpark
description: Plenty of day parks at the beach reserves. Then night park back of Coles carpark, behind car wash

name: Princetown Rec Reserve
description: Reserve Campground, $25 power site.  Fairly basic with dirty bore water but very close to 12 Apostles if you want somewhere handy after a sunset photo shoot.

name: Truck Stop rest area
description: Just a roadside rest area, nothing special. Be sure to visit Port Fairy while you are in the area.

name: Portland RV Friendly park
description: Free to stay here for up to 48 hrs.  Dump site too. Self contained campers only.  wifi at info centre on the waterfront.

name: Mt Gambier Showgrounds
description: $15 unpowered, $22 power site.  community vege garden, recycle shop.

name: Narrung free campground
description: Free to stay 72 hours. Adjacent to the free ferry. Grass area, limited shade. Wind sheltered picnic table. Drop toilets. Minimal Phone reception. The walk to the light house is a must-do. Cross the river via free ferry then walk 50m along road then follow track at the sign. It's about 15 mins each way see photo.

name: Simmand's Bay wild camp
description:
Our first wild camp in Australia, sure we put it on here! Don't spoil it by putting it on the other app..
Enough level space for two cars, one big rig or several tents if traveling in one group. Sheltered but visible from the road. Not a lot of traffic and nobody bothered. Water is only 5m away, loads of oysters at low tide.
No facilities. Good Telstra 4g coverage.

name: Wheogo Park, by Lake Forbes, Forbes - NSW
description: Local park, on beautiful lake setting, minutes from downtown, approved for overnight camping. Toilets and bbq facilities as well as sani dump are just 300-400 metres back towards the Newell Highway. Usually at least a few campers here (no tents ). Suitable for big and small rigs.

name: Cape Jervis
description: plenty of parking along the rocky coast. nice and quiet away from the ferry traffic. also another good free spot close by is Lady Bay.

name: Greenock Oval
description: $5 Donation, Picnic Area, Resting Area, Toilet, No Shower, Good Signal

name: Coastal wilderness
description: If you're lucky with the weather, this is a prime spot to check out the coastal wilderness of Western Tassie! Follow the moderate 4wd track from Granville Harbour and you will find several flat, grassy spots along the way. Exposed to the winds, though. No facilities, no phone signal. Sandy, sometimes narrow track, so 4wd only and no big rigs.

name: Robinson motorhome park
description: $8pn, pay at Foodland - very friendly well stocked supermarket.  Level gravel unpowered sites. Water. Public toilets and BBQ across the road. Swimming pool a short walk. Motorhomes only, no caravans or tents. power in parent toilet. wifi at SA Bank

name: Port Augusta motorhome park
description: $7pn. self contained campers only. just a gravel lot.  well away from highway, but across the road from a gun club. Restaurant open  Wed, Thu, Fri only.  Water and dump point.

name: Cowell Motorhome park
description: Free, or donation.  Selfcontained campers only.  Just a gravel park, but nice and quiet. Potable Water available at the sports ground on Brooks Drive

name: Billy Lights Point
description: Motorhome park,$10pn.  Self contained vehicles only.(toilets locked at night)  level sealed carpark next to boat ramp. nice and quiet.

name: September Beach campground
description:
Inside Lincoln National Park, so you need a $11 day pass to enter the park, then a $12 camping permit for the site you want to occupy.  The Port Lincoln Visitor centre can help, or parks.sa.gov.au
Road is sealed to Surfleet Campground, then another bumpy 11km to get to September Beach, but its a  nice spot

name: Yangie Bay Campground
description: $10 day pass required, plus $12 camping permit for the site you occupy. Phone / Data coverage works at the campground to book last minute. Other options may be the Cemetery parking lot in Coffin Bay, or drive 1hr north to Point Drummond free camping area if you are done here.

name: Haslam Rest Area
description: free, no facilities, but level and quiet with farm view.

name: Murphy's Haystacks
description: AUD 2 each to view the haystacks.  Good place to park up for dinner, then try to catch the famous sunset pic

name: Graham Husson Fauna Park
description: Gravel Parking. Next to a wildlife sanctuary. Roo's, Emu and Koalas.

name: Cohen Rest Area
description: Free, large pull out area with lots of trees, no facilities.  Easy option if you cant face the dirt road road to Cactus Beach

name: Rest Area Peg 38
description: Free rest area, we drove right to the cliff for a great scenic spot.  There are plentiful options for overnight stays all along this highway if you are self contained.

name: Jillbunya Rest Area
description: Just another roadside stop, but plenty of room to get away from the highay.  no facilities

name: Norseman Rec Area
description: free campground for self contained vehicles. Green grass whike we were there! makes a change from dst.  water and dump at visitor centre

name: Munglinup Rest Area
description: Large dirt rest area in front of a roadhouse.  Toilets, so popular with tenters.  There was a good gravel rest area 12 min east of here, perhaps quieter.

name: Hopetoun RV friendly park
description: Free for self contained vehicles, grass area next to beach access.  25km from Fitzgerald River Park.

name: Pallinup River Rest Area
description: Good size rest area with trees for shade, lots of spots to park away from the highway.  BBQ, litter bins, no toilets

name: Mt Barker RV friendly carpark
description: Self contained vehicles can park free overnight.  Sealed carpark, no other facilities.  Water and dump at visitor centre.

name: Cosy Corner Campground (East)
description: Individual sites, first come first in.  close to sandy beach. BBQs in day stay area.

name: Northcliffe Cemetery
description: We had the wrong gps for Sids Campground and landed up here.  Very quiet location, level and shady trees.  good for an overnight.

name: Rest Area
description: Just a roadside rest area, level and plenty of trees between the highway and park.

name: Aboretum Campground
description: Simple sites in a forest area.  FCFS, AUD 11 per person per night.

name: Alexandra Bridge Campground
description: $10pp oer night. Seperate individual sites in a treed area, next to a river.

name: Lookout carpark
description: Lookout carpark at the top of a hill, very quiet

name: Cemetery carpark
description: Cemetery carpark, with a stealthy hidy spot in one corner.  great spot to  park after a day at Hamlin Beach

name: Seninis Campground
description: FREE campground in Moondarra State Park. The campground is in the loop of a river deep enough to swim. Very lovely sight, with some coverage. Dry toilets but no access to water. Lots of wildlife (wombats, wallabies, iguanas...). Fairly easy access via a dirt road. Fire pits and possibility to collect wood in the forest. No phone coverage.

name: white beach trailer park
description: clean campsite. very friendly. 30-35 per night. right on the beach.

name: seven mile beach cabin park
description: lots of sites, powered and grass. laundry and camp kitchen for use

name: big4 iluka holiday park
description: nice view. near freycinet national park. clean

name: gowrie park
description: backpackers powered and unpowered sites. cabins. clean and up to date. 28 per night for power

name: Victoria Point Reserve Ferry parking
description:
Parking lot good for an overnight 40 min outside of Brisbane centre. Best for self contained vehicles. 
Quiet, bathrooms nearby.

name: werribee south caravan park
description: clean 32 a night. laundry available. showers good

name: big 4 port fairy
description: part of chain. 41 per night. lots of things for kids.

name: big 4 port elliot
description: chain of campsites. 32 per night. clean. lots of things for kids. not far from ocean

name: nhill caravan park
description: older campground. 30 per night. laundry onsite. clean

name: shady acres caravan park
description: clean older campground. laundry and pool 29 a night

name: Lookout parking
description:
great view on the Cape Leeuwin.
quiet at night, no facilities

name: Lookout Parking
description: Quiet car park at the lookout. No "no camping" sign. no facilities

name: 5 ways caravan park
description: clean older campground. lots of permanent residents. 35 a night

name: san remo caravan park
description: clean small campground. 34 a night. bbw onsite

name: lakes bushland cabin and caravan park
description: clean, family run. pool and tennis court. 40 per night. kookaburras around

name: Capel RV park
description: Capel RV friendly RV park, free for 24 hours.  Tar sealed park next to sports area, trees for shade. self contained vehicles only. water and dump nearby.

name: C Shed Carpark
description: $10 all day parking, but no charge after 8pm.  No overnight restrictions posted and we stayed 2 nights OK.  It is next to a railway line and the port, so a little noisy, but location, location, location!  Rottnest Express ferry leaves from here (a must do!) and easy walk to Fremantle highlights.  Water available at the marina.

name: Yanchep National Park
description: $11 per person, flat level sites. hot showers and easy walk to the National Park attractions.  Lots of kangaroos at dusk!

name: Lancelin gravel pit
description: just a large level dirt area on the side of the road, not too much road noise, we slept well.

name: Nature Reserve
description: 72 Hour free camping permitted here for fully self contained vehicles.  level dirt area surrounded with large shade trees. very quiet.

name: Sandy Cape Rec Reserve
description: A great spot to enjoy sand dunes, beach, swimming and fishing. campground is split into north and south areas. Try to get a spot in south to be close to the beach and dune. No water here so bring plenty.  $20 per night

name: Cliff Head Beach Reserve
description: Camp for a max 72 hours.  Several different areas, lots of space.  South side has quite a few shade trees. $20 per vehicle per night. A few flies around when we visited, you need a mesh hat.

name: eden gateway caravan park
description: top chain has pool laundry etc. clean and well run

name: shady willow holiday park
description: pool. clean older park. walking distance to town and beach

name: southside village
description: large campground near Canberra. noisier than others. lots of cabins

name: Lane Cove River tourist park
description: Pational park with laundry, BBQ. clean lots of sites. During the off peak season $42 a night or if you stayed 7 days it was $273. $39 a night.

name: Green Head Beach
description: Follow the 4wd track starting at 30 7' 14" S 115 0' 48" E down to this beautiful spot with access to the beach. It's behind a dune and sheltered from the wind. Space for several vehicles, but the access track is narrow and a bit rough in places. Telstra signal if you climb the dune.

name: NRMA Myall Shores Holiday Park
description: Caravan park. has laundry bbq etc. new managers. some sites near swamp so mossies

name: Trial Bay Gaol Camping
description: national Park camping. clean and well run. historical ruins nearby. Free park entry. See website for varying seasonal camping fees. Book online. Great views of bay

name: blue dolphin holiday resort
description: private campground in yamba near clarence river. BBQ spots all over. pools and kids playground

name: Binna Burra Lodge in Lamington National Park
description: To locate, follow Binna Burra Rd to the very end. Camping in your vehicle $35 per night. Very close to other campers and no view from the campsite. Electricity and water available. Coin laundry, showers and toilets available. No personal campfires allowed but there are shared fire pits and firewood for sale. Cafe on site with good views from outdoor balcony. Safari tents and tent camping available too - price unknown

name: oxley caravan park
description: older campground in town. busride into Brisbane. 30 per night

name: ingenia holidays noosa
description: part of chain of campgrounds. great for kids. pool, playground games roombusy in peak season. 36 a night in off peak

name: captain cook holiday village
description: chain of parks.  36 per night. BBQ, pool,  beach 800m walk.

name: BarraCrab Caravan Park Clairview
description: private campground on the beach. BBQ playground 37 a night for beachside. 35 for smaller

name: Home Hill caravan park
description: City campground next to the town with a free swimming pool. 30$ per night for powered sites

name: big 4 cairns coconut holiday park
description: chain of holiday parks(campgrounds) lots of things for kids to do. BBQs all over. pool spa mini golf. got special so 26 per night.

name: Geraldton RV friendly park
description: Free overnight parking for self contained vehicles.  dump and water availble.  can get busy and the parks are narrow so you are very close to your neighbour.

name: Coronation Beach
description: beachside camping, pit toilets, no water.  $15 pp pn. per vehicle

name: Galena Overnight campground
description: Free 24hr camping.  Large area next to the Murchison River.  Picnic tables, toilets, dump station.

name: Hamelin Pool Caravan Park
description: A small low cost ($11pp) campground not to be missed. Walk to the Stromatilies, sunset views.  Swimming pool and shade areas.  Rustic farm atmosphere. There is a small store and food available. Makes a good starting place before heading to the expensive campgrounds at Denham.

name: Whalebone Bay
description: Beachside parking area 1km from highway.  No water, no toilets, no rubbish.  You need to get a 24hr camping permit from the Denham visitor centre during office hours $15.  If there is phone coverage you can call 08 9948 1218. You can only book on the day of stay and only stay 1 day - no renewal.

name: Quobba Blowholes
description: $11 pp pn, self contained vehicles only.  1km south of the blowholes, overlooking a calm beach with excellent snorkelling right off the beach.

name: Lyndon River Rest Area
description: Free, just a piece of flat dirt with BBQ tables, pit toilets and a dump station, but only a 1 hour drive to Coral Bay.

name: Tulki Campground, Cape Range NP
description: $11 pp pn. Small 11 site campground 5km north of Torquiose Bay.  Pit toilet, no shade, no other facilites.  Dump site at NP visitor centre.  Closest water is Exmouth visitor centre. You MUST book online before arriving for any of the campgrounds in this park https://parks.dpaw.wa.gov.au/park-stay  If you dont book, and want to spend more than 1 day here, and are staying outside the park, you will need to pay daily entry fees $12 each day, or get an annual pass.

name: Beasely River Rest Area
description: Free 24 hr parking. Very nice sealed car park with trees, well off the main highway.

name: Eco Retreat Campground
description: $20 pp pn, expensive for a bit of dirt, no power or water. Solar showers.

name: Hamersley Gorge Campsite
description: If you are silly enough to drive the rough dusty highway to Hamersley Gorge National park, this place is excellent to stay the night before facing the horror drive back.  Very large level area with rubbish bin. free to stay, and outside the national park, so no ranger issues.

name: Port Hedland Turf Club
description: Free 72 hour camping for self contained vehicles.  Dump and water nearby.

name: Stanley Rest Area
description: Free 24hr camping, good distance from highway, grass areas, picnic tables,

name: Cotton Tree Holiday Park
description: Magnificent council run park right at the beachfront. Close to all shops and amenities. Costs are about $46 per night. Cheaper if you book per week.

name: Rest Area
description: Rest Area, 24hr free camping.  plenty of flat space, picnic tables and shelters.

name: Boab Rest Area
description: free 24hr camping for self contained vehicles.  Huge Boab tree in the centre.  Picnic tables and shelter

name: Ngumban Cliff Rest Area
description: free 24hr camping.  picnic tables and shelters. great sunsets.

name: Marys Pool Rest Area
description: Free 24hr camping. shade trees next to a muddy water hole, can be crocs.  Picnic tables.  Easy 1km sealed access road from highway, very quiet. Very big terrain with a number of shady places. Away from the highway. Long drop toilets, not sheltered picnic benches. Sanitation dump station. We saw a sign that the Yiyili Community Store (10 km southwest near the road) sells food and diesel.

name: Kinkuna Beach Camping
description: An absolutely beautiful camping area in the National Park. No formal campsites, just choose a spot. Absolute sea front available. No amenities, nothing. Take in what you need and take out all rubbish.

name: Lakeside Resort Caravan Park
description: $35 pn unpowered. good swimming pool and bar / bistro. Ask for an Amazing North tourist book and get 10% off.  Bar has $1 off beer and wine happy hour.

name: Lake Argile Resort
description: Campground fees for resort facilities.  $44 powersite, $39 for CMCA members.  Concierge greets you on arrival and allocates a site.  After you pay they escort you to your site and explain amenities.  You feel like a VIP.  Good bar and bistro.  Great lake views, and several trails.  Infinity pool is excellent. You can book cruises on the lake from reception. Sunset Cruise is very popular, you may need to book before arrival.  Other cruises are available at neighbouring cruise business.

name: Limestone Creek Rest Area
description: Rest area with flat terrain and a reasonable number of trees. Sanitation dump station, picnic tables (most not covered), toilet, water, barbecues.

name: Bush camp near Edith Falls
description: Old sealed road from highway towards river. We parked up before the river but other campers ventured past us.

name: Edith Falls Rd
description: Large flat area next to highway.  Good access for large vehicles

name: Adelaide River Showgrounds
description: Fairly tired campground, but good value at $27 powered, $15 unpowered.  If you have a small rig there is free camping at Robin Falls, 8km down Docat Rd.

name: King River Rest Area
description: Free 24 hr camping, Nice large flat area, some trees for shade.

name: Warloch Rest Area
description: Free 24hr camping, picnic table, shelter, toilet, dump.

name: Frewena Rest Area
description: Road side rest stop.  There is a track at the back of the rest area to get a good distance from the highway.

name: Rest Area
description: Free 48hr camping for self contained vehicles.  Away from main highway.  plenty of space, some trees for shade

name: grass parking
description: a bit of grass to park and stay the night in a quiet area, as camping at the beach parking lots in Lancelin is forbidden.

name: Leeman's landing beachside parking
description: Spent the night several times here. I am always alone when the fishermen leave after the sun sets. Next to the beach, drinking water, toilet and bbq available. Great place!

name: Beach parking
description: Spent the night on multiple occasions here when we are on our way down south. Public toilets and water available. Wake up next to the beach and have breakfast there! During the week the school bus comes to pick up the kids in the morning.

name: Hair of dog inn
description: Pub with on site camping/caravan/overland space out the back. Hot showers and clean toilets. Buy a meal and camping is free! Very lovely owners

name: Wilpena Pound Resort & Campground
description: Full-featured campground with all amenities situated at the entrance to the picturesque Wilpena Pound (Ikara) geological formation. There is fuel and a general store, and a visitors center to arrange a variety of activities. There are powered and unpowered campsites, as well as rooms and glamping tents for hire.

name: Scenic look out beach camp
description: Off road track goes down south tucked away from look out point. Right near the beach. No signs say you cannot camp here. We havent had any rangers passing by. Nice free spot no facilities.

name: Croydon Rodeo Campground
description: $5 donation for max 2 night stay, purchase permit from the visitor centre. grass area with some trees for shade if you are quick.

name: Gravel pit
description: Large flat gravel pit area below highway.  Fairly quiet.  Pit toilets across the road.

name: Rifle Creek Rest Area
description: 48hr camping allowed.  $2 donation.  Very popular so arrive before 3pm for a good spot.  Grass and shade trees.  Telstra 3G coverage

name: Cooktown Racecourse
description: Donation.  Selfcontained campers only.  Level grassed sites with trees.  Water and dump available in the town

name: Ringers Rest RV park
description: $10 pv pn.  Lots of space on a large paddock. Maybe share with the odd friendly horse, and if you are lucky Hot Air Ballons may land here.  selfcontained vehicles only.  Good mobile and TV reception.

name: Tully Showgrounds
description: free 48hr parking for self contained vehicles.  Basic parking, but place to explore the surrounding area.  You need to get a permit from the visitor centre.  While you are there try to get on a Sugar Mill tour.

name: Cardabia bay camp
description:
ADMIN NOTE: a user reported on 2019-10-06: Wild camping is not allowed around Coral Bay 
---
No sign that you cant camp here. The place is on a 4wd track and looks amazing. No visit from the rangers. This is a sanctuary zone so no fires and no fishing. No facilities but a lot of wild life good for snorkelling.

name: Bush camp next to the beach
description: Large flat area next to the beach. No rangers no sign. You are allowed to fish on the beach here. No facilities, no telstra signal, beautiful nature. 4wd or adventure bike needed.

name: coober pedy wild camp option
description: rest area permits trucks only. a bit down the gravel road there are wide shoulders that can be used for any type of vehicle.

name: Karijini bush camp
description: There are several spot on the side of hamerey-mt bruce road. This is one of the better ones. Its a big open area hidden behind some trees. Its a 5min drive from mt bruce. Rangers dont come looking for you cause its not the National park.

name: Florence falls 4WD campsite
description: Campsite near Florence falls. 2WD campsite nearby but you could come here in a 2WD. This campsite is quieter but both fill up early on the weekend. $6.60 per person. Nice sites but no grass. Unpowered, no water. Solar showers but still cold but that's ok in this weather! Fire pits at each site but very close to your tent. Can walk to the falls

name: AAOK lakes resort and caravan park
description: Caravan park with powered and unpowered sites. Nice amenities, hot showers, potable water and lovely owners who squeezed us in late at night. Restaurant on site. Let us fill up our water tank even though we were on an unpowered site. $25 for two people

name: Kakadu Lodge
description: Caravan park in Jabiru, small town in Kakadu where you can stock up. $32 per night 2 people unpowered however much nicer amenities than the campsites in Kakadu which cost $30 for 2 people. Hot showers, clean amenities, very big and busy though

name: Mardugal Campground
description: Campground near Cooinda. Overpriced as are all the campsites in Kakadu, $30 for 2 people unpowered. Warm solar showers, clean amenities. Many mosquitos and bugs at the river is close. Good place to stop if you are doing the sunrise boat tour the next morning which I highly recommend even though it's expensive ($99p with buffet breakfast)

name: Florence falls 2WD campsite
description: Larger campsite next to 4WD campsite. Both accessible with 2WD, didn't stay here but very similar on a drive around

name: Shady lane tourist park
description:
Very clean and nice caravan park. They don't advertise.
 Unpowered but $32 for 2 people and far better than the one for $25 down the road, Definitely worth the extra cash

name: Yamaha
description: Cleared area 80m off the highway. Some road noise of course but good enough for an overnight on the road.

name: Bush camp just outside millstream NP
description: Bush camp just outside millstream National park. There is a spot that is a bit tucked away. Its right next to the railway but it sure beats the rest areas next to the road. No cellular service.

name: George campsite
description: Free epic campsite! Its not easy to get to but it sure is worth it! 1hour of 4wding and you get to a large area with many different spots. We went in dry season and all the crossings were dry.

name: Slip rock rest area
description: Free rest area next to the road. Lots of space hidden from the road. 40ish km out of port hedland.

name: Cleo Walton Park
description: Lovely camping around the dam. Lots of trees and flat areas.

name: Lake Francis west of Camoweal.
description: Lovely camping also NG the banks of the lake. Few kms west of Camoweal where you can purchase all your necessities. Lake has a multitude of bird life. Bins as you turn off the highway so please take all your rubbish with you.

name: Banka Banka Station.
description: Camping in the grounds of a working cattle station. Large grounds but cramped as very popular. Walks and country entertainment on offer. Busy happy hour.

name: Alan Keller Rest Area
description: Roadside rest area with water and toilets

name: Palm Springs
description: Palm Springs is an informal, free camp site next to a natural warm spring. Small camping area, fits about 5 campers alongside the road. Can be dusty as road trains use the road to access the cattle stations. 24 Hour limit but on staying here.

name: Wolfe Creek Crater Camping
description: This is an informal free camp site at the site of the Wolfe Creek meteorite crater, within the Wolfe Creek reserve.

name: Canning Stock Route - Stretch Lagoon
description: Overnight stop on the Canning Stock Route. Lovely large stretch of water, lots of trees. Water is discoloured but swimmable. No cost to stay here either.

name: Canning Stock Route - Well 50
description: Camping area around Well 50. Trees and lots of open areas for camping. Well 50 has collapsed and is almost completely disappeared.

name: Canning Stock Route - Well 45
description: Camping on theCanning Stock Route at Well 45. Nothing left of the Well as it has completely collapsed into itself. Lots of share and some open spots. Can probably hold about 6 camper's.

name: Canning Stock Route - Well 43
description: Camping on the Canning Stock Route near Well 43. Nice open spaces with some low trees providing shade. Many camp spots scattered around, all just off the track. Well 43 is almost completely covered over with just some relics left.

name: Canning Stock Route  -  Well 35.
description: Roadside camping along the route. Not much shade but some magnificent rock holes in the gully.

name: Canning Stock Route - Well 33
description: Lovely spot just outside Kuramanitji at Well 33. Tons of really great water and amazing bird life. Windmill does all the hard work and there is a tap on the side of the tank. Not a huge amount of shade but lots of open spaces. About 7kms out of town.

name: Canning Stock Route - Georgia Bore
description: Camping spot on the Canning Stock Route at the intersection of the  western edge of the Talawana track. Lots of lovely clean water and a long drop toilet. Lots of camping spots and plentytrees.

name: Canning Stock Route - Well 14
description: Camping next to Well 14. No facilities but plenty of space with some shade. Very close to main track but no traffic.

name: Canning Stock Route - Well 6
description:
This campsite is alongside the CSR and isgor the benefit of those travelling this most lonely route. Camping is amongst huge ghost gums with lots of open space. 
There is no cost to camp here.

name: Roadside camping outside Cue.
description: Open ground on the North side of the road when travelling from Cue to Geraldton. Lots of open camping sites, firewood and some shade. The further you drive from the road the better it gets. Very little road noise. Free.

name: Canna - Church Ground
description:
Lovely open ground next to the church and behind the old school. No real shade as it is the car park (I think) Lovely walks (wildflowers) from here.
Hot showers, power and toilets make for a lovely stay.
Donations of $10per night suggested.

name: Sheba Dam
description:
A beautiful free campground on the banks of Sheba Dam, surrounded by natural bush in the hills above Nundle.

Just east from Hanging Rock, Sheba Dams (No 1 and 2) were built by hand in 1888 to store water for sluicing gold. Now they are just a pretty spot to picnic, camp, and fish for trout.

The campground at Sheba Dams is widely dispersed through natural bush, and the sites are mainly grassy, with plenty of shade from the large gum trees. Be careful when setting up camp, especially if it is windy, as large branches can easily squish you if they land on your tent.

Well maintained long drop toilets are located near the entrance to picnic/camping area, and a large sheltered area with picnic tables is also provided.

Number of sites:
30

Camping Fees:
This is a great free campground, please say thanks by leaving the place in good condition and shopping locally.

This is a free camping area.

How to book:
No bookings are required. It is reasonably popular in the warmer months, but due to the high altitude (read freezing) is mostly deserted in Winter.

Toilets:
Longdrop or composting

Pets:
Not allowed

Water Availability:
Non-potable water may be available. Boil all water for at least 10 minutes before drinking.

Camp fires:
Fires may be allowed in built fire places. Please check local fire bans and rules.

Barbeques:
Wood barbeques are available. Bring firewood and check firebans.

Swimming:
You are able to swim in the lake nearby.

Fishing:
There are fishing spots at or near this campsite.

Picnic Tables:
Yes.

Horse Riding:
No

Canoeing / Kayaking:
There are canoeing and kayaking spots at or near this campsite

name: Katerina - next to the river
description:
This lovely campsite is on the banks of the Avon river. It lies between the road and the river and has lots of campsites with tons of shady trees. Campsites are spread out alongside the river with lots of space between.
This free campsite is provided and serviced by the shire of Toodyay so please support their towns by shopping locally.

name: Zebra rock mine, gallery and campsite
description: Unpowered campsite with cold/warm showers in the afternoon. Clean amenities but really need an update. $10 per person, unpowered. No powered sites. Restaurant on site but pricy and basic. Sunset boat tour $130pp, didn't do but gets good revised. Good vibe with campfire, music and bar. 10km of dirt road to get there, ok for 2WD.

name: Bungle Bungles Caravan Park
description: Caravan park at the start of the 52km dirt road into the national park. Clean facilities, communal fire, BBQs, hot showers. $30 for 2 people unpowered which is much better value than inside the park which is $26 for pit toilets as only facility. Recommend using this on the way in/out instead of an extra night in the park for the extra $4

name: Kimberlyland Waterfront Holiday Park
description: Great park. Let us send a package here in advance if we booked a night (open booking so didn't need a date). They also let you wash your car (and let us stay past checkout to do so)! Very lovely staff, pool, coffee shop on site with excellent coffee, mosquitos as it's by the water. Comprehensive and clean facilities, laundry etc. Expensive $40 for 2 people unpowered weekends, $35 weekdays but very worth it if you need the services as we did

name: Adcock River
description: Free camping just after the second crossing on the left when driving west. Lots of space, clean, shady, barely any bugs considering by the river.

name: Peaceful Bay beach camp
description:
Need the 4WD to get here as couple of hairy parts on the 4km sandy track you need to take from the town to get here.
Lovely 'peaceful' spot above the rocks and the beach.  Was some guys fishing nearby when we arrived but all quiet after 8pm.

name: Denmark Rivermouth Caravan Park
description:
Right on the water this is a well kept camp ground.  Plenty of space for all vehicle sizes with water and power at sites.  Good toilet and shower facilities, playground, TV and BBQ areas.  Many trees for shade as is needed in the WA summer.  Also has boat rentals and a little shop.

Fishing in the inlet is possible and its also right on the Bibbulmun track

We stayed over new years and the place was completely full, but now overcrowded

name: Emu Point Big 4 Caravan Park
description:
Arrived in holiday period and got one of last overflow spots.  Fully grassed campsites or hardstands for big rigs.  Very well kept camp ground with all amenities needed as well as kids clubs in the holidays.  Its not cheap but then again none are in WA
Very good showers and toilet facilities, BBQs, laundry as well as playground.  Short walk in a number of directions to the beaches.

name: Moody Cow Brewery
description:
A great brew-pub to break up any drive along the base of the Darling range.  Exceptional burgers were had while overlooking the expansive grassed area from the outside deck.  Their local brews aren't too bad either.

It gets quite busy on weekend lunchtimes as the city folk make a trip out of the city to visit

name: Bluewater Park Rest Area
description: Site allows for 48 hours stay. There is water at each space, toilets, parks, play equipment, and benches. I didnt see any cooking facilities or showers.

name: Balgal Beach Camp Area
description: RV-friendly town. Free Campsite right on beachfront. There are toilets, cold showers, picnic area, bbq, and a pub/restaurant (closed). must book on Townsville council website. free

name: Wangetti Rest area
description: Parking spot next to the beach. Can stay overnight. No amenities (other than bins).

name: Karinyup Waters Resort
description:
Tucked away in a quiet suburb in north Perth is this gem of a caravan park.  It's easy to get to from the Freeway or Mamion Ave.  Great and well kept facilities, including large pool area.  
There are not a lot of Caravan Parks (Camp Grounds) left in Perth so suggest call ahead in busy periods. (08) 9447 6665

name: Lancelin Caravan Park
description:
Beachside caravan park.  It's a bit dated but its not expensive and facilities are still decent.
Lancelin, or 'Lano' as typical Aussie nicknames come, is a bit of a sleepy little fishing town, but is good for windsurfing (so by that it gets pretty breezy up there).  You're still far enough away,  but not too far, from the sprawling suburbs of the city these days either.

name: Daintree Riverview Lodges & Van Park
description: Great little camp ground. Unpowered was $12pp. Has kitchen, laundry, power, water, toilets, hot showers, TV, museum. Right on the Daintree river. Across the road from pub, restaurants, shops and info desk. Peter was very welcoming upon arrival. Power sites and lodges are available.

name: Guilderton Caravan Park
description:
Right on the river mouth and close to the beach this is  good size Caravan park.  Decent facilities as well.  Shops nearby as well as things like boat rental.  Gets busy over summer.

Camped here a number of times as kids many moons ago and good that the laid back vibe of the place has hardly changed

name: Swamp Creek Camp & Rest Area
description:
Swamp Creek Reserve is a small reserve right alongside the Peel River; the reserve is broken into two by Swamp Creek and is connected by a bridge on the road and a small walking bridge right beside the road. The side the Toilet is on is best recommended for big Rigs as there is a bigger turning circle area; the opposite side is suitable for Caravans and tents.

Because of the junction of the Peel River and Swamp Creek the water levels have been seen to rise quickly and the Tamworth Regional Council has advised of flash flooding in the area.

The area is well known for gold and gemstone fossicking and plenty of time can be spent in the water way panning for Gold. The local town of Nundle offers plenty of tourist attractions. The Woolen mill is a must for Australian Grown and Made Woolen products from yarn to clothing. The socks are even made right here at Nundle and a tour of the woolen mills is very informative.

SITE ACCESS
If leaving from Tamworth travel towards Nundle. The reserve can be accessed from either end of Rivers Road. The road is gravel, if coming from Nundle the distance is 2Km.

FEES & BOOKINGS
There is no charge for the use of this facility at the moment, so if you are staying at this site we encourage you to help keep it clean, and please visit and support the nearest town or village.

THINGS TO DO
