At Warrabah National Park, near Tamworth and Uralla, you can enjoy camping, bushwalking, fishing, swimming, canoeing, wildlife photography, and birdwatching by Namoi River.

One of the few inland river parks in NSW, beautiful Warrabah National Park, just east of Manilla and north of Tamworth, has an incredibly tranquil atmosphere thanks in large part to the spectacular Namoi River. The park is bisected by over 14km of the river in a dramatic gorge. Massive granite boulders perch high above the valleys deep, calm pools and the swelling river rapids offer the promise of exciting adventures for intrepid canoeists.
Naturally, most visitors to the park base their exploration of the park around. The parks sense of peaceful solitude makes it a wonderful spot for long, relaxed bushwalks, birdwatching, nature photography, and self-reliant camping and hiking.
Theres plenty of space in which to camp and picnic and lots to explore, from the grassy flats beside the river to the towering ridgelines that rise high above it. Youll find campsites nestled in the bush and a well laid out space designed specifically for scenic picnics by the river, complete with all the conveniences you'd expect.

name: Halls Gap General Store
description: The only supermarket in the area. Stocking is OK but not great, prices are extremely high. Licquor Store as well.

name: Langi Ghiran Campground
description: Large plain surrounded by mostly gum trees and some other, safer shady trees in the Langi Ghiran State Park. Multiple toilets and picnic tables, but no other facilities. A poorly maintained walking trail for different walks leaves from the campground. Free of charge. Patchy Telstra reception.

name: Bunjil's Shelter
description: Aboriginal rock art. According to LP one of the most important Aboriginal sites, but we felt the rock art was disappointing compared to Aboriginal places we visited in Central Australia: three clear animals and a set of very vague symbols.

name: Eureka Stockade Holiday Park
description: Holiday park with many cabins and a few camping sites. Powered sites only, which makes it expensive. Toilets and showers old but clean, very well equipped kitchen, washing machines. Next to Eureka swimming pool complex. We got a small, but shady site. AUD 37 (2 adults, campervan).

name: Corrimal Beach Tourist Park
description:
Camping and caravaning place, 23$ the night.
Good wifi.
Hot shower.
Equipped kitchen
Playground for kids
One of the less expensive on this aera
It's forbidden to camp on every beaches or parks.

name: Riverfront Caravan Park
description:
Big caravan park and camping along the river.
Access to the river to swim.
Shower for 1$
No wifi.
20$ negociable to 15$ with a bicycle.

name: Endrick River Crossing
description:
One of the legal wild camping in this area located along the river.
Many places to camp, park cars or big rigs.
Take to the left 200m before the bridge, on east side.
Pick up all your trash of all sorts.
Defecate more than 50m of the river, in a hole please.

name: Pebbly Beach Campground
description:
Pebbly Beach campground sits by a small bay north of Station Creek Beach. Getting to this remote campground is as much an adventure as staying there  youll need to drive along the beach and cross a saltwater estuary at low tide.
Once youre there, the fun really begins. Settle into a spacious campsite, just metres from the she-oak lined shore, then start exploring. Youll find great walking tracks in the area, and the nearby headlands are excellent for whale watching.

Number of campsites - 60

Camping type - Tent, Camper trailer site, Caravan site, Camping beside my vehicle
Facilities - Toilets

Please note-

This campground is not suitable for large caravans. You can bring small caravans and trailers if towed by high clearance 4WDs.

Free firewood is available at the Station Creek turnoff.

Price-

$12 per adult per night.
$6 per child per night. Child rates apply for children aged 5-15 years only. Children under 5 years are free of charge.

Please note that during NSW & QLD school holidays and long weekends a minimum camping fee of $24 per site per night applies.

Entry fees
Vehicle entry fees are not included in your accommodation or camping fees.

Bookings-
Bookings are not available. 
The campground operates on a first in-first served basis so its a good idea to arrive early in the day, particularly during summer.

name: Bunjils Lookout
description: 48 hours camping allowed at the Bunjils Lookout on a hilltop overlooking the area and with a monument devoted to the Banjils Aboriginal Tribe. Toilets, picnic benches, electric BBQ, children's playground, tank water; everything well maintained. Very windy when we visited even though we didn't on the top of the hill. Free of charge.

name: Barwon Heads Caravan Park
description: Very large campground next to the Barwon River and very close to the sea. Walks with beautiful viewpoints nearby. Well maintained amenities. Washing machines, dish washing facilities, barbecues. Most sites surrounded by bushes with little shade. Free wifi, but 100 MB per day only. Showers limited to 5 minutes (with 5 minutes waiting for the next cycle). Sanitation Dump Station. Walking distance from the village with IGA supermarket. AUD 32 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Good Telstra 4G.

name: Point Leo Foreshore & Reserve
description: Unpowered sites directly on the beach; beautiful! Reserve run by volunteers. Well maintained. Washing machines. AUD 40 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Good Telstra 4G.

name: Ace Hi Ranch
description: Mainly for school camps. Only available for individual campers during school holidays and weekends. Only powered sites. AUD 40 (2 adults, camper).

name: Flinders General Store
description: Product range of a supermarket, but more delicatessen type. Interesting but expensive. Good range of freshly baked bread.

name: Melbourne BIG4 Holiday Park
description: Campground with reasonable access to the city by public transport. Small sites, few with shade. Swimming pool, sanitation dump station, TV room, play room, fitness, well equipped kitchen. Wifi 500 MB per day, but it is so slow that you never will reach that limit. Good Telstra 4G. Expensive: AUD 48 for a small, unpowerd site (+ AUD 0.36 credit card uplift).

name: Orroral Campground
description:
Camping in the national park
Toilets
Tank of rain's water
Big roof with tables
A lot of space to park cars or put tents
Small river in border of the space
Many treking paths 
Charge to spend the night if a guard is there

name: Queen Victoria Market
description: The biggest market we have seen in Australia. The front part in the original building has luxury stands with fish and meat for prices that exceed supermarket prices. Behind it is a big semi open air market with vegetables, clothing, and many, many other items for prices that are definitely lower than in the supermarket.

name: Discovery Parks Melbourne
description: The park belongs to the TOP Park camping chain and is the most expensive campground we visited in Australia. We chose it because of its proximity to the departure port of the ferry to Tasmania. Sites are small with some shade. Amenities are well maintained and the kitchen is good. There are a swimming pool, sanitation dump stations, washing machines a TV room and barbecues. Public transport to the city centre takes about a  hour. Next door is a Woolworth. Powered sites only. We paid AUD 65 for one night (2 adults, campervan). Good Telstra reception.

name: Forth Recreation Ground
description: Space nominated as campground by the Forth community. Large grassy field with toilets and barbecue next to river, no other provisions. Excellent first stop after arrival from mainland Australia. Camping vehicles arrive in line here leaving the Spirit of Tasmania. Free. Good Telstra coverage.

name: Lower Liffey Campground
description: Large, grassy terrain surrounded by high trees. Flush toilet, picnic tables and barbecue places, no other amenities. Use of the barbecues was prohibited until further notice after the big bush fires. Walk to the Liffey Falls 3 hours return. Free of charge. No Telstra reception.

name: Swansea Beach Chalets
description: The campground has mainly chalets, only some 15 camping sites. The campsites are next to the beach with a superb view over the bay: deep blue water with mountains in the background and small islands with cormorants in the foreground. It can be windy. Good amenities, barbecues, swimming pool, washing machines, dish washing facilities. AUD 35 (2 adults, campervan, no power). Good Telstra reception.

name: Namboida River Campground
description:
Go 4WD touring into the heart of Nymboidas wild beauty at Nymboida River campground and canoe, swim, and bushwalk to your hearts content.

Accommodation Details:
Number of campsites: 20
Camping type: Tent, Camper trailer site, Camping beside my vehicle
Facilities: Picnic tables, barbecue facilities, toilets

Please note:

Sites are unmarked and unpowered

This campground is suitable for groups

Camp in the main campground away from the river as heavy rain upstream on the Dorrigo Plateau can cause flash flooding

This is a remote campground, so please make sure you arrive well-prepared.

Price: Free.
Bookings: Bookings are not available for this campground.

If camping in remote, unspoilt beauty surrounded by dramatic landforms while neighbouring the beautiful Nymboida River appeals, point your 4WD towards Nymboida River campground. Push your canoe out into the river, or take a summer dip while listening for the distinctive chink of the bellbirds. There are no marked tracks, but experienced bushwalkers will love the wild beauty of Nymboida. This is a quiet campground and you may well have the place to yourself.

Even getting theres an adventure. Old Glen Innes-Grafton Road passes through a historic hand-cut tunnel into the stillness of the deserted valley. Cast your imagination into the past and you may hear the snap of the reins on the Cobb & Co. coach team, the thud of the timber getters axe, or the cry of the bullocky hauling down the track to Clarence River.

name: Lime Bay Campground
description: Large campground with shady trees in a National Park. Beautiful bay, especially at low tide. Flush toilet, no other facilities. Fee AUD 13 (2 adults, campervan) payable at a honesty box. Park fee must be paid in addition. Good Telstra 4G reception.

name: Morris' IGA
description: Reasonably well stocked but extremely expensive supermarket. Costs of fruits and vegetables are almost double the Coles prices.

name: Fortesque Bay Campground (Banksia & Mill Creek)
description: The campground consists of 2 areas. The first area, Banksia Campground, is near the ranger's office and mainly for tents, although we saw a few cars and caravans. Here are the showers. The second area, Mill Creek Campground is a few hundred meter further down the road and is used by vans, caravans and tents. Mill Creek has large numbered sites near the bay under high trees. The first few sites have bay view. Booking highly recommended. Payment for both campsites at the ranger's office until 16:00, self service kiosk if you arrive later. The ranger sells coins for 4 minute hot showers. Fee AUD 13 (2 adults, campervan), showers AUD 2. Some Telstra reception near the ranger's office.

name: Phil's Place
description: Private yard with about 6 shady sites close together. Toilet and water only. Some view over the bay, but surrounded by industry. On weekdays noise from the surrounding industry and highways from early in the morning onward. The place is located at 295 Main Rd, Austins Ferry. From the main road it is a rather steep path leading to a gate. You have to call ahead to get the access code for the gate. Phone numbers: +61 4 0812 6770, +61 4 1732 4173. Bus from the main road directly into town. Fee AUD 15 (2 adults, campervan). Not friendly: for 4 adults and 2 vehicles we had to pay the double price although we occupied one site only. Good Telstra reception.

name: Port Arthur General Store
description: Store with a small range of vegetables and bread. The Port Arthur Centre store at the opposite side of the road has a similar product range.

name: General Store
description: This general store doesn't have any groceries.

name: Picnic Place
description: Taps with free drinking water available at this place.

name: Mount Wellington
description: Parking lot at the pinnacle of Wellington Park. Toilet open between 7:00 and 22:00 according to the signs, but open all night when we visited. Not designated as campground, but no "No camping" signs either. Great view over Hobart and the peninsulas. Free.

name: Land of the Giants Caravan Park
description: Beautiful campground in the Mt. Field National Park that has all amenities of a commercial campground. About 60 sites under high trees next to the river. Different walks starting at the Tourist Information next to the campground. Sites are numbered, but not assigned. Washing machines, barbecues, dish washing facilities, treated water. Fee AUD 16 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Payment can be done at the Tourist Information during opening hours and via a honesty box otherwise. Park fee must be paid. Good Telstra reception.

name: Lake Burbury Boat Ramp Camping
description: Large green lawn next to the boat ramp to Lake Burbury. The lake itself is not visible from the camping area. Little shadow. Toilets (a bit of a walk away) and barbecue, no other amenities. Mediocre maintenance. Fee AUD 6 per vehicle. No Telstra reception.

name: FUEL
description: No more fuel stations on this road until Queenstown.

name: Grace Nicolas Apex Park
description: Picnic place with shelters and a drinking water tap.

name: The Springs
description: The overflow parking lot is not directly visible. Toilet (24/7) and shelter available. May be busy at daytime on beautiful days. No shade. Free.

name: VDL Track - Vale Belvoir
description: Path with about 5 sites suitable to camp next to it. Open grass land around. Sign that camping is permitted, but offroad driving is not. No amenities, free. Reasonable Telstra reception.

name: DBL Mechanical
description: Professional workshop specialized in Toyota. We came here to have our leaking gearbox checked. Due to lack of time we decided for a temporal solution. We were served straight away quickly and professionally. We would definitely go here for larger jobs as well.

name: Blue Wren Park
description: Large lawn with trees around, beach across the road and the railway track. Penguins supposed to be in the nature reserve almost opposite the campground, but we didn't see them. Restaurant open 10:00-16:00. AUD 12 per night (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Only 3 powered sites.

name: Port Albert
description: Free parking lot camping with dump station. Good for 24 hours. 4G full bars cell signal.

name: Spirit of Tasmania
description: Smooth check-in with a quick quarantine inspection: under the hood and the cooking gas bottle location. Fruits and vegetables were not asked for. Vessel departed 45 minutes late. We drove into Melbourne 90 minutes after the scheduled arrival time. 2-person cabin with shower and toilet was comfortable.

name: Blackwood Mineral Springs Holiday Park
description: Campground with mainly permanent places surrounded by high trees. Amenities aged but functioning and reasonably clean. Next to mineral springs. Washing machines and dish washing facilities. AUD 25 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Good Telstra reception.

name: Lederderg Campground
description: Various sites to camp around a loop through the forest. At the place marked are new toilets. It is a gravel area surrounded by high trees. No water. Free. No Telstra reception.

name: Glenlyon Recreation Reserve
description: Nice recreation reserve with a large, flat grassy field where camping is allowed. Clean flush toilet, drinking water, picnic benches, no other amenities. Lots of kangaroos in the area. The adjacent field is used for horses that leave their poo also on the camping field; so you have to select your site carefully. Free of charge.

name: Clunes Caravan Park
description:
Caravan Park next to the village centre with mainly permanent caravans. Dated, functioning ablutions, low capacity when the campground is full. Slow wifi, 100 MB/24 hours max. During weekends noise from the next street beer garden and every night unpleasant noise from some permanent caravans. AUD 30 (2 adults, campervan, power). Poor Telstra reception.

I was very unhappy about the way personal property of guests was treated. I left my (expensive) glasses for 10 minutes in the bathroom after showering. The team that was cleaning amenities (at 8 am in the morning, very practical time) had already thrown them away. The glasses barely could be rescued from the bottom of a garbage bag.

name: Picnic Point Campground
description: Dirt road approach. I was trimming trees in my 3.4m clearance rental Sprinter Camper but made it. Sign says $12 adults and $6 kids but nowhere to pay and nobody collected. Beautiful beaches and good fishing.

name: Large Turnout
description: Large, pull-through turnout on east side of road. Free. Flat. cell service. Good for a night.

name: Wellington parking
description: Parking, we had our first night in Australia, there are gas barbeques, free nearby, we had a great night and in the morning at sunrise on the water, it's just sublime.

name: Bacchus Marsh Caravan Park
description: Well organized campground with new, well maintained amenities and a well equipped kitchen. The unpowered sites are on a lawn at the back of the campground, away from the main road and are quiet. There are a few shady trees. Washing machines and dryers, a sanitation dump station and facilities for dish washing. AUD 32 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). We didn't try the wifi. Good Telstra reception.

name: Treetops Camp Activity Centre
description: Campground run by local scouting volunteers. Nice terrain with clusters of trees and bushes as well as kookaburras and kangaroos. Old and reasonably well maintained amenities. Advance booking is recommended (+61 3 5428 6756). AUD 17 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Good Telstra reception.

name: Store My Van Caravan Storage
description:
We are storing our campervan here during our return to Europe. The place has extreme security measures:
- The exact location is only given after a storage agreement has been reached (the coordinates of this entry are in the neighbourhood, not exact). The entry looks like a farm entry like you see them so often
- To enter you need a gate code that is sent the day before delivery
- You are welcomed by 4 aggressive  looking dogs. You have to stay in your car until you are welcomed by the owner
- The owner will guide you through a second gate with code only known to the owner. You then finally arrive at the storage terrain with many caravans, a few cars and a few containers.

We have stored our car in a 20 foot container. Fee AUD 150 per month.

The storage facility can arrange fixed price transport to the airport.

Car retrieval with 24 hours advance notice.

We can make  final judgement only after we collect the car, but so far all looks good.

Contact: caravan-storage.com.au

name: Reflections Seal Rocks Holiday Park
description: New, clean, grassy RV park. $50/night for large caravan with 2 adults and one child. Across the street from beach. Playground. Laundry.

name: Shelley Beach Car Park
description: Nice little campground. Fees for national park and camping apply ($13+8pp). There is a volunteer campground host who will collect the camping fee. Fresh water comes from a small stream down the mountain and toilets are very clean. Road is gravel but 2wd friendly.

name: Helms Arboretum
description:
Nice spot close to Esperance.
Not far from highway but hidden by a lot of trees. Was good for a few nights without problems and no sign of no camping.

name: CWA Caravan Park
description: nice spot for a night. Some trees for shade as well as a few bins. Self-contained vehicles only. Honesty box 5-10$

name: bikes abroad
description:
specializes in air & sea freight shipping and offers in-house Customs & Quarantine clearance
for motobikes, camper and expeditiontrucks from and to Australia.
very professional and reliable staff.
contakt: Ivan or Brent, both are very friendly and helpful 
office adress: 
bikes abroad
Unit10/42 Global Drive
Tullamarine VIC 3043
Fon: 0466 965 460
Fax: 03 9310 5315
E-mail: ivan@bikesabroad.com.au
            brent@bikesabroad.com.au
Web: www.bikesabroad.com.au
facebook: Bikes Abroad Pty Ltd

name: Htel Granya
description:
Possible to camp on the garden of the hotel for free
Just buy something to eat or drink
Bathrooms with showers
Water tape accesible
Wifi, they can ask 2$
[Password removed by moderator.]

name: Upper Gum campground - Centenary Park
description: Nice campground close to the rock Arapiles

name: Windsor Caravan Park
description: Established Campground next to the City centre

name: SCARNESS CARAVAN PARKQ
description:
Camping between the sea and the esplanade with all amenities, near shops. 7 Australian dollars per person without electricity. With electricity $ 11. Lady Elliot $ 445 on a small plane, the corals are not splendid and the snorking by boat only 1/2 hour. Possibility of doing it alone if the tide is not low and weather permitting. By cons the arrival is beautiful and people are very welcoming.


Camping entre la mer et l'esplanade avec toutes les commodits, prs des commerces. 7 dollars australiens par personne sans l'lectricit. Avec lectricit 11 $. Lady Elliot 445 $ en petit avion, les coraux ne sont pas splendides et le snorkening en bateau seulement 1/2 heure. Possibilit d'en faire seul si la mare n'est pas basse et si le temps le permet. Par contre l'arrive est magnifique et les gens sont trs accueillants.

name: granite crek
description:
the location is not at the place excatement but about 5 km before if you climb to Gladstone. Under the trees just beside the road with toilets and water. Free. he is on the site CampsAustralia


l'emplacement n'est pas a l'endroit excatement mais environ 5 kms avant  si l'on monte vers Gladstone . Sous les arbres au bord de la route juste avec des toilettes et l'eau. Gratuit. il est sur le site CampsAustralia

name: Warburton Holiday Park
description: Good place to stay, everything seems to be very new. Laundry, kitchen but no WiFi available. Not the nicest spot for the tent but we felt ok. Supermarket nearby. We paid 38$/tent/ 2ppn

name: Northeasts Park Scottsdale
description: Campground organised by the Lions Club. Campsite is free, you just pay 3$ for Shower. Toilet are as well there. They ask you for some donations. Its allowed to stay for 14 days.

name: Weldborough
description:
Campground with hot shower and toilets. Nothing special but we dont need much. We paid 10$/p night with tent. WiFi is an official free spot but only 30 min/day. 
Hotel 100$/night at the same place

name: Burdekin
description: In the center of the village, near the information center, in the street the campers can park for 36 hours. All amenities: BBQ, kitchen with hot water, tables, showers, toilets, laundry, all very clean and quiet

name: Hat Head Holiday Park
description:
Clean amenities, established sites for all types of vehicles and camping. close to beach and boat ramp. ice and groceries close by. Prices for Hat Head Holiday Park are approx. $25-40 (depending on season) per camp site per night (powered and unpowered are in that price range)
Cabins from $95 per night.

name: Green Patch
description: Book and pay via ACT national parks. Small sites good for tents or one vehicle. Amenities are clean with warm showers, close to beautiful beaches with clear water

name: Mill's Lookout
description: Mill's Lookout is a quiet spot with a nice atmosphere north of Geraldton. We have camped here three nights without any issues. Can be windy at times. You will get nice sunsets and -rises. Great scenery!

name: Meadows Bush Camp
description: Nice and quiet bush camp out of sight from the main road, where only a few cars are passing by. Might be a bit tricky with a 2WD, it's a sand road. Very green spot, also away from any town - good for star gazing.

name: The Wollombi Tavern
description:
Large grassy area behind the tavern. Shady spots as well as fire places. The camping spot is provided by the owners of the Tavern and the expectation is that you will buy meals and drinks. Support these small rural pubs as they are fast vanishing.
Free in exchange for business.

name: Pink Beach
description: Free Camping in a parking lot with washroom facilities.

name: Colac Tree Road
description: Nice dead end logging road. Track says dry road only, but it was raining when we came up and did not need to engage 4wd. Decent Telstra signal.

name: Two Peoples Rest
description: Not very fancy put secluded and quiet place. Approx. 40 Meters from the road, but out of sight. Just outside of the protected area, so should not be illegal to stay here.

name: John S. Christian Campground
description: Great and quiet stop by a river bed near Black Hill. No wind, plenty of fire wood around. It's an official free camp ground with toilets, also mentioned in Camper Mate.

name: Heyfield RV Rest Stop
description: Random camping around the oval. Totally free with a 2 night maximum. Tents, RVs, Vans welcome. Brand new coin shower and toilet building as of June 2019. Nice spot in an RV Friendly Town!

name: Avon River Reserve
description: Lots of room for any size rig parked beside the Avon River. Popular with fishermen on the weekend, quiet during the week.

name: Chinamans Creek 36 Hour RV Rest Area
description: Small sloped parking area for maybe 5 rigs. Dated, but clean bathroom building. Nice walking boardwalk into town from this location. Free. 36 Hour maximum stay.

name: Beach parking area
description: Fine for self contained, but no tenting and no services or facilities.

name: Empty lot just before Orbost Airport
description: Large level empty grass lot just before the airport entrance. Room for any size rig. No services.

name: Racetrack
description: Gravel parking lot at the horse racing track. Asked at maintenance and they said we were fine to park for the night.

name: Lyndhurst pub
description:
Free drinking water provided by the pub (near the campsite). On the parking there is a water tape and a long hose. 
Ask at the desk before use it, very nice guy !

name: Birdsville Free Campsite Free drinking Water
description:
Very nice and quiet place at Birdsville's entrance. Few water tapes available to refill drinking water. 
Plenty spots and trees.

name: Sanidump- Free
description: Sanidump and water (not potable). Nice spot next to a river. Quiet town plenty of room for big rigs.

name: Seven Mile beach- Dune Parking
description: Parking spot for Seven Mile Beach. Great spot if you need to get to airport in the morning. No signs stating day use or no camping. We parked here for one night with no issues. Bins available but no water or toilets. Planes fly over low if your funny about noise.

name: Tomerong State Forest
description: Super wild camping in the forest. They have just done some logging in this area  so it's not that attractive. But, it's free and away from the crowds. big clearing, roads are currently good in 2023 5 mins of dirt road, very flat. lots of space. no facilities

name: Melton Motor Inn
description: Dated place with noisy, quite dark but large rooms and friendly, helpful staff. Expensive for what it offers. In town center. Gate height 2.40 meter, street parking for larger vehicles. AUD 145 per night for a double.

name: Motel - Castle Creek
description:
Nice, simple, clean motel with 24/7 automated check-in, $120 for a room for two. 
Wifi, cleam bathroom, kitchenette. Park in front of your room.

name: VC Pembrook state Forest Rest Area
description: Typical Aussie Rest Area, Drop toilets, non-potable water, 24 hr stay allowed.

name: Capricorn Holiday Park
description: Big established campsite. kitchen, wifi, carwash, etc etc. good bathrooms. 38 AUD for 2 persons + Car with a tent (unpowerd)

name: Yardie Homestead
description:
huge Campgrund with every facility even Gas Station, Tours and Restaurant. 
WiFi is not free (5AUD for 300mb)
32 AUD 2 persons + car and tent for a night. unpowerd. 
good place if there are no Campsites in the NP.

name: Double Beach Caravan Park
description:
Big Campgrund with all facilities, kitchen, bbq, hot showers, Shop. Near the beach. Shady places. 
30 AUD for one night (2 persons, tent, car, unpowerd)

name: miners
description: nice basic campground. Free! Clean Pit toilets. must so during wild flower season. lots of shade.

name: Kirkalocka Station
description: A working station offering farm stay for travellers. Tents, camper trailers and caravans welcome. We camped behind the old shearers quarters and had use of their facilities. They werent flash but they were functional. Theres some old buildings including the original house to explore.

name: Durba Springs
description: An oasis along the Canning Stock Route. Lots of grassy camping areas along a natural spring (water not drinkable). Long drop toilet. Set amongst tall red cliffs. Great spot for a couple of days to rest.

name: Savory Creek/Lake Disappointment Campsite
description: A lovely campsite under desert oaks near Savory Creek and Lake Disappointment

name: Desert Queen Baths
description: An oasis in the middle of the desert. There are a few clear, flat areas for camping. From the campsite it is a short walk to the baths, which is a permanent source of cool, deep water. Bush toilet appropriately as the ground is quite hard and there are no facilities provided.

name: Sundowner Rockbank Caravan Park
description: Soulless caravan park with dated but clean amenities. Small swimming pool, laundry. Targeted at season guests. Close to noisy Western Highway.

name: State Border Victoria - South Australia
description: Parking on the border between Victoria and South Australia. Clean toilets with light, toilet  paper and water, no other facilities. Free.

name: State Border Victoria-South Australia
description: It is not allowed to take fruits and certain vegetables from Victoria into South Australia. Bins are provided with 5 km into South Australia.

name: Toyota Melton
description: We spent 3 working days for repair of a gearbox leak, clutch replacement, battery replacement and regular service. When we made the booking before we stored the car for 6 months they couldn't tell us after a quick check whether the gearbox repair would be a 2 hour or a 10 hour job. After a similar check on the scheduled day they told us immediately it would be the long job. Fortunately we could arrange accommodation. The first delivery of the clutch was wrong and one of the ordered batteries appeared to be sold, but while we were waiting in the service department they put a lot of effort in rectifying the issues and eventually we got the car on the agreed time. So far it looks like they did a good repair job. Toyota workshops are never cheap, but you get original parts and prices are fixed.

name: Hummocks Station
description: Beautiful place on a farm. Well maintained ablutions, friendly and helpful owners. Superb views of gum trees and many birds. Laundry and dump station available. AUD 25 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Mambray Creek
description: Beautiful campground amidst red gum trees in Mount Remarkable National Park. Various walks and trails from the campground. Well maintained facilities. Dish washing place. Sites must be pre-booked and park vehicle fee must be paid. The single day vehicle park fee of AUD 11 is valid for the entire camping stay. Camping fee is AUD 21.50 (2 adults, campervan). Optus reception on the campground is good, Telstra at the entry of the campsite and at the ranger station only.

name: Poochera Hotel & Caravan Park
description: Quiet campground with spacious sites. Dated but clean amenities. Washing machine, no dryer, simple kitchen (magnetron). Good Telstra reception. AUD 20 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Fowlers Bay Caravan Park
description: Compact caravan park next to the sea (at the other side of the beach road), but no nice beach. We saw a whale from just outside the campground. Dated but functioning and clean amenities, although not many. AUD 25 (2 adults, campervan, no power). Washing machine, no dryer. The office is in a shop just outside the campground. Telstra reception at parts of the campsite.

name: Penong General Store
description: If you travel west this is the last shop for 1000 km.

name: Murphy's Haystacks
description: Camping on the parking of the tourist site. AUD 10 per vehicle per night. Only toilet.

name: Whitewell Tank Camping Area
description: Campground just outside the gate to Head of Bight whale watching. No facilities, free of charge.

name: Nundroo Roadhouse
description: Roadhouse with caravan park and fuel. Distances between fuel stations are 100 to 150 km.

name: Head of Bight
description: In season (June - October) great place to see whales with calves. Visible from a viewing platform just in front  of the coastline. Beautiful cliffs and dunes.

name: Nullabor Roadhouse
description: Roadhouse with caravan park and fuel. Fuel stations are 100 - 150 km apart in the Nullabor. Diesel is more than AUD 0.70 more expensive than in Cetuna.

name: Peg 85 Rest Area
description: Like many rest areas along the A1 Eyre Highway this rest area has various tracks leading away from the parking proper that offer excellent overnight spots up to about 200 meters from the road. Little road noise and barely visible from the road. Open spots between bushes. No amenities, free, no Telstra reception.

name: BP fuel station
description: Fuel stations are 100 to 150 km apart in the Nullarbor.

name: BP fuel station
description: Fuel stations in the Nullarbor are 100 - 150 km apart

name: Baxter Rest Area
description: Rest area with sanitation dump station, toilet and water.

name: Shell
description: Fuel stations on the Nullarbor are 100 - 150 km apart. Shop doesn't have anything other than the usual fuel station stuff.

name: Mundrabilla
description: Great place to stay for a night with good toilets and showers.

name: Eucla Road House
description: Fuel stations in the Nullarbor are 100 - 150 km apart. Fuel is less expensive than on the SA side.

name: BP Fuel Station
description: Ths fuel station is significantly more expensive than fuel stations on the WA side.

name: Border Village Roadhouse
description: Shop offers little more than the usual fuel station stuff, but they do have (frozen) bread.

name: Quarantine Checkpoint
description: It is not allowed to bring most vegetables and fruits from SA to WA. Officers inspect every vehicle that travels into WA. We did not see inspections into SA here, but we saw an unoccupied inspection station just outside Cetuna.

name: Gateway Caravan Park
description: Large, spacious campground with lots of trees. Aged but functional and clean facilities. Laundrywith washing machines and dryers. Barbecue place and small kitchen. Friendly, helpful staff. Part of Acclaim chain. Gas bottle refilling.

name: Norseman IGA
description: Well stocked although expensive supermarket. Last decent shop before the Nullarbor. We didn't find any groceries along the Nullabor, except a roadhouse selling frozen bread. Quarantine check not until Cetuna.

name: Gateway Caravan Park LPG
description: Fills large and small Australian bottles (POL and DIN 477-1 no. 4). Charged per kg. Like most Australian filling stations only a tank, so bottles without bleeder will not fill very well). AUD 8 FOR 2.3 kg.

name: Southern Hills
description: Parking with toilet and dump station. Tracks to various places further away from the road. Free. 24 hours max. A similar place called Ten Miles Rocks can be found at 32.06812 S, 122.56003 E, a few km towards Norseman.

name: Fraser Range Caravan Park
description: The Caravan Park (we didn't stay but it looked nice) fills gas bottles with POL connection.

name: BP fuel station
description: Fuel stations are 100-150 km apart in the Nullarbor.

name: Woorlba
description: Parking with toilet and dump station. Drive one of the tracks starting from the parking for a few 100 m for a quiet place.

name: Woorlba
description: Sanitation dump station on parking with camping facility.

name: Southern Hills
description: Sanitation dump station on parking with camping possibilities.

name: IGA Thevenard
description: One of the last decent supermarkets before Nullarbor. We didn't find any groceries in the Nullarbor except one bar selling frozen bread. Be aware that most fruits and vegetables cannot be taken across the border into WA. Officers will inspect your car at the border.

name: Public shower hot
description: Free public shower in the library/leisure center. Take the passage left hand side of the front desk to the toilets.

name: Rest area
description:
Rest and Picnic area with tables, bbq and fire pits. 
Partly shaded, lots of space.
Full Telstra 4G coverage.

name: BP Fuel Station
description: One of the two fuel stations between Norseman and Esperance.

name: BP Fuel Station
description: One of the two fuel stations between Norseman and Esperance.

name: Bushlands Caravan Park
description: Terrain with mainly long term campers with worn out caravans and campers. It all looks a bit messy. Amenities dated, but clean and functional. Friendly owner. Laundry with washing machines and dryer. Barbecues, basic kitchen with dishwashing place. Good Telstra reception. AUD 25 per night for campervan with 2 adults, no power.

name: Hamersley Inlet
description:
Well built campground with about 15 numbered, flat  sites (first come, first serve). Toilets, non-potable water, barbecues. Fee AUD 10 per site per night, payable through honesty box, plus park fee. Day fee for the park is AUD 13, but we got a year pass for all WA parks for AUD 92.

25% decline asphalt road to the campground. Various nice walks from the campsite. No Telstra reception. We did the walk to the Tamala Karst Lookout, there we had Telstra reception.

A km or so before the campground is another campground (-33.948923, 119.926102) with toilet only. This campground is free. It is not signposted.

name: IGA Hopetoun
description: Well stocked but expensive supermarket. The first alternative is in Raventhorpe.

name: Hopetoun Fuel Station
description: Next fuel station is in Raventhorpe or halfway Esperance.

name: BP Munglinup
description: The only fuel station between Esperance and Raventhorphe, both about 100 km away.

name: Mogas
description: One of the three fuel stations in town. Be aware that travelling east there is no fuel station until Raventhorpe.

name: Stirling Range Retreat
description: Spacious terrain next to the Stirling Range with mountain view for the unpowered sites. Well cared for amenities and camp nature, large and well equipped kitchen with dish washing place, laundry with washing machines and dryers. Everything shows love for the place. Walks on and just outside the terrain. Joint camp fire and swimming pool as well as a presentation about birds, flower tour and a birdwalk are offered. Friendly staff.  Some basic groceries and frozen bread sold. Fee AUD 32 for 2 adults, campervan, unpowered. Drinking water "from the dam" ( filtered, chloride, not totally clear, some taste). Weak Telstra signal on parts of the campground.

name: Torbay Inlet Camp
description: Small camp with 9 dedicated sites, a few are suitable for caravans and large vehicles, the rest for tents. Toilet only, water if the container has been filled. Next to Torbay Inlet and about 1 km from the beach. We saw a message that had been taped off earlier that the camp fee had to be paid, but we saw no amount and no way of payment. Some Telstra reception.

name: Peaceful Bay Caravan Park
description: Large, grassy terrain with plenty of trees. Clean amenities, very basic kitchen with dish washing facilities, laundry with washing machines and dryers. Restaurant with speciality fish & chips (daytime only). Maintenance leaves room for improvement. Drinking water "from the dam" (filtered and with chloride, not totally clear and withsome taste). Good wifi near the office. Good Telstra connection. AUD 28 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Northcliffe News Agent & General Store
description: Next fuel stations in Pemberton and Walpole.

name: BP Pemberton
description: Next fuel station in Northcliffe when heading southeast

name: Caltex
description: One of two fuel stations in Walpole. Next fuel station is in Northcliffe when  traveling west.

name: IGA
description: This IGA is a reasonably well stocked supermarket.

name: BP Fuel Station
description: Next fuel in Busselton (westbound) or Pemberton (eastbound).

name: Yallingup Beach Holiday Park
description: Grassy, flat terrain; many sites with trees. Well maintained and clean ablutions. Across the road of the beach. Barbecue area with sunset view over the sea. Powered sites only. AUD 40 (2 adults, campervan). Good drinking water (town water). Excellent dish washing facilities. Sanitation dump station. Good Telstra reception. Wifi near the office.

name: Allgear Motorcycles
description: Honda and Yamaha dealer. Can get parts for most brands of bikes shipped in and carries some of the tires for large adventure bikes (had a off road and a 50/50 for my BMW R1200gs.  Nice guys and quick to help.

name: Wardan Aboriginal Centre
description: Our visit was a bit strange experience. The place consists of an exhibitions with panels and items describing Aboriginal life (contribution by donation). Signs show that in addition a (1) field tour, (2) tool making and (3) spear/boomerang throwing are offered. According to a sign outside costs are AUD 25 for each activity, a sign inside showed AUD 10 each. We were welcomed by an Aboriginal lady who tried to tell some interesting stories. However, it was hard to comprehend as she was very difficult to understand and the way she told it was rather haphazard. Suddenly she disappeared and didn't return. Furthermore the not working illumination didn't add to the experience. Photography was not allowed. It could have been very interesting, but ended up being a disappointment.

name: Preston Beach
description: 24 hour camping allowed on the Preston Beach parking lot in 5-day period. May 1st until October 31st only. Vehicles must have grey and black water container. Maximum 5 vehicles simultaneously. The indoor (cold) showers were out of order, one outdoor shower available. Barbecue. Good Telstra reception. Free of charge.

name: Coastal Holiday Park
description: Large campground with lawns and trees. Many permanent cottages. Well maintained and clean amenities (although we had some issues with the laundry). Good dish washing facility. Staff friendly but not too clever. Wifi on the entire campground. Only powered sites. AUD 35 for 2 adults with campervan. Good Telstra reception. Town water. Sanitation dump station.

name: Lake Clifton Thrombolites
description:
The thrombolites look like rocks, but are micro-organisms that resemble the earliest for of life on earth. Lake Clifton is one of the few places in Australia and on the planet where they can be found. You have to walk a few hundred meters from the parking lot to reach them.

We wanted to make the 5 km walk that starts from the parking lot, but the smashed glass and theft warnings on the parking lot made us feel uncomfortable to leave our car unattended for a longer time. We asked the ranger and he strongly recommended to park the car in front of the winery a few hundred meters up the access road.

The walk itself was nice, but never got to the lake.

name: Dolphin Point
description: Head down to the car park right next to the water. Views over the tidal river with running water, toilets and outdoor shower. Stayed here overnight with no problems, locals seem lovely

name: Cherokee Village Tourist Park
description: Campground with modern, well maintained and clean amenities. Most of the space is taken by permanent cottages. Quiet environment, friendly staff. Washing machines and dryers, good kitchen, swimming pool, sanitation dump station. Wifi near the office only. Good Telstra reception, town water, AUD 35 per night (2 adults, campervan, unpowered).

name: Hillside Garden Village
description: Campground targeted at permanent sites for senior citizens with activities like bingo and singing for members of the campside club. Modern, well maintained and clean ablutions, but a characterless place. All sites are on concrete slabs (no tents allowed).Swimming  pool, washing machines, dryers, no kitchen. Expensive for what is offered. Good Telstra reception. WiFi near the office only. No powerless sites. Some highway traffic noise. AUD 40 (2 adults, campervan).

name: Batemans House Boat Hire
description: Quiet and out of the way but also right on the water. Amazing oyster shack if you keep heading down the road - this is where we stayed as we asked the owners if it was ok, but there are heaps of spaces earlier on. Please dont stay in their car park without permission. Great sunset view. Boat sheds/oyster shack opens at 8am and closes at 4pm so if you come and leave outside of those times you shouldnt have a problem.

name: Fremantle Village
description: Campground belonging to the TOP chain. Well maintained, clean amenities, 2 kitchens, community room, laundry with washing machines and dryers, dish washing facilities. Next to the beach, Free shuttle bus to Fremantle every 10 minutes. Friendly staff. Good Telstra reception, wifi near the office building, AUD 38 (2 adults, campervan, power).

name: Warri Campground
description: NSW rest stop - large area with heaps of space for your own private spot amongst the trees. Lots of small fire pits and a short walk to a clean creek. Didnt use the toilet as it didnt look too fresh

name: Oura Beach Reserve
description: Large reserve right on the Murrumbidgee river. Heaps of space available and you can stay over a few nights. Quite away from the main roads. Optus and Telstra reception. Drop toilets available & shower in the river. Established fire pits available all over. Locals say it gets busy over summer.

name: Coolac Cabins and Camping
description: Great small caravan/camping spot for a country stay and stop for hot showers and washing, couldnt recommend this place more. Its $25 for a powered site & $20 for unpowered and well worth the money. Lovely large hot showers, washing machine and drying line (no dryer if its raining), they light a communal fire every night and even have a games set up including quoits and golf. There is a communal kitchen and a room with Netflix for watching movies. The have 3 lovely border collies that played with our dog all evening. They only have 8 powered site so book in during summer.

name: Rundle Park
description: Park with drinking water tap for car tank refill, beach shower, children's playground and barbecue.

name: Green Head
description: Sanitation dump station next to the road.

name: Murchison River Caravan Park
description: Campground belongs to Top Caravan Park range. Various size sites with mats or slabs. Lots of shade from large trees. Part of the dated ablutions are cabins with toilet and shower. Large camp kitchen. Opposite the beach with good sunsets. Daily pelican feeding (2 pelicans when we attended). Wifi mainly near the kitchen. Good Telstra reception. Seasonal dog access. AUD 39 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered).

name: Kalbarri Anchorage Caravan Park
description: Caravan park next to the river with only a road in between. Large, shady trees. Large kitchen, slow wifi near the kitchen. Sanitation dump station. Laundry with washing machines and dryers. Dated but clean and ample ablutions. Swimming pool. Good Telstra reception. Seasonal pet access. AUD 38 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered).

name: Western Australian Shipwrecks Gallery
description: Excellent museum with partly restored Dutch VOC vessel Batavia and many findings of shipwrecks. Explanation of life on board, navigation etc. Fee by donation.

name: Nerren Nerren Rest Area
description: Rest area with toilet, barbecue and sanitation dump station. Maximum stay 24 hours. The area consists of sand with medium high trees and scrubs. Places up to about 150 meter from the main road are available. Some Telstra reception. Free of charge.

name: Galena Bridge Rest Area
description: Nice rest area next to the river. Camping for 24 hours allowed. Toilet and sanitation dump station available. A similar rest area can be found just north of the river.

name: Denham Sanitation Dumpstation
description: A sanitation dumpstation is available at this location.

name: Caltex
description: One of the fuel stations in Denham. Note that when leaving the peninsula the next fuel station is in Overlander (125 km), unless you make a detour to Nanga.

name: BP Overlander Roadhouse
description: When traveling to the peninsula the next filling station is in Denham, unless you make a detour to Nanga. At this location is also a caravan park. The filling station shop sells the standard stuff: drinks (including milk), prepared sandwiches. No bread, no fruits or vegetables.

name: Shell
description: One of two fuel stations at this location. Note that when traveling south to the coast the next filling station is in Kalbarri.

name: Monkey Mia Dolphin Resort
description: This RAC resort is one of the most luxurious campgrounds we have come across in Australia. Beautiful new toilets and showers, a large kitchen with ovens, electrical stoves and ample dishwashing facilities. Entertainment room, bar, restaurant and two swimming pools. Laundry with washing machines and dryers. General Store with a basic set of groceries including bread, fruits and vegetables. Fuel station. Directly on the beach. We paid AUD 42 for an unpowered site (2 persons), but were allowed to use power. A powered site is AUD 50.  In addition you need to pay entrance fee for the marine park (AUD 20 per day with concession; being Dutch we had no Australian concession card, but that was no problem). Our annual pass for Western Australian parks was not valid. Excellent Telstra reception, good wifi connection on our campsite. Wifi allowance 1 GB per 24 hours per device. Sanitation dump station.

name: BP Kalbarri
description: One of the three filling stations in Kalbarri. Note that when traveling north there is no fuel station until Billabong Roadhouse (196 km).

name: Big Lagoon Campground
description: Beautiful campground next to Big Lagoon, 16 sites in total, 4 directly at the lagoon. Barbecue and sunset viewing places, clean long drop toilet, untreated water from a big container. To enter the park entrance fee must be paid if you don't have a pass. The campground fee is AUD 11 per person. It should be paid upon park entry (honesty box, cash only), but we paid the volunteer team on site instead. You need a 4WD with high clearance because of the deep sand tracks in the park. We lowered the tyre pressure to1.1 bar and had no problem to enter. Equipment to inflate tyres after you return is provided at the start of the 4x4 tracks. Minimal Telstra reception.

name: Eddagee Rest Area
description: Parking with scrubs offering many places to put a vehicle or tent. Fence allows for about 100 from road. Toilet, no other facilities.

name: Wooramel Roadhouse
description: Fuel station and caravan park. Next fuel stations are in Overlander (south) and in Carnarvon (north).

name: Norwesta Lifestyle Park
description: Medium sized caravan park with some trees. Ablutions dated but clean. Large and well equipped kitchen. Sanitation dump station. Cafe open during weekends serving pizzasnd pasta. Wifi near kitchen. Excellent Telstra reception. Laundry with washing machines, no dryers. Town water. Friendly place. Only powered sites. AUD 35 (2 adults, campervan). We got a concession price although we don't have a card.

name: Woolworth
description: Very well stocked and reasonably priced supermarket. Note that when you travel to Shark Bay the next supermarket is in Denham, about 300 km away.

name: Jones Bridge Park
description: Cute little camping spot right on the river. There are 5 spots that come with a little fire pit and a friendly local has nominated himself as caretaker making sure there is wood and no trash around - if you see him you will need to chuck him $5-$10 if you can. Only dog friendly camp spot for kms

name: Chalks Campground
description:
Forest campground with new toilet facilities, three sided hut with open fire, many camping sites with fire pits and fire grates for cooking, non potable water available. 

$5 pp p/n book online. The rest of the forest is closed off or camping via permit only.

a tiny bit of phone reception

12km from Williamstown, 15km from Birdwood with pubs, supermarket etc, close to Barossa Valley and Adelaide Hills wineries, 53km from Adelaide CBD.

name: Lighthouse crossing reserve
description: Great spot right on the Murray surrounded by paddocks and cows. Very quite with heaps of space to make your own. Recommend bringing firewood. Make sure you have your fishing licence and fisheries come past often. Good 4g

name: Shark Bay Supermarket
description: Moderately stocked and rather expensive supermarket. Be aware that when traveling north the next supermarket is in Carnarvon (300 km).

name: Peoples Park
description: Large campground next to the beach. Snorkeling is possible across the street. Most sites have some shade. Few, rather small unpowered sites available that cannot be booked. Well maintained ablutions. Laundry with washing machines and dryers. Sanitation dump station. Large kitchen with standard facilities. Water on sites is bore water, not suitable for drinking. Drinking water is provided, but it is not allowed to fill tanks. Convenience store and small restaurant at the front of the campground. Wifi in the restaurant only. Good Telstra reception. Powered site AUD 52 (2 adults, campervan, school holiday period).

name: Minilya Rest Area
description: Rest area with toilets and barbecue. Flat area without shade.

name: Minilya Bridge Roadhouse & Caravan Park
description: The roadhouse is the first fuel station after Carnarvon when traveling north. Towards the coast the next one is in Coral Bay. At the site is a caravan park as well.

name: Yalabia Rest Area
description: Rest area with toilets, fire places and sanitation dump station. The area is fenced with the furthest about 100 m from the road.

name: Guobba
description: Three sanitation dump stations are available just outside the campground.

name: Foodworks
description: Reasonably stocked (including vegetables, fruits, bread) but rather expensive supermarket. Note that when traveling south the next supermarket is in Carnarvon (almost 300 km).

name: Caltex
description: Note that there are  no fuel stations outside Carnarvon until Minilya roadhouse (north) and Wooramel roadhouse (south).

name: The Reef
description: Restaurant serving big seafood platters with oysters, mussels, large shrimps, squid and more for AUD 79. Much more seafood and pizzas, also for takeaway.

name: Yardie Homestead
description: Fuel station belonging to the Yardie Homestead Caravan Park. Last fuel before you enter the national parks.

name: Shell
description: This fuel station is the first filling station after Minilya when traveling north, unless you deviate to Coral Bay (12 km one way).

name: Caltex
description: Unmanned fuel station, service 24/7 available. Next fuel stations are Minilya or near Exmouth.

name: Yardee Creek Crossing
description: Sanitation dump station at the end of the paved road.

name: Bullara Station
description: Operational cattle station with campground. Large sites, very friendly place. Some walks in the environment. Evening campfire with dumpers and telling of the history of the place. Firewood heated showers with shower head style Africa: a bucket with holes in which water is poured through a hose. Sandy terrain with half high trees, but not much shadow. Some Telstra reception. Laundry service. Garden cafe for morning coffee and breakfast. AUD 28 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered).

name: Tom Price Tourist Park
description: Large, shady campground belonging to the Top group. Kitchen with many barbecues, but few disk washing places. Laundry with washing machines and dryers. Good Telstra reception. Dated but functional amenities. AUD 36 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: House Creek Bridge
description: Rest area with 24 h camping permission. Treeless terrain with toilet, barbecue rather close to the road. Free.

name: Nanutarra - Caltex
description: Next filling station towards Port Hedland 180 km, towards Tom Price 280 km.

name: Shell
description: Next fuel station to the west is about 280 km.

name: Coles
description: Well stocked and reasonably priced supermarket. Next supermarket west is in Exmouth, some 560 km away.

name: Ningaloo IGA
description: Reasonably stocked and (for IGA) well priced supermarket. The next supermarket east is in Tom Price (app. 360 km).

name: Port Hedland Golf Club
description: Sandy terrain next to the golf club building; some sites with shade. Aged but functional ablutions. Toilets and showers only. Noise from the road trains on the highway. AUD 15 (2 adults, campervan, no power). Some Telstra reception.

name: Sanitation Dump Station
description: A sanitation dump station can be found here.

name: Two Camel Creek Rest Area
description: 24 hour stopping with barbecue and toilet. About 300 meters from the road. Free.

name: Sanitation Dump Station
description: A sanitation dump station can be found here.

name: Auski Tourist Village
description: Shell fuel station. Next fuel station north is in Port Hedland (250 km). At this place is also a caravan park. Showers available for non-residents (AUD 5).

name: Auski Tourist Village Fuel Station Shop
description: The shop has bread, milk, a few fruits, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks and all the usual fuel station stuff.

name: Stanley Rest Area
description: A sanitation dump station can be found at this location.

name: Sandfire Roadhouse
description: When traveling northeast the next fuel station is in Broome (app. 300 km). Fuel station shop sells bread and milk. We didn't see any vegetables or fruits. The roadhouse also offers a caravan park and accomodation. The caravan park is shady with good patches of grass.

name: Pardoo Roadhouse - Liberty
description: First fuel after Port Hedland. We didn't see any useful groceries in the shop. Also caravan park with shade and good grass.

name: Woolworth
description: Well stocked and reasonably priced supermarket. Next grocery store north is in Broome (app. 650 km). Bottle stores in Port Hedland are closed on Sunday and open at noon on other days. In South Hedland is a comparable Coles.

name: Tarangau Caravan Park
description: Terrain with grass and many shaded sites. Walking distance from Cable Beach. Clean ablutions. Wifi 200MB per day and near reception building only. Adequate Telstra reception. Town water, sanitation dump station. AUD 29 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Roebuck Roadhouse - BP (+caravan park)
description: Next fuel station towards Port Hedland app. 300 km (unless you deviate to Port Smith - 2 x 23 km extra). Also caravan park.

name: Goldwire Rest Area
description: Camping permitted for 24 hours. Far from the main road, barbecues, toilet, sanitation dump station. Free.

name: Villa Marine Holiday Apartments
description: Surrounded by tropical rainforest, this relaxed Eco Friendly Holiday Accommodation is 1 minute walk from Yorkeys Knob Beach, a 10 minute walk from Half Moon Bay Marina and 17 km from Cairns Central Business District. Villa Marine has been awarded 3 times Best Standard Accommodation for the Region and it is very affordable. The airy, self-contained apartments come with FREE Wi-Fi, great kitchens. Famous for the beautiful rainforest views, rainforest birds and wildlife. 9 only Villas, it is quiet and peaceful. Amenities include a huge lagoon pool, BBQs and an outdoor dining area, as well as fishing equipment, laundry. Utilize the owners extensive local knowledge of the Great Barrier Reef and Rainforest. They run The Tourist Information Centre of Yorkeys Knob, which has an extensive range of Cairns Tours.

name: Coles
description: Well stocked and reasonably priced supermarket. Note that the next supermarket south is in Port Hedland (650 km).

name: Field Air Conditioning  & Auto Electrical
description: Supplies electrical car parts and repairs car air conditioning. Did a professional job repairing the airco of our LandCruiser. Had the required parts in stock, timely informed us of the costs and completed the job within the promised time. Shuttle service within Broome.

name: Fitzroy River Lodge
description: Very large campground (310 sites) with OK facilities. Swimming pool, laundry, standard camp kitchen. Own fuel station. Sandy terrain witha reasonable number of shady trees. Wifi near reception building. Lots of wallabies. Rather expensive for the place: AUD 42 (2 adults, campervan, no power). Reasonable Telstra reception.

name: BP - Ngyiali Roadhouse
description: One of the fuel stations in Fitzroy Crossing. Next fuel station towards Broome is app. 300 km.

name: Ellendale Rest Area
description: Rest area with 24 hours camping permission. A few hundred meters from the main road. Long drop toilet, sheltered picnic places, flat terrain, no shade.

name: IGA
description: Well stocked supermarket. Note that the next supermarket west is in Broome (400 km),  northeast is in Halls Creek (250 km).

name: Willare Bridge Roadhouse & Caravan Park
description: Next fuel station west is in Broome, app. 150 km (except if you deviate to Derby), east in Fitzroy Crossing 220 km. The place has also a caravan park.

name: Willare Bridge Roadhouse Shop
description: Shop has frozen bread, milk, lots of meat, some vegetables, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks in addition to the usual stuff.

name: Spring Creek Dump Station
description: Sanitation dump station on the top section of the rest area.

name: IGA Express
description: Next supermarket southwest is in Fitzroy River Crossing (250 km).

name: Shell
description: Next fuel station is in Fitzroy River Crossing (app 250 km).

name: Wyndham Caravan Park
description: Caravan Park with lots of shady sites and the "largest captive boab tree" (whatever that may mean). Small swimming pool, well equipped kitchen, laundry, sanitation dump station. Waterhole with many birds including gouldian finch. Wifi near reception, 1 bar Telstra. AUD 30 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Fuel station
description: Next fuel station west is app. 200 km away.

name: Wyndham Supermarket
description: Reasonably stocked supermarket set up in "African style". Traveling southwest the next supermarket is in Halls Creek.

name: Parry Creek Farm
description: Although according to their website camping facilities are open year round the campground appeared to be closed when we called on 2019-10-12. Check before you go.

name: Wyndham Turnoff
description: 24 hour camping, close to road, flat terrain, no shade. Sheltered picnic sites. Weak Telstra reception.

name: Fruit Fly Free Zone
description: Traveling north it is not allowed to bring in citrus fruits in the dry season, although there was  no physical check.

name: Warmun Roadhouse
description: Next fuel northeast is in Wyndham (110 km). Place has also a caravan park (unpowered site AUD 25 per night, 2nd night free), drinking water and showers. The shop has meat, milk, frozen bread, drinks. We did not see vegetables or fruits.

name: Spring Creek Sanitation Dump Station
description: Sanitation Dump Station can be found next to the new toilet building.

name: Katherine Holiday Park
description: Large terrain with many shady sites. Big swimming pool. Modern, well maintained, clean ablutions (large people have to be careful that they don't get a free haircut from the ceiling fans). Sanitation dump station, good kitchen. Laundry service. Moderate Telstra reception. AUD 45 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered).

name: Mathison Rest Area
description: Flat terrain with little shade directly at the road.

name: Sullivan Creek Campground
description: This campground is in fact a rest area directly on the road, but because it is in a National Park it must be paid for (AUD 3.3 per person). It is next to the creek. Long drop toilet, no shade, small, picnic benches without canopy. Most free regular restareas are better for camping.

name: Victoria Roadhouse
description: Note that the next fuel station is in Katherine when traveling west.

name: Timber Creek
description: At this location are 2 fuel stations, Puma and United. United is slightly less expensive. Furthermore there is a caravan park.

name: Timber Creek Hotel
description: The shop of the hotel and fuel station has frozen bread and meat, some vegetables and fruits, milk and non-alcoholic drinks. On the shop of the United fuel station we saw a sign Supermarket, but we didn't check it out.

name: State crossing WA-NT
description: Quarantine checkpoint upon entering WA (vegetable and fruit limitations). We went into NT. Although there are quite some import restrictions (fruits, tomatoes, potatoes) we didn't see a single warning sign, no waste bins and had no checks.

name: Bridge Toyota Darwin
description: After multiple unanswered emails and follow-up calls we were told that they don't service foreign cars. This is the first time that this happened to us after traveling for 3.5 years in 5 continents.

name: Woolworth
description: Well stocked and reasonably priced supermarket. Note that the next one traveling west is in Kununurra.

name: Rapid Bay
description:
On the sea front. Remote. Toilets. 10 dollars per night.
 Scenic, quiet, lovely!

name: Dundas tourist drive
description: a tourist drive with plenty of isolated wild campground.

name: Dundas old mines
description:
an interesting abandoned mine site. 
10 points of interest Along a 30km gravel road I very good shape.

name: coffin bay public toilet
description: public toilet in front of the bay with tap water.

name: United
description: One of the fuel stations is Katherine. Note that the next one traveling southwest is Victoria Roadhouse.

name: Bridge Creek
description: Rest Area with up to 24hr stay permitted. Up to 200 meter from road, flat terrain, little shade. Picnic places,  toilet, barbecue. Free.

name: Fishers Nest
description: Small campground in garden-like environment between palms. Cubicle with nice toilet/shower. Water is drinkable bore water. Advance calling recommended (+61 428 141 136). 1 bar Telstra. AUD 15 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered). Free use of washing machine.

name: All Rural Mechanical
description:
Excellent workshop recommended by the Toyota LandCruiser Club Darwin. We needed  300,000 km service and wanted a thorough inspection before shipping to East Timor. They found issues that should have been found during earlier service and communicated well about the repair options and costs. Radiator, water pump, bushes were replaced, engine mount was repaired, all liquids replaced, brake pads changes and brakes tested, bearings replaced and standard maintenance was done. I could regularly enter the workshop to see how things were going.

They offer a free courtesy car (fuel only). Alternatively an airconditioned library is nearby.

Al an alternative the LandCruiser club recommended Offroad Autos in Palmerston, but we didn't check them out.

name: Mary River Caravan Park
description: Campground along the Mary River. Many grassy and shady sites. Worn out but clean amenities. Basic (not very clean) kitchen. Something between a tiny swimming pool and a large tub; laundry. Different nature walks starting from the campground. 200 MB wifi per device at reception. Poor Telstra reception. Sanitation dump station, water is bore water. AUD 30 (2 adults, campervan, no power). Lots of wallabies and birds.

name: Jabiru Foodland
description: Reasonably stocked but expensive supermarket. Traveling west next supermarket in Humpty Doo. Note that Jabiru has no bottle store.

name: Kakadu Information Bay
description: Flat terrain with toilets, picnic tables. 200 m from the road.

name: Puma
description: Note that fuel stations between Jabiru and Humpty Doo close in the wet.

name: Anbinik Kakadu Resort
description: Campground with powered sites only. Every site has its own toilet/shower. Little shade. Laundry, swimming pool, small kitchen, town water, barbecues. One bar Telstra. Enormous numbers of little corellas and flying foxes at sunset. AUD 42 (2 adults, campervan).

name: Sanitation dumpstation Jabiru
description: At this location you will find a sanitation dump station

name: Fuel station Oenpelli
description: Next fuel station in Jabiru when traveling southwest.

name: Adjumarlarl Store & Takeaway
description: General store selling goods varying from vegetables to washing machines! Reasonable stock of vegetables and fruits.

name: Injalak Art Centre
description: Art centre offering aboriginal paintings and beads. Expensive and rather low quality. Outside you can see aboriginal women at work making very simple pieces. Because it is in Arnhem Land you need a permit to visit.

name: Northern Land Council
description: Issues permits to enter Arnhem Land to visit Oenpelli. Permits are issued on the spot and are valid for one day. They cost AUD 16.50 per person. You can only use it to visit the art centre in Oenpelli and its direct environment. After the Cahill Crossing you are not allowed to stop along the road. Note that you may have to wait for low tide to cross the river safely. If the tide is below 6 meter it is safe. Check WillyWeather for actual values.

name: Woolworth
description: Well stocked and reasonable supermarket. Note that it is the last supermarket until the much more expensive Foodworks in Jabiru when traveling east.

name: Brighton Caravan Park
description: By the sea, all facilities, near train station into Adelaide. 4 X nights 34 dollars/night including electronic & wifi.

name: Water tap Central Square
description: Tap with free drinking water next to the parking lot. A hose can be connected.

name: Garudja Lodge
description: Lots of shady sites. Basic kitchen, laundry with washing machines and dryers. Beautiful swimming pool. Starting point for Yellow River cruises. New amenities, basic kitchen. We haven't found any useful groceries in the store. Strong Telstra H+, no 4G. AUD 30 (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Kakadu Tourism Fuel Station
description: Next fuel can be found in Jabiru en Humpty Doo.

name: Free Spirits Resort
description: Large campground with few unpowered sites. Adequate amenities, laundry with dryers, good kitchen, large swimming pool. Next to Stuart Highway, but road is far enough away from campsites. Big swimming pool, town water. Many high palms. Wifi near bar/reception. Good Telstra reception. AUD 24 (2 adults, campervan, unpowered).

name: Puma
description: One  of the few fuel stations towards Arnhemland.

name: Licquor Legends
description: May be your last opportunity to buy take-away licquor for the next 1000 km or so when you travel towards Arnhemland. Open on Sunday.

name: Puma
description: Only fuel station between Humpty Doo and Jabiro.

name: Discovery Adelaide Beach Front holiday park
description:
Motorhome, caravan park with full facilities by the beach. 38AUDpn fourth night free.
Retail near by, bus to Adelaide CBD

name: Australian Home Affairs
description:
A Carnet de Passages needs to be stamped and a vehicle inspected here prior to shipment.

We went here in preparation of the shipment to Dili of our car. We didn't have a Bill of Lading yet, but the quotation of Bollor and an email confirming the shipping date were sufficient. VIN and engine number were checked. The whole procedure was friendly and took about 30 min.

name: Campingworld
description: Well stocked shop for camping and fishing gear.

name: Weighing Bridge
description: You must weigh your vehicle here before it is loaded in a container for shipment. Just push the button and a ticket with the weight comes out. Free.

name: Bollor
description:
Agent for shipping vehicles in a container to East Timor. Bookings for shipping to East Timor can be done by ANL and Bollor. The shipping is always done by ANL. They sail with two vessels that are supposed to sail the triangle Darwin-Dili-Singapore. ANL is notoriously unreliable: ETD's typically change, the route may be reversed or Dili may be skipped if they have insufficient freight. We had contact with ANL for the booking as well, but found them irresponsive.

At Bollor we delt with Alzira Lay-Leong (alzira.layleong@bollore.com, +61 8 8935 6701). She was responsive and helpful, but not very accurate. Before our vehicle was delivered for shipment (5 days before sailing minimum) we had our Carnet stamped by customs in town and weighed the vehicle (see separate iOverlander entries). We could drive the vehicle into the container ourself and attend when the container was locked. We paid about AUD 3,000.

name: Knights Bend
description: Camp on the Murray River. This is a free camp.

name: Street Art
description: In Litchfield Street and in Austin Lane you can find excellent street art. We found it much more impressive than the street art in Melbourne.

name: Indonesian Consulate
description: The consulate provides visas in 4 to 5 working days. We couldn't use it because we didn't had enough time in Darwin. If you travel via East Timor to Indonesia you can get a visa in Dili, but the Dili consulate often issues no visit visas for more than 30 days, whereas most other consulates give 60 days. So if you have the time in Darwin and have your sponsor arranged Darwin may be the better choice.

name: Hanuman Darwin
description: One of the better (and more expensive) restaurants in Darwin offering mainly Indian and Indonesian dishes. The food was very tasteful, but the service was friendly but disorganized with long waits and repeated requests. We may have had bad luck, as we had the impression that tables around us were served better.

name: Cohuna Reserve
description: Free camp just off the main street, near water. 400mts to hotel for a great feed.

name: Kingaroy sewage dump point
description: Basic but free. In town at a small park.

name: Stuart River overnight campsite
description: Toilets. Maximum stay 20 hours. Free. Tables.

name: Myroodah crossing at Fitzroy River
description: Nice and quiet spot. There are several campspot along the riverbank. Only little shade. We are alone with 1 billion flies, no mozzis.

name: Piersone point
description: This is an old military outpost, now memorial. Vehicle camping was available and easiest. There is a lighthouse on the point and if you follow the dirt road on the south side of the parking lot it continues under the lighthouse where there is an old howitzer bunker with a flat and covered concrete pad where a tent can be pitched. A great place if it is windy or raining. Be cautious, there is a significant amount of glass around the bunker area which can rip a tent but was easily removed off the pad to make a space. Overall a beautiful place near Hobart. FREE

name: Marla Camp Ground
description:
10 Aud /pppn (per person per night), power 10 Aud on.
Clean facilities, some shade. Pool. Good supermarket and fuel station.

name: The N.T. General Store
description: Outdoor store with lots of stuff that you don't find at BCF.

name: Kings Creek Station
description:
25aud pppn powered big rig. Pool, some shade, busy little cafe bar during day. Pleasant staff. Good Spot.
Heli rides etc if you like. Workshop for vehicle repairs, welding.
phone internet very weak.

name: Murgon campsite
description: Local Council amenity for 48hr stay. Cooking, disability toilets, and power.

name: Dalmorton Campground
description:
Located near the historic town of Dalmorton, this campground is a great base for exploring walks in Guy Fawkes National Park or for swimming and fishing in Boyd River.

Accommodation Details:
Camping type: Tent, Camper trailer site, Caravan site, Camping beside my vehicle
Facilities: Picnic tables, Barbecue facilities, Longdrop Toilets
Price: 
$6 per adult per night.
$3.50 per child per night.
Bookings: Bookings are not available for this campground.Please note

This campground is suitable for groups but is aremote campground, so please make sure you arrive well-prepared.

Sites are not marked.

--------------------------------

This spacious campground in Guy Fawkes River National Park is located near the historic town of Dalmorton, which was once a thriving gold-mining town during a short-lived boom.
A quiet campground thats rarely full, Dalmorton campground has a large mown area that is suitable for group camping or a game of soccer or rugby. There are also logs placed around the fireplaces, encouraging people to sit and share stories whilst enjoying the warmth of the fire on cool evenings.
The campground is on the edge of Boyd River, making it a perfect place to stay if youd like to while away some holiday time swimming, canoeing or fishing.
At dawn or dusk, see if you can spot the red-necked wallabies around the grounds, or the platypus in the river. At night, brush-tailed possums sometimes visit the campground, and you may hear the sounds of purebred dingoes howling from the surrounding hills.

name: IOverlander Roadhouse
description:
THE Overlander Gas station in Australia.

Moderator Note: There is apparently a caravan facility and rest area near by.

name: Wingello Base Camp
description: Large flat area within the pine trees. Gravel road all the way in through pine plantation for a few kms - flat and uneventful. Quiet, shady,and with a drop toilet. No drinking water. If youre lucky you might see a wommy. Free!

name: Mt Stromlo MTnb Park
description: Purpose built recreation centre - mountain bikes/ road cycling/ running. FREE SHOWERS AND DRINKING WATER  - huge clean facility. Theres a cafe too opens wkds and wed -fri evenings only. The centre opens late - 9pm

name: Princess Royal Sailing Club
description: Public car park. Next to sailing club. On the seafront. Quiet. Lovely views. Boat launch ramp. Decent-sized flat tarmac car park. No facilities.

name: Cooloola National Park - Teewah Beach Camping
description:
Beach camping on a 15km stretch of pristine beach. Its a National Park so the usual restrictions apply (no pets). Camping is $6.60 per person per night, and you also need a vehicle permit to camp on the beach. (Around $30 for a week). Sites are not numbered, just set up where you please. Book online at https://parks.des.qld.gov.au/parks/cooloola/ or at many of the stores in nearby Rainbow Beach
There are no facilities and no water available (except at Freshwater creek, near the northern end) also no mobile reception or internet. 
Beach is best driven within 2 hrs of low tide, and you need a 4wd.

name: Rocky Point car park
description: Council car park, on sea front, near town centre. Council experiment. Free two nights. Visit very helpful Haley Street tourism office for permit. Big rig, Cara, motorhomes only. The other two car parks offer more privacy, but this one is central to everything.

name: Gillards Beach
