description: Beautiful campsite with about 20 spots next to the beach, nice nature walk with lizards, kangaroos, wallabies and echidnas. NP free entry. camping is paid. 15 minutes down a dirt road

name: Chatsworth Park
description: Free camping. 20 hour maximum stay. Room for vans & caravans. Toilet block and picnic tables. Right by the side of the highway so could be a bit noisy at night

name: Red Rock Camp Ground
description:
Red Rock is nicely
 placed ajacent to both the beach and a river, campsites are of good size and amenities are in good order

name: South Beach car park
description:
Big irrigated grass lawn between free carpark and the beach. caf, public showers and loo's. Next to the frieght railway line.
Quiet and peaceful at night, packed full in the day.
Side of carpark nearest railway is owned by the railway, no restrictions or tickets. Side by grass is council, restrictions apply.
I have been here for a week, no problems so far. Easy walk or cycle to the middle of town or train to Perth

name: Willoughbys Beach camp dround
description: This place is down on the Edward River. Not a place to come if its wet. You can swim here, no toilets or showers must be self contained.

name: Wild camp Jarrahdale ovale
description:
Nice spot, calm, near Jarrahdale.
Billy (woman firefighter) visited us at 22 pm, to see what we were doing here and to advise us for fire prevention.
Kangaroos are here in the night! 
We put the roof tent in the night.
Enjoy!

name: seaside camping
description: free campground with i think around 15 places. toilets clean. no shower. great view!

name: Taylor Park - Aberdeen
description: Small park in Aberdeen NSW, nice park with good rest area and Dump site

name: Abermain, New South Wales
description: Goulburn Street, on Right hand side, past school, Free for Registered Guests or fee for dump point use only

name: Hammond road campground
description: Free campground, 12 sites first come first serve. Toilets only but very nice and quiet place in the inland.

name: Mekhong Thai
description: Rated the best Thai in Brisbane. Owned and run by world travelers Joe and Deon

name: Gil Weir - Great spot FREE
description: Free campground for a maximum of 4 nights. Pit toilet. Next to a river. Lovely and quiet. Good Telstra reception. 2x picnic tables which are hot property. 2 mins down a sealed road from highway. sand flies at dusk. FREE

name: Kilcoy Free Camping
description: Free designated campground. No amenities but nice and quiet. About 4 other campers here over Xmas period. Quaint little town.

name: Walpole Nornalup NP
description:
Small parkinglot after 2km dirtroad (2wd accessible). 
No no camping sign.

name: Seymour Park
description: Established dog park, large area bigger than most dog parks. Has a large area of park with picnic tables outside the dog area, plenty of parking for long vehichles.

name: Dongara
description:
Free overnight rest area for self contained caravan E motorhome only.
Dump system for chemical toilets

name: Transwest Tyre and Auto
description:
Excellent customer service. Chris is the boss.
Big Rig down to small stuff.
Good prices.

name: Leading Computers. Carnarvon
description:
Excellent computer services for serious problems.
Gavin is the boss. Belfast lad!

name: Sip N Save Hotel
description: Yeah, the name sounds bad and it is a hotel over a bar but quite nice! Double room (for 2)was $60, clean with shared bathrooms (and quiet). Bar has food that looked good and drinks. Parked the motos out back off of the street, basic insta coffee/toast for breakfast or full breakfast for $ downstairs (there is a fridge, electric kettle and microwave in the upstairs breakfast room). A private cabin at the camp grounds will be $120. We were tired of the cold and wind and this was just fine for some seasoned overlanders:)

name: Fortescue Roadhouse
description: Quiet, flat tarmac area near the fuel station. No fees.

name: Gympie 5 Kms North
description: Off road 20 HR max stay. Near small lake. Nice and shaded. Some highway noise. Toilets

name: Boolboonda Tunnel
description: Sorry, coordinates are wrong for this place. Maps will show where the tunnel is.

name: Tilderodden Conservation Park
description: Big area on Burnett River. Ideal for a night or two. Fees apply (about $12 for two). Shade

name: Jack Coe Park
description: Area near a lovely baobab grove. Just a picnic area but large overnight parking area

name: Wambelong Campsite
description: Part of Warrumbungle NP. Nice place on creek. Quiet. Shade. OK for big rigs. $6pp $8 per vehicle per night.

name: 2 Kms West Of Hermidale
description: Big off road area behind toilet block at rest area. Away from road enough traffic noise muted. Plenty of firewood. 44kms west of Nyngan. Rail line nearby, don't expect too much noise from that. Flat area

name: Louth. On West Side Of River
description: Nice area on west side of Darling River. Shaded. Small town with a pub nearby. Ask about the cross in the cemetery while here. Well worth visiting when sun setting.

name: Near Lock 9. Murray River
description: Big area near boat ramp just before the lock. Turn left at boat ramp sign. Bit rough getting in and would be awkward in wet weather. Areas all along river. Lovely spot. 10kms off highway 9 of which are good gravel. Part of Murray-sunset NP.

name: Old boat ramp near Salt Creek
description: About 1km north of Policeman Point/Coorong hotel. Track on south of road heads off about 3kms to seldom used boat ramp. track entrance is hard to see, use Google maps to navigate to this point. No problems in wet weather getting here. In a large clearing just before a disused boat ramp. a small amount of reception, no facilities. 2wd ok but there is some shrubs growing in the middle of the track you need to drive with one wheel in the middle of the track on the shrubs and one wheel off the side of the track. walk or drive a minute to end of track for better views.

name: South of Goolgowi
description: Off road large area near Goolgowi. No facilities but traffic noise shouldnt be too bad. Free. All weather.

name: Ullaroo Campground
description: Part of NP. Lovely place on ocean shore. Changing over to a booking only setup with National Parks. At moment ok to drop in. Manager on site. $12 per head plus fee for vehicle if not NP member. Minnie Waters village nearby. Iffy mobile reception. OK if you walk to top of nearby hill and stand on edge of cliff. Dont fall over

name: swan river riverside
description: nice park on the Riverside with water, toilets, barbecue and playing area.

name: Infocenter campground
description:
Tarmac parking spots. overnight allowed for self-contained vehicles. 
hot shower, toilets, playground and skatepark. FREE WiFi not reaching to the car.

name: poncaarie Campsite
description: wild Campsite close to the village. lot of place on both sides of the river.

name: toilets and water
description: toilets, water and cold shower available here

name: poncaarie fuel station
description:
146$ unleaded and 156$ diesel 13/03/2020
sandwich, coffee and others available

name: wildcamp
description: Wildcamp with a lot of flys close to a lake but it was dry in march.

name: Grenfel Company Dam
description: Sheltered area by the small lake. Grass/sand. Some distant road noise. Surrounded by trees but open. Nice spot.

name: Gravel pit
description: A large flat gravel storage area just off the road. 40 km east of Kimba.

name: rest area
description: rest area in gravel between broken hill and Silverton where you can visit the mad Max museum!

name: Wildcamp in the middle of cows Field!
description: Wildcamp in the middle of cows Field and not too far from the road. nothing but some trees to shelter you

name: fuel
description: village with 2 fuel stations, water and shower. you have shops and bars too

name: hermit's cave
description: an Italian went live here back in the 20's. he took this mountain whith senic view for home.

name: narrandera camps
description: you have different campground around the town. some with toilets, some close to the beach.

name: Beach toilets
description: Little beach with a playground and toilets with water

name: Ivanhoe Camp Site
description: $15pppn unpowered. Well maintained, great pool, near town centre.

name: North Head campground
description: free Campsite on the coast in the murramarang national park. entrance is following a dirt track from the A1. fair few sites to choose from and stunning beach at only a few minutes walk.

name: Mulgowie Hall
description:
Open campground. Quiet place. Electric spots. Nice hot shower.

AUD 15 unpowered per night
AUD 20 powered per night

You need to contact caretaker but there's no phone number at the sign. Just stayed for one night

name: Hughenden
description: truck park. Large tarmac, flat area on edge of town. Quiet, nice view.

name: Stanthorpe Wild Olto
description:
Path next to the road which leads to different spots where you can wild camp and find shadow between the trees.

Stayed a few nights sleeping inside the car. Really quiet

name: Mundubbera Rest Stop
description:
Rest stop just north out of Mundubbera town.

You can park overnight.
Toilets, tables and BBQ
Good for one or two nights

name: Fly creek Campsite
description: wild camp site, located next to river. do not swim crocodiles

name: Moses rock
description: Car Park, but nobody came to bother me! Great to spend the night. On the beach, beautiful spot!

name: Wilbinga Dunes
description: By the beach. Free off road camping spot in the dunes locals use it as well for fishing. No facilities!!!

name: Established Campsite
description: Nice campsite, very nice showers and toilets. Kitchen available. 10 dollars for a tent.

name: House beach Camping
description: It does take a bit of effort to get here but once you do is just wonderful. Great spot over a stunning beach. Only a drop toilet available so come prepared!!!3g signal avaliable but spartan.

name: Kalgoorlie Rest stop
description: Got here late and we decided to stay although it suppose to be for self contained vehicles only. We have a rooftop tent. There are bathrooms 24 hour open so we had no problems. Quite at night

name: Pinnacles Desert
description: Part of the National Park. This is the 4 km drive around the pinnacles. Park entrance fee needed. 17AU$ or the National Park Pass. Worth it!!!

name: Miligan's Island
description: A community manage basic camp spot with a long drop toilet and some picnic tables. No water but is close to a really nice beach. It was free when we were here although a ranger comes by and colects a 15 $ fee

name: Stockyard Cave
description: A spectacular Cave and a nice side trip if you are in the area. 4wd needed in the last 5 km.

name: Lake Indoon Rest Camp
description: Free camp site next to the lake with toilets and showers as well as the classic Australian barbecues pitts.

name: Dongara Tourist Park
description: Nice campground with all the necessary amenities and a bit cheaper than the other campgrounds near by. Good fast WiFi in all locations. Laundry, kitchen etc.

name: private cold showers in cubicles
description: Next to scateboard Park in toilets. Private cold showers

name: Yarrawonga Point
description: 4x4 track, sign posted. Large, very pretty camping area. Quiet in week, busy with Mackay locals at weekend. Whales come in very close at right time of year.

name: Lucky Bay Camp site
description: At the edge of the dunes this basic camp run by the Rangers has basic long drop toilet and some tables. No water or any other facilities so come prepared

name: camping in small clearing
description: Camping in small clearing. Junction between the marked road and some unused forestry tracks which are overgrown. Managed to find a flat spot for sleeping in my car. 10 mins from the sealed road. Tiny bit of telstra reception for calls and slow internet

name: Banks of Lachlan River
description: Perfect spot on high banks of river off the gravel road called the Lachlan Valley Way following the river.  Find dirt track into the trees, many spots to choose from.  Plenty of firewood and crazy birdlife in the trees.

name: Blue Dolphin Caravan Park
description: A bit rundown but still functional right at the entrance of the village. Most sites are protected from the wind. Friendly owner. We paid 40 AU$ something that we found a bit much as with the same money you can pay in the further down camp with much better facilities

name: Cape Peron
description: Lookout of the Northern part of Cape Peron. Takes an hour to get here with minimum 4x4 skills.

name: lookout south bound (Mt pleasant)
description: Lookout on side of road heading south. Could get a bit windy. No no camping signs

name: Bewong Rest Area North Bound
description: Rest area on North bound side of Hwy. Can be accessed from north by pulling into fuel station and then turning around. Right on the road but it's not that busy

name: North Kiama Rest Area (north bound)
description: Just off the highway has flushing toilets and a sink with tap. Not too noisy

name: Footlights theatre camping ground
description:
Quiet, pretty, friendly and helpful owners. Lovely pool, loos clean, easy walk to town. AUD 20 unpowered, power available.
Best stop in Yeppoon

name: South Gregory
description: One more spot inside the National Park were camping is permited. Basic facilities and long drop toilets. Exept the pass to get in you need to pay 11$ pp and you can camp in any of the 4 campgrounds. Mobile 4G was fuctioning here.

name: Waldron Swamp Rest Area South Bound
description: Rest area on side of Hwy. Some highway noise. Separate truck and car parking

name: Broulee Rd Rest Area North Bound
description: North bound side of highway, accessible in both directions

name: Jerrawangala Rest Area South Bound
description: Rest area on south bound side. Has an exit lane. Can be accessed if heading north by doing a u turn only. Right on highway

name: Betty's Beach Campsite
description: Nice little spot next to the beach with a few designated lots. Toilets available. No paybox or ranger on site, so it was free

name: Beach parking lot
description: spent the night on the parking lot. Very quiet. There is a bbq and toilets and showers available to the beachgoers

name: Beach Carpark
description: Parking lot for beachgoers. Van is out of sight. Spent the night here on several occasions when in Albany. No amenities, so sleeping only!

name: Playground Carpark
description: Slept in my van at this public carpark as there are no signs. BBQs and public toilets nearby. 4G signal

name: Street Carpark
description: Quiet spot in a street parking lot in a residential area

name: Overflow car park
description: This parking lot next to Maccas is pretty secluded. No signs whatsoever. Probably much better spot than the other one in the city. Free WiFi at Macca's

name: Back beach carpark
description: Small parking lot for beachgoers. No signs and no facilities available. Nice place to watch the sunrise

name: Quiet spot end of road
description: Plenty if space at the end of this undeveloped road. 4G reception. Just be aware of the kangaroos when driving in/out, there is heaps around!

name: Edrom Rd Rest Area North & South Bound
description: Right on the Hwy. Pretty level. Pit toilet. Great reception. The northbound side of the road is much more level.

name: Scrubby Creek Rest Area
description: 700m off road in state forest. Northbound side of road. fire rings, picnic tables, pit toilet. not too much road noise. about a 2 min drive from the highway on a good road. re-opened after the fires a few years ago

name: Dry Creek Quaama Rest Area. South Bound
description: Right on highway. Pit toilets. Fairly level. decent place to stay the night

name: Quaama Rest Area North Bound
description: Right on highway. Pit toilets. Fairly Level.

name: Kiola Rest Area
description: In state forest no facilities. Hard to see from road.

name: Kiama Bends Information Bay
description: Off the highway. No facilities. Fairly level.

name: Wallagaraugh Rest Area
description: North bound side of road. Pit toilet. Tables.

name: Wonboyn beach
description: This is the furthest access point for this beach. There is one at the south as you drive in. There's a few nice short walks at this end. Rough road in some clearance needed. Could be slippery after rain.

name: Free warm showers
description: In toilet black at Eden warf. You will see the shower signs.

name: Pambula Historic Mines
description: Camping in the state forest. Need AWD with medium clearance to get in the rough road. Lots of exploring around the historic Gold mines. No facilities

name: Horseshoe bend of Darling River
description: Stunning spot to camp on Darling River. There's a faint dirt track to the left just before a cattle grid a couple of kms past the park's formal campground if you're coming from Wilcannia. Follow the track 3-4 kms along fence until you hit the river. A little effort but a huge reward.

name: Darling River campsite
description: Another great place to camp on the banks of the river. Follow dirt track off main road which weaves back to the river.

name: Tilpa Weir
description:
Multiple places to camp at Tilpa Weir. Follow clearly signposted track down to water. Picnic tables but that's it.  Good campsites for 4wd access along the river if you follow the tracks. 
Check the river levels. Darling river is dry / near dry in drought years.

name: Gas refill @ Mitre 10
description: Gas bottle refills at Mitre 10. They have the camping 3/8 fitting plus POL for bigger 4.5/9kg bottles.

name: Town water tap
description: Tap with town water for drinking. At the Jindera lookout.

name: Wyndham General Store
description: ULP and diesel. A bit expensive restricted hours. General supplies also.

name: Big Jack Rest Area
description: Parking on side of dirt road. Drop toilets and picnic table.

name: Rocky Hall Park
description: Small park on dirt road. Has a picnic table. On a creek. Be careful with fires, lots of dry leaves and grass around. No facilities.

name: Coral bay/ Bayview Caravan park
description: This is your second option in Coral bay. Sites are big and have all the amenities. The whole of coral bay was full of people as we were in school holiday here. A bit to much for our taste and pricey at 48$AU for unpowered site. Apart from that though was an ace!!!

name: A bend in the Darling
description: Great place to camp on the high banks of the Darling.  Follow well  used track off road just north of a little bridge.  Go back about 1 km to the river.  Very quiet and still.

name: Bombala Caravan Park
description: Powered site $22 for 2 people extra person $6. Maximum of 1 tent or camper van. Very hot showers. on the river (with possible platypus sightings at dawn and dusk) no fires. very clean. IGA supermarket in town.

name: Leather Barrel Creek Rest Area/Camping
description: Either side of the road. on a nice Creek with rapids. drop toilet. free. no phone reception. National Park entry frees

name: Tom Groggin Rest Area/Camping
description: National Park entry fees, free camping. no reception on. drop toilets, fire places, on the Murray river. lots of space

name: Tom Groggin Horse Camp
description: by the Murray river, open farm area. park entry fees apply. free camping. pit toilet. no reception. Horse friendly

name: Geehi Flats Campground
description: National Park entry fees. free camping. lots of space. along a creek. drop toilets. 4x4 camping across the creek at the back of the campsite but closed seasonally and in wet weather. no phone reception

name: Geehi Horse Camp
description: National Park entry fees apply. free camping. down a dirt track. pit toilets no phone reception

name: Thredbo Diggings Campground
description: On the Thredbo river just past the national park pay station. free camping, park fees apply. pit toilets. Nice mountain views

name: Ngarigo Campsite
description: National Park entry fees apply. pit toilets. free camping. a few minutes off the sealed road.

name: Swift's Creek Caravan Park
description: Council caravan park on the creek. a gem of a place. un-powered $16 per night per site. $20 key deposit. Hot showers and laundry - wash $5 dry $3. Under cover seating and fire places. Pay on arrival at local IGA (see other listing). Good phone reception, its on the other side of the creek to the town.

name: Swift Creek IGA Xpress (caravan park payment)
description: Go here to book and pay for the caravan park. if you call they can give availability. The shop has most groceries and a few camping and hardware items at the back

name: Information Center
description: Good information Center for the area and for Cape Range National Park. You can book campgrounds and arrange entrance here as well.

name: Marlay Point Camping
description: Free camping on the lake. flushing toilets. no fire signs, but a shelter which has a fire place and allows fires. max 48h per month. see photos for other camping locations to try out. mosquitos are here. It's winter and they were crazy for around 2 hours at sunset. there is phone reception. there's a donation box in the shelter.

name: Swing Bridge Reserve
description: Camping on the river near the historic bridge. it's a dead end road no facilities

name: Camp 12
description: Camp 12. It has minor views of the water and a pit toilet. Free camping. 2 Min walk to beach. Lots of mozzies! Byo fire wood and water. Phone reception

name: Dump free
description: Free dump in front of toilet block. Has a hose for washing the area Down

name: Hot Showers $4
description:
2x $2 coins for 5 Min hot shower
2/7/2020 still closed due to corona virus

name: River View Near swing bridge
description: There was a caravan at the swing bridge running a generator so I parked here instead. Nice river views. No services good phone reception. Not for camping just overnight parking. A few locals use this dead end road

name: Bundaberg CMCA RV park
description:
Council run. Level ground. self contained vehicles & caravan only. Dump point. Aud15 pppn.
Visitors meet for a sundowner at 4pm. very pleasant.
Short walk to Also, Coles, wworths, town.

name: Rest Area
description: No facilities, but it's an established rest area so overnight rests are fine. Keep the place clean. 10 mins to the east are toilets at Franklin River reserve, but camping was banned there thanks to messy people and complaints from local caravan parks (its in the local paper)

name: Rest Area
description: Vic Roads rest area, so you can rest but not set up camp. Has flushing toilets. If you go to the back and left there's a nice picnic table. Good phone reception. Free

name: Truck Parking @ United
description: A new servo. Currently the 2nd half of the premesis is vacant. Lots of parking including truck size spaces. 24hr toilets

name: Hot Shower
description: Free hot shower in public toilet next to Coast guard at the boat ramp reserve. No overnight stays currently allowed. Gold coin honesty box for parking

name: Noosa Sea Scouts
description: Excellent location, centre of town, 15aud pppn, max 35$. Grass, shade, clean ablutions, no power to sites.

name: 5 Mile bend camping
description: Wild camping on the Murray River. 1 min drive to the east is the day use area with toilets and boat ramp. No camping permitted there

name: Hot Shower free
description: Free hot show at info center. Gold coin donation. 1x male 1x female and 1x disabled shower

name: Balranald Rest Stop
description: Large open area at a highway Junction. Service station across the road. Has a pit toilet. Some truck noise at night. Free hot shower in the town see other pin. Has phone reception

name: Free Hot Shower
description:
Free hot shower at Mungo NP visitors center. They are always low on water as there isn't much rainfall out here. Your better off going to the free hot shower at balnarald. 
1/7/2020 NP Entry $8

name: Mungo Main Camp
description:
Mungo Main camp. Drop toilets. Showers at the info center. Fire places. Byo wood. Park & camping fees payable
9/7/20 NP $8 per car/day camping $12 pp/night

name: Mungo lookout
description: This is the most accessible lookout for the wall of China, although you are better off doing the short drive to the walls lookout (approx 10km each way) or the 70km loop road. You have to pay Park fees to go further in you can pay at the office near here

name: Belah Camp
description:
Drop toilet. Half way round the 70km driving loop.
9/7/20 book online only camping $6pp/night park $8 per car/day
Hot showers at visitors center but they don't have much water so your better off going to Balranald.

name: Kandanga
description:
Village green/centre camping area, shade available. Public look across the road, shop does take away meals, post office.
Drop some cash in the donations box, max stay is 72 hours.

name: Port Macquarie Service Center
description: Close to highway. 24hr flushing clean toilets. Lots of space. No signs prohibiting overnight/long periods of parking. Quiet near the trucks

name: Point Plommer Campground
description:
NP entry and camping fees apply, book online. Excellenct walks around the headland. Best views ever. Minimal phone reception.
15/7/2020 Park entry $8 camping $ 24 per site (2 people)

name: Cold shower in national Park toilets
description: If you have a NSW national parks pass you can use the camping shower as a day visitor. It's cold but this area is great to visit. Otherwise entry is $8 (2020)

name: New Italy Rest Area
description: Its a few meters off the highway so pretty quiet at night. Big car parking area but a bit of a slope. Has flush toilets and dish washing area. Also a Cafe and gift shop. Donation for facility use - volunteer run. Dam water (non-drinkable) some phone reception. Some grass/bush area for tents at the back away from the new Italy buildings. A popular stop before Byron Bay, which has no free camping

name: Chocolate Coated Bananas
description: Frozen Chocolate Coated Bananas usually with peanuts, coconut or 100s and 1000s. $2.50 each. Lookin the freezer. Dont get ripped off at the big banana, come here. You need correct change for the box. Accessible from both directions on the highway. In babana season you can get bananas here or further up the road at farm road side stalls

name: Roses Park Rest Area
description: Best free camping close to Dorrigo. Lots of level spots. Popular with campervan and caravans. Tents too. Flushing toilets. Fires OK. General store next door. Good phone reception. Gold coin donation to maintain facilities. Max stay 48hrs

name: Hot Shower $1 for 4 mins
description: Hot Showers in the Dorrigo show ground at camping area. $1 for 4 mins. If you want to camp here check the Ray white Dorrigo website for booking and price info

name: Dump point
description: This road looks like it belonga to the caravan park but it also takes you to water front parking. As you turn off the main road you will see a dump station on the left with a big sign. It doesn't say anything about caravan park users only.

name: Kempsey Service Station
description: 24hr toilets. Lots of car and truck parking. Room for caravans and big rigs. Fairly Level. Lots of fast food. Only maccas and fuel are 24hr

name: Free cold shower in cubicle
description: Free cold shower in cubicle. (separate male and female) You have to drive past the camping toilets x 2 (they have hot showers and pin code entry) this is a day use only toilet block. Free national park entry. Excellent views and picnic areas

name: Free Dump point
description: Free dump point next to day use toilets. Free park entry

name: Smoke Cape Camping
description:
Drop toilet, close to beach.
Book online
20/12/2020 car entry $8 camping adult $6 child $3.50

name: Highway overnight stop
description: No facilities,by a small creek.They were other people here when we arrive, so it must be known overnight free camp outside Tom Price. Some noise from the road near by.

name: Shell Gas station
description: Behind the gas station there is an open area for overnight but you can stay longer if you want. Toilets and Showers are free. There is a Coles Express in the gas station if you need small things. There is a bit of noise from the Road trains running on the hiway

name: Karatha Caravan Park
description: Powered sites only, but has free laundry and a small selfservice restaurant here. 40$ per site. Mostly targeting to people that work in the area but a great overnight stay if you wanna regroup after a week in the outback.

name: Pardoo Station
description: A really great place to stay and break your trip if you are heading to Brome. This is a working cattle station that has a very organized caravan park. All amenities are present. It also has a small store with some essentials. 40$ for powered sites. It also has a pool in case you feel like taking a deep

name: Cable Beach Caravan Park
description: Big sites with shade. Well maintained amenities and a nice swimming pool. Nice cafe/restaurant in entrance. One street back from the beach. 48AU$ for powered sites.

name: Car park of Mid Western Regional Council
description: We decided to head to Mudgee last minute for an NRL country trial game and there wasnt any accomodation or camping availability anywhere in town. We pulled up in the car park of the Mid Western Regional Council, there are toilets across the road. We put up our roof top tent and headed to the game. It was nice and quiet and no one bothered us all night

name: William Creek Perl farm
description: Free camp area by the pearl farm. No facilities and maximum stay is 3 nights. During work hours you can use the WC of the restaurant.

name: Barred Creek
description: There are a number of spots here overlooking the beautiful beach but there is no amenities at all so you need to be 100% self-sufficient. Some sporadic 4G on Telstra

name: One tree reach wetland
description: A newly developed area. 100m board walk to wetland viewing. A 400m walk through the bush. Lots of birds

name: Gunbarnun
description: Comunity based bush camp with toilets and basic showers. Nothing special but cheaper than the other organized camps on the penisula

name: Beach near Hawks Nest NSW
description: 4wd beach driving permitted. Camping was allowed but NSW parks pass needed.

name: Minshull Mechanic Repairs
description: This is a rather expensive mechanic that will try to bring up jobs in order to gain more money out of you. Do not fall on his lie. Go in and ask him to do exactly what you want

name: Mill Creek Campsite
description: Camping fees apply, within national park. Free park entry. Sites start at around $24 minimum which includes 2 people per night. Gas bbqs, composting toilet and fire places. Minimal phone reception. Book online see url.

name: Boab Cottage
description:
This is Rob 's cottage that will alow you to camp as well in his place for 30AU$ per vehicle. You need to contact him one day ahead. It is a good price compare to the caravan parks in the area. Rob can also help you with what you need as he knows Broome well
Boab cottage 
0417907161
Rob Beckett
68 Lullfitz Drive, Bilingurr, WA, 6725
Sands street

name: Lennard River Rest Area
description: Nice Area for a couple of nights by the river.  No facilities but worth to stay if you are self sufficient

name: Imintji Camp
description: A camp on the road next to the gas station. No power and expensive at 34AU$. Facilities are new but not taken care off. We stayed here because of a breakdown. Would not recommend it.

name: Frog Creek
description: A nice free camp next to the creek. No facilities but plenty of wood around.It must be popular as a lot of people roam up for the night!!!Please make sure you take all garbage on your way out

name: Hann River Rest Area
description: Another great wild camping on the Gib river Road. No amenities. bush camp by the river. Not possible to camp in wet season.

name: Sandy Creek campsite
description: In Meryla state forest. From Moss Vale make your way to Meryla Rd, then follow it for 30 mins (dirt road) you will cross 2 concrete bridges and then a timber bridge. The camp-site is just after a level water crossing (hard rock base, shallow) mostly on the right side of the road, 1 spot on the left just make sure you don't block the track. 4x4 needed to get into left side (small area) for right side drive past camp site and turn around and drive up the easy slip road. See photo for river crossing. No facilities or phone reception. Free. I tried to drive south east from the site to Fitzroy Falls but the mud puddles were too big for my AWD. Definitely 4x4 for these roads south of here. 2wd access from Moss Vale.

name: Roadside pull out
description: Pull out on side of road with a view. Small amount of reception. No facilities. The odd motorbike will pass during the day.

name: Purnululu visitor center
description: This is your first stop in Bungle Bungle where you need to register and pay entrance fees if you do not have the anual pass. When we were here it was closed so we fill up the form on the entrance

name: Echidna Chasm
description: Top attraction in the Bungle Bungle park. No camping allowed. Beautiful 3 km return walk through. Some lunch tables and sade in the parking.

name: Lake Pamamaroo - Menindee
description:
Great campsites along the lake front.
The lake doesnt always have water, but when it does these are and excellent stop.

Telstra 4G available

name: Peawah 24 Hour Rest Stop
description: 24 hour rest stop with pit toilets and RV waste dump site, no water or phone signal.

name: Mount Robinson 24h Roadside Campsite
description: Barely roadside campsite in the shadows of Mount Robinson with strong 3G Telstra reception

name: Pender Bay Escape
description: Half a bush camp and half a caravan park this community based camp is paradise. You need to make an effort to drive the 25 sandy bumpy road to here, but when you arrive you are rewarded with magnificent clifftop campsites with fire pit and a isolated beach to yourself . Amenities are a bit far from the sites but they are all in good condition. 4g avaliable. You need to email them prior your arrival  penderbay@bigpond.com

name: Casurina Campground
description: free camping in the state forest. has pit toilets. lots of space but can get busy on weekends. pets welcome. 2wd dirt road in

name: Turpentine campground
description: free camping in state forest. no facilities but lots of space, but you have to hunt around for a level spot. it's quieter than the other campgrounds due to lack of toilet, but it's close to Casuarina and the pines so you can hear a bit of loud vehicles noise.

name: The pines campground
description: free camping in the state forest. pit toilets and space for fires. pets welcome. gets very busy on the weekend. I moved to Turpentine on the weekend (with no facilities) and it was worth it. no reception

name: Patchys Auto Electrics
description: Great Auto electrician. Fixed our aircon on the spot for a very reasonable price. Fair pricing and good work!

name: Barn hill Station
description: Well establish campground on the cliff overlooking a beautiful bay. Part of a working station with plenty of shade and very friendly staff. A small canteen is also operated. No booking needed.

name: Otway Gate Motel
description: A great budget motel. Clean, newly renovated room with comfortable bed, a toaster, kettle and a microwave in the room and cups, plates and cutlery available if you ask at reception. Supermarket near by. Rooms start at $100AUD. Good value.

name: Ocean view Caravan Park
description: This is the municipality caravan park. It has a new and an older section. Well run, very clean and right at the end of the town. Your best bet in Onslow. Amenities are new and very clean. Wonderful sunrise and sunsets.

name: Pipers Glen Resort
description: Cabins and camping right by the lake boats available

name: RAC Exmouth
description: Typical RAC caravan park with large sites and great amenities. All though big it still has sites side by side,so not that great privacy. They just open a new section here with swimming pool, great kitchen and games room. We Recommended it for sure as it is the best on the area!!

name: Red Bluff
description: Campsite, on the beach. A few trees for a shady spot. Long drop toilet. Pizza shop open most days, but very basic camp site with beautiful views

name: Mesa Camp
description: Another camp managed by the Park& Wild life Australia. Basic but clean drop toilets is the only amenity . Booking is mandatory. Some trees for shade and direct access to the beach. Telstra reception. 45km from Exmouth. 11AU$ pp

name: The Junction Caravan Park
description: Great place to stop for the night after or on the way to Mt Augustus or Kennedy Range NP. All amenities are new and well taken care off. The pub has great food cooked by chef Omo. Worth to try!!

name: Fruit Fly Exclusion
description: no fruit permitted west of here. bin provided. usually unmanned but you can be stopped by officials on the road

name: Fruit Fly inspection point
description: make sure when heading west you throw out your fruit before you get here. you can be stopped for a vehicle search

name: lake front camping and highway rest area
description: free camping lake front. flushing toilets and non potatable/drinkable water. phone reception

name: hot shower
description: free hot showers as long as you are a customer at the fuel station. Press the buzzer on the front door of the toilet block and the service station attendant will let u in.

name: SA border
description:
No fruit, vegetables, plants or grapevine allowed past. 

30/9/2020 you need to apply online with SA police prior to crossing. 

Coming from Mildura it's 50km of dirt road to get here. It's another 40km of dirt on the SA side and the quality is worse. The road is closed in the wet

name: Rest Area
description:
On south bound side. 
No toilets but flat and has a light on all night l. 
Under cover picnic table. Phone reception. Looks like some options of camping off the road if you have 4x4. 
Better views on the other side but no toilet spots

name: Rest next to the vineyard
description:
North Bound side of road. Rest area next to vineyard. A bit of highway noise but a shady tree next to covered picnic table and great views. 
I stayed on both sides, the other side is better for calls from nature. 
This side is a great place to stay after a big day at Banrock winery 5 mins away.

name: Avoset Campground
description: in Coorong NP. a small amount of water views. no facilities they are 2km away. 6 sites. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: Pelican Campground
description: in Coorong NP. no facilities. some sites are water front.toilets 1km away. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: free dump point
description: outside the rv area. has wash hose also (bore water) drinking water nearby

name: potable/drinking water.
description: free. outside rv area. see photo for location

name: Oystercatcher campsites
description: 4x campsites in Coorong NP. no facilities, close to water. summer access only to beach via salt water wetland crossing. phone reception. 2wd access. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: Malleefowl campsites
description: 5x campsites in Coorong NP. no facilities and no views. very basic. phone reception. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: Sandpiper campsites
description: 5x campsites. no facilities or views. phone reception. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: Hooded Plover campsites
description: 8x sites. no facilities. walk across the road to lake and 2 mins down the road to public toilets. no toilets in campsites. phone reception. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: Herald bight
description: Camping right on the beach with stunning views. No facilities. Fees apply on honesty box in the entrance of the park. You need to deflate your tyres as sand is realy soft in parts

name: Long Point
description: 5x sites in Coorong NP. Free park entry. Drop toilet. Most sites have views. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site. Reserve and pay online. 2wd access on graded dirt road

name: Kartoo Rd
description: 7x sites scattered along this 4x4 track. Numbered from north to south. No facilities. In Coorong NP free park entry. 4x4 high clearance ideal. If you're driving a medium clearance 4x4 SUV you will need to drive with one wheel in the middle of the track for about 75% of the track. There are some bog holes after rain. The pin on the map is site 5. No phone reception. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: Kartoo Rd campsite 1 & 2
description: This has to be the best site of them all. The road in is extremely boggy. I wouldn't set up a tent here because the potential for it to be blown away is high. See other Kartoo Rd location for the rest of the info. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site. Reserve and pay online

name: Mark Point
description: 2x sites next to a boat ramp. Awesome views but can get windy. In Coorong NP free park entry. Some reception. No facilities.can get too windy for tents. 1/10/2020 $16.50 per site - book and pay online

name: John Batten Hall
description: A 24-hour stop on the beachfront with public toilets and 2 showers on the ladies side. No tents allowed. Nice and quite neighborhood.Great overnight option.

name: Dump point
description:
Free dump point at BP Petrol Station, next to car wash. 
There is trailer parking.

name: BP Truck Stop
description: Parking on the truck side of the servo, just be mindful that truck drivers are trying to manoeuvre big rigs. There is the usual refrigeration engines running. At this pin there isn't too much light. There's 24hr toilets, WiFi near the building, Oporto and wok in a box. Also a caravan dump point. Beats $40 a night at the nearby caravan park if your on the road and looking for something simple. There is showers in the truckers lounge, I didn't enquire about the price for non truck customers.  1/10/2020 I downloaded the OTR app and they gave me a free coffee.. Not bad.

name: Moura River Park
description: Moura River Park is a great camp to relax right by the river. To stay here just put a few coins into the donation box which is attached to the amenities building. The money goes towards maintaining this beautiful place. Telstra and Optus service does work here.There are showers and toilets, drinking water is not available. We have seen a lot of people swimming in the river. Bins are provided and emptied regular. Enjoy this beautiful place and keep it clean.

name: Riverland fruit quarantine
description: Heading north out of Adelaide, you are not allowed to bring fruit and vegetables past this point. Random inspections

name: Holder Bend
description: Free camping on the Murray, no facilities. Signposted from highway. Road inside the campsite can get very boggy. Great river views. Some ambient highway noise. 5 mins from highway. 7 day limit. Concrete boat Ramp into Murray River provided. Good phone reception

name: Maize Island
description: Free camping along the Murray bank in Maize Island Lagoon conservation Park. Fishing and bird watching opportunities. 2WD access but can get boggy. No pets permitted

name: Drinking water - drive thru
description: Drive thru drinking water - 5 m from dump point. Also rubbish bins

name: dump point
description: Drive thru dump point. Also rubbish bins and potable water.

name: Under the bridge
description: Camping on the Murray River under the bridge. There is traffic noise and the road gets boggy after rain. There are other camping options if you explore. No facilities. If driving east, the road is on your left just after the bridge, slow down on the bridge.

name: Lake Victoria outlet
description: Free camping on the east and west sides of the outlet. Picnic tables. Toilets on western side. Bird watching. Lots of birds if water is being released. Minimal phone reception.

name: Free dump point
description: In the camping park outside toilets. Can pull up and drive through.

name: Drinking water
description: Few metres down from the dump point. Drive through.

name: Badcoe VC rest area
description: A great place to watch the sun set over the lake. No facilities however and I have realised that the best option is head to Gurney rest/camp area after sunset. Both these locations can be accessed in both directions on the free way. Watch out for big mozzies.

name: Gurney Camp
description: This place is way bigger than it looks on the satellite view. Lots of room although you need to hunt around for a flat spot. Lots of room for tents. There's 2x picnic tables and a drop toilet. Wineries near by and excellent sunrise/sunset viewing 2ks south at badcoe rest area. This place can be accessed from any direction on the highway. Medium 4G reception. It's a decent distance of around 100m from the free way but there is still some noise.

name: Jack Harrisson Park, Wappa Falls Dam
description: an absolute gem, quite small park surrounded by dam with lots of happy wild life. Gates close over night

name: Wappa Falls Dam outlet
description: swimming holes in creek depending on water level of dam, paved steep descent to small car park, one of the very few freshwater swim options

name: Yandina free RV Stopover
description: free RV stopover, tolerated camp spot, toilets, cafes and pub close by, train tracks next by

name: Moura Rotary Park
description: This is a great spot for a few days to explore the township, surrounding area and stock up on supplies. There is a BBQ, undercover seating area, rubbish bins, toilets as well as a water tap on the side of the building. Overnight  stays are only $5 payable at the Mitre 10 store 2min walk.  There are many attractions in and around town Google it, enjoy your stay.

name: Great bush camp by the lake
description: This is a great bushcamp by the lake. No facilities, must be self contained, any human waste should be cleaned up and buried, any rubbish should be taken back and fires extinguished before leaving. This is a place with lots of wildlife enjoy. Telstra and Optus service does work here.

name: Nash Bay
description: Part of the Sandy Cape campground area but away from the other campers,this secluded bay was perfect hideout. A bit rock crawling to get to but with 25psi on your tires you will be good as gold

name: RAC Caravan Park
description: A Great spot in Cervantes by the beach. Has all the camping amenities and they are all kept clean and well maintained. Ask for promotions for longer than a night stay. In the price you get the bonus of use off the heated pool.

name: Lazy Labyrinth
description: This is a great bushcamp on private property. It is a very clean and quiet place with plenty of firewood and fire pits provided All that is asked for is a $5 donation per vehicle for the upkeep of this beautiful place. There are also some fully self contained airconditioned cabins available. This is a great place enjoy.

name: Desert Oaks Rest Area
description:
Free camping on the side of the highway. Nice shady spots next to trees, toilets and bins as well as drinking water available. Fires permitted. 
Please clean up after yourselves :)

name: Canning Stock and Gunbarrel Visitors Center
description: The old hospital has been converted into a visitor center and also offers a place to overnight. Self contained vehicles only. They allow you to use their facilities when the Visitor Center is open

name: Leonora Caravan Park
description: Small well run caravan park in the town of Leonora. Some permanent campers and mine workers. Basic but clean. There is another free option in the museum outside the town but you must be self contained.

name: Near Belmore Falls
description: A medium size clearing near the turn off the Belmore Falls. Picnic tables, toilet and lookouts nearby at the Belmore Falls precinct. Flat parking area, quiet for overnight parking. Not the kind of place where you set up a camp. The national park status isn't clear so don't bring pets.

name: Belmore Falls lookout with swimming
description: Away from the tourists there is a short track to a lookout at the top of the Falls. 2 Min walk to the lookout. To get to the lookout find the track next to the creek where the road crosses it. Swimming in the clean Creek next to the road. Space to picnic by the river next to the parking on the side of the road but you would get your feet wet if you park here as you need to cross the creek to get to the Falls lookout. Free

name: Wave Rock Caravan Park
description: Great simple camping under Wave Rock. All the amenities present. You can walk to the Rock from the camp as well as tackle any other of the nice walks in the surrounding area.

name: Baden Powell Scout Camp
description:
Beautiful park on the edge of the village. Basic and clean facilities. Koalas, bird life. Caretakers are friendly and helpful. 
Pay AUD20 to become a 'member', then AUD 14 powered with water.
Stayed here for a covid19 month. Cycle 10km to train for Brisbane, 1km to shops.
Excellent MTB track park for mountain bike enthusiasts very near by.

name: Bayview
description:
dirt area at side of road located between two car parks.
Use car park between 7pm and 7am for overnight in a self contained vehicle.
Loo at the big car park

name: drinking water
description: drinking water at the back of the car yard

name: Rockdale, Sydney
description:
Quiet, 2 people AUD 40pn, 250 per week.
Small, well run, clean new ablutions.

name: servo and rest area north bound
description: 24hr toilets, lots of room to park overnight. A big grassy area. Not too close to the highway. Northbound only

name: free shower nth bound
description: Out the back of the servo in the temporary toilets. It's in the disabled toilet.

name: 7th day Adventist Camp
description: Church and government run small camp ground among the 5 or 6 in a row in this area. Good clean amenities and in a great price of 22$ with power included. Right on the beach.

name: Snowry River Holiday Park
description: Lovely place with camp kitchen, showers and lots of green space. Wi-Fi with no password. Located on the Snowy River with Platypus in the river next to the park.$25 for unpowered. Suitable for all overlanders. Pub and general store in town.

name: Eaglehawk neck layby
description: A nice little dead end road overlooking the sea. Sheltered from the main road by trees. Only suitable for fully independent travellers. Not suitable for wild toileting. Stayed one night.

name: Fish Waste Bin
description: Recycle fish waste here. Goes to compost

name: Lake Front
description: Parking spot right on the lake. 2wd dry weather access. no facilities. Minimal reception. Drop toilet 5 mins away at picnic site. No fishing permitted. Don't use access via spotted gum Rd - it's blocked off.

name: Port Kembla pool
description:
Free entry during opening hours. You need to enter the toilet block from the pool side not the beach side. 2 out of 4 showers have warm water look for the big stainless steel box. The showers have doors. Usually open 6am-7pm.

https://www.wollongong.nsw.gov.au/explore/our-pools/pools/saltwater/port-kembla-pool

name: Off highway
description: No facilities, not visible from the road. Not too noisy at night. 10 min walk or 2 Min drive to rest stop toilets. Enter 100m south of here. look at satellite map. One you leave the highway keep right till you reach the spot. Perfect for a night. Full phone reception

name: Pink Lake Caravan Park
description: A typical family-orientated caravan park with small sites and at the high price range. With that said, it was well maintained with helpful staff. You are better off heading inside Cape Le Grand and stay in the Lucky bay Camping if Lucky bay is what you are after. All amenities are present here

name: Candelo Town rest area
description: Free camping in the middle of a quiet town. Toilets and water. No showers. Some limited local supplies. Flat and shaded parking. Donations welcome

name: Membinup (Daniels)beach
description: Another great spot for free camping in this bay. This comes with its own private beach access and it is protected from the wind. No facilities no 4G signal so come prepared

name: BP gastation
description: Great hot clean showers for 3,5AU$. Good value if you are on the road

name: 11 mile beach wild camping
description:
Beautiful spot just up on a little cliff, you can walk down to the beach if youre keen. There are no signs and no one drove past the 3 days weve been camping out here. 
4WD NEEDED & you should be self sufficient!! This spot is accessible by 4WD only. Youll have to head down a small sandy trail and follow the trail until you see the little parking bay. 
Dont forget to bring your water, please leave it as you find it!
PLEASE TAKE YOUR TRASH WITH YOU!

name: Cocklebiddy Roadhouse
description: Camp and overnight area next to the road house. Nothing more than a gravel parking with power hook ups,shower and toilets but still well maintained and with very helpfull staff.

name: 10km viewpoint
description: Plenty of camp space here but no facilities. It can get really windy but the views are worth it. Some Telstra signal but in 3G only.

name: Bp Caravan Park
description: Overnight area with in the cabins behind the gas station. Toilets and 2Au$ showers. 25AU$ per site is a bit overpriced but great option if you need it. Good wind  protection and Telstra 4G signal. There are also cheaper unpowered sites.

name: Eliston beach
description: Public Showers and toilets at the entrance of the beach. No hot water

name: Port Lincoln Caravan Park,North Shields
description: Nice tidy Caravan Park with big sites and all the typical amenities. The small shop in the frond it is well stock up in supplies in case you forget something. A bit wind as it is straight on the beach. Also has some cabins. 24AU$ for unpowered site

name: Fitzgerald Bay North
description: Great wild camp. A bit windy but good for overnight. Other spots around it as well

name: Goyder Rest stop
description: Great bush camp of the road. Plenty of wind protection and close to the turn of for Alligators Gorge. No facilities at all.

name: RV Park Moonta bay
description: This is an area for an overflow camping in Moonta bay. No facilities and if you want you have to give a donation at the tourist center. Good for overnight with some shaded sites. A bit dusty when it is windy. Shops in walking distance.

name: Bumbunga Pink Lake
description: The color of this salt lake changes. Usually it gets more pink in the summer and after or around sunset time. Great lunch stop, not that much pink though

name: Duncan Park
description: A gem we found by luck! This free camp spot has brand new toilets and a small barbecue and dish washing area. You can use it as a dase to explore the Wineries of the area.

name: Point Clinton Caravan Park
description: Beautiful place to stop. very clean and friendly staff

name: Tarlee
description: Another great area to camp for free with clean toilets and drinking water available. On the main road so during daytime hours you can hear the traffic. Allowed to stay up to 72 hours. A donation box is under the sign!!

name: Palmer Cricket Ground Camping
description: Inside an olive field and next to the cricket court this community camp ground had great shade and clean toilets. Great for a couple of days.

name: Dump beach parking
description: This is a designated area with in the parking where you can camp. The signs mention only from 6pm till 10am but nobody came to check. There is a beach access right on your doorstep also comes with bathrooms and an outdoor shower.

name: Cape Jaffa Lobsters
description: We were send here for fresh lobster.Cheaper than the market,You get to pick from the tank and he even cooks it for you. Great value!!

name: Discovery Park Robe
description: Another typical Discovery Caravan Park with all brand new amenities and the bonus of an indoor swimming pool. The sites are very close to each other but the location is great( just off long beach)40AU$ per site.

name: Carpenter Rocks
description: Behind the community park there is a huge area designated for campers. There are toilets and barbecue. Also a tap from a rain water tank but for use while here not to fill up tanks. Great spot for overnight while checking the area.

name: Sawpit Free Camp
description: Great free camp under a eucalyptus forest. Popular with locals from Portland but still plenty of space. Long drop toilets and fire pits with tables the only amenities. But who needs more than that. Koala can be found in the trees.

name: Fairy port Apex park
description: Park with toilets and outside cold shower. If you go in the disable one there is also a hot indoor shower

name: Panmure Stop
description: Found this place by pure luck. It is right off the road but have toilets and sinks for washing. You can walk under the bridge and get to a refreshing swimming hall on the other side. Road noice is not a problem as it goes quiet durring the night. Great spot!!

name: NRMA
description: Great Caravan Park with all the amenities you need. Staff was very helpful and the place was very well taken care of. Great location. A lot of trails start here

name: Tanners Camp
description: Another great bush camp with long drop toilets and picnic tables. Very quiet at night. Good alternative to the expensive caravan parks along the coast in Great Ocean Road

name: Lake Illawarra
description: Lakeside car park, stunning views. just off the main road, but quiet at night. Lots of shade. Property owned by sailing club next door. No facilities. I spent two weeks here with no problems. Supermarkets 1km away.

name: McLoughlins Beach Road
description: Wild camp straight off the beach. No facilities. Popular but plenty of area to camp. Beach not the best for swimming but  must be good fishing as everybody was doing just that.

name: Wyanga Winnery
description: Free stay for self contained vehicles within the winery grounds. Using their restaurant is expected even if it is just for coffee. We camped with our Land Cruiser with a portable toilet with out a problem. There is a toilet open in restaurant during operating hours only. Very hospitable owners. Restaurant is great as well and good priced. Ground is a bit uneven.

name: Betca beach picnic area
description: Great beach with day use facilities. Barbecue,Toilets,Tables and running water. Not suitable for swimming.

name: Jackson's Crossing
description: Made it here after a wild off road from Buchan. Great route but a bit demanding. You trespass a private property (where you are not allowed to camp) before you reach the river crossing . River crossing was straight forward in February. You will need to cross first to a small island and then on the other side, as soon as you cross, you are back in the N.P. and your camp is on your left. Only a picnic table here but the scenery is unbeatable.

name: Mt Kosciusko look out
description: A marvelous 36-hours overnight stop for RVs with magnificent views to the mountain. No facilities except picnic tables so come prepared or stock up in Omeo.

name: Fletcher's Road
description: Large clearing on ridge in state forest on secondary road, formerly a site loggers piled wood. Worked great for us.

name: Bright Riverside
description: Great Caravan park with brand new facilities right next to the town. River runs on its side. You can walk across the bridge and get to town. Very clean new amenities. Great kitchen and TV area.

name: Brown Brothers Winery
description: Flat area that is part of the Brown Brothers Winery. Toilets can be used across the street next to the Celar door. There is also a restaurant there.

name: Daly Heads
description: Bush camping, approx 36 sites, x1 toilet.  Beautiful views of the coastline and nice beach to wander

name: Ovens Billabong
description: A free campsite just off the hi-way next to the river where you can take a swim. A bit of road noise. Lots of space to camp with your own privacy. Good for an overnight. No facilities at all though.

name: Kyneton mineral spring reserve
description: RV overnight stop good for a night. Some road noice in the morning. Great toilets and water supply. You are allowed to stay 48 hours only.

name: Top of Hill
description:
Its a free camp on top of a hill. Follow the 4WD track from the highway up on top. You can see the start of the track if you come from Onslow (south) way. 
Big hill climb but nice clearing at the top, great view and good camping spot. Can have a campfire here. 30k out of Karratha!

name: Bett beach on Myrray
description: Great wild camp on the shore of the river. Plenty of space. No facilities but wonderful riverside views.

name: Murray river
description: Great spot in a flat part of the Murray. Many places to camp around so you can be on your own. Must be self sustained as there are no facilities. Big RV's can also camp as the road in is smooth. Tents can be used as well.

name: Discovery Parks Camping
description: Great camp ground right on the river. All the amenities present and in great condition. Normal price for power sites at 33AU$. Nice and quiet.

name: Wentworth - Murray river
description: Another great spot by the Murray. This is outside the village of Wentworth. No facilities except trash bins. Plenty of spots around. It can be tight if you are towing. Water is swimmable most of the year except when the algae is present as we were told by locals.

name: Peterborough
description: Municipality allows overnight stay in this cricket field. No facilities but it feels safe and better than a side of the road option. Leave no trace!!Easy walk in town if you need to.

name: Brachina Gorge east
description: A great camp ground in the Flinders. You are next to the riverbed and a pleasant walk away from the yellow feet wallaby area. There is rain water tank for water and toilets. You can book it on line when you book your National Park pass.

name: Maree Hotel free
description: There is an area designated for campers in the back of the hotel for free. A donation is expected when you use the showers. Basic but nice and clean. The pub serves meals and cold drinks if you want. Add a use of the pool in the place and you have an oasis.  Great little gem on the SA outback!!

name: Derby Park
description: Free campground with BBQ area, water, toilets and showers ($4 for 4 minutes). Maximum stay 14 nights.

name: Portable water
description: A great facility to fill up with drinking water. 20 liters for 4$ only card. Locals do not advertise it since they wanna sell bottled water

name: Old Timers Mine
description: Urban free camp on the side of Old Timers Mine museum. Nice clean bathrooms 24 hours open. The place gets busy fast come early. Very helpful staff from the museum with plenty of info about the town. Free wifi from the town network.

name: OTR servo
description: free dump point in the carpark of the OTR service station

name: Fruit and Vegetable Checkpoint
description: Massive undercover check point when entering South Australia. No fruit or vegetables are permitted. When I passed through there were about 6 staff on duty checking inside cars.

name: Kulgera Roadhouse
description: This roadhouse provides powered and unpowered sites at a good price. (20$ unpowered.) Well maintained facilities and a good bar in case you need a drink. Also comes with a small pool.

name: Mary river Roadhouse
description: Although the roadhouse is actually closed the Caravan park is still open. Amenities are old but well maintained and the caretaker is really friendly. 10AU$ pp for unpowered site.

name: Heartbreak Camp
description: A hotel that actually operates like a roadhouse on the Savannah way. All amenities are well kept. A must stop to get some of that red dust out!!!

name: Lorella Springs Homestread
description: This is NT's wild life sanctuary. There fee is per day and you can camp anywhere in their 1000000 hectare property. As soon as you check in the staff will inform you with what you can see and do. There is also the option to camp right here if you like more organized camping. A great concept that everybody stays more than a week exploring the area. There is waterholes, billabongs ,sand dunes and more. You can check their web site for more info.

name: Mac Arthur river camp
description: Well maintained camp with all the usual amenities. A great place to relax and clean up some of the dust of the Savannah way. The town has 3 mini markets with basic supplies as well.

name: Ellis Beach camping
description: The free camp just up the road does not allow overnight anymore so we stayed in this lovely camp ground right on the beach. Cheaper than the one in Palm cove at 34AU$ for unpowered site. All amenities are in great condition and really clean. If you get here early you get a seafront site which is pretty special. We were unlucky to have rain here so pictures are not perfect.

name: Archer River roadhouse
description: A well kept roadhouse and campground on the way to the Point. Lots of shade and clean amenities. Great for an overnight to get some of that red dust off you.

name: Weipa Camping
description: An established campground by the water. All amenities are well kept and clean. Plenty of shade. Lots of campers come and next day they are off to the Tip. Good for a couple of nights. Supermarket is in a walking distance.

name: Pennyfather
description: Great camp on the beach. No facilities. Many spots in the area some with shade. Make sure you lower your tyres as the sand is soft.

name: Turtle Street South camping
description: Informal camping right on the beach. No specific campsites rather pick a spot. Road in is a bit rough and windy but easy for a 4wd.

name: Seisia Holiday Park
description: Great waterfront Caravan park in Seisia. It can be noisy sometime with locals partying but other than that, this place may as well be your No1 destination in your trip to the Tip of Australia. All amenities present and well maintained.

name: Bramwell junction
description: The owner of the station also run this place on the crossroad to the OTT. Simple but clean with basic facilities and a small shop in the fuel station. Same price for overnight. 25AU$ unpowered sites

name: Saunders Beach
description: This great spot offers free camp for 48 hours. You need to send an email to enquiries@townsville.qld.gov.au for an approval. You are only allowed 2 days per week. Great beach just in front of you and some basic facilities like toilets and barbecue.

name: Bungalow Bay Camp
description: This is the only place to camp on the island. If you cross with your vehicle there are powered and unpowered sites as well as dorm rooms. All the amenities are present and well taken care off. There is a Coals Sanctuary within. Just a great place to spend sometime while in Magnetic Island.

name: Taylor Creek Rest Area
description: A rest area beside the highway. Has toilets, a water tank, picnic tables.

name: Kambolgie Campground
description:
Park campground
paid.

name: Maguk Campground
description: close to Maguk Falls. excellent swimming hole with rock jumping, waterfall. lots of fish.

name: Tjaynera Falls (Sandy Creek) Campground
description:
national Park campground.
short walk (3.4km return) along track to Tjaynera Falls, an amazing swimming hole.
limited sites. all with bbq 
toilet block.
self pay system
4wd access. Ford to the north was 0.5m deep. The Southern one 0.6m.

name: Seabreeze Caravan Park
description: A well established caravan park with all the amenities present and well maintained. A bit out of the center.  Avoids the noise and the parties of downtown Airily beach but it is still in a walkable distance. A super market for supplies is next door. Good value for money.

name: The Retreat Hotel
description: Parking bay outside of hotel on the Peak Downs highway. Room for several campers and big rigs. Picnic tables. Hotel 100 metres away, cold beer and good meals.

name: Finch Hatton showground
description: At the Showgrounds it is possible to camp. Power(25AU$) unpowered(20AU$). Big open space with well maintain amenities. You need to pay the caretaker on the way in and only in cash.

name: Limestone Gorge Campground
description:
A campground in arguably the most interesting part of Judbarra NP. Next to the East Bains River. the gorge is surrounded by interesting karst area. There are a couple of short walks to look at tufa dams. Unfortunately there is no safe swimming in the Bains and the tufa dams. Dry when we were there.
The campground itself is basic with some picnic tables and a couple of pit toilets.

name: Rowllan park and scout camp
description: An adventure park for mountain bike as well as a scout camp wellcomes campers with 15AU$ per site. No power but great clean amenities and a camp kitchen. Very well taken care area as the owner leaves on site. If they are not there you need to put the money to the honesty box in the entrance.

name: East Bains River Rest Area
description: a nice shady rest area on the bank of the East Bains. many bins.

name: Poinciana Caravan Park
description: Found this convenient campground in Yeppoon as the ones in town were full. Although had some bad reviews the new management has turn things around. The amenities are all new and super clean and the staff was very helpful.  A bit of noise from the road in the unpowered sites but only during the day.

name: Wash House Laundrymat
description:
- Double and triple loads and dryers
- Little bit expensive but convenient

name: Corso's Pub
description: We camped behind the pub for 10AU$ per vehicle. Quite place, great for a night. In the pub you can get a cheap meal and drinks. Toilets close by but no shower. Friendly owners.

name: Laundry 4655
description: Great laundromat with an area to wait while your laundry is done. Center located and with street parking available

name: MV Sarawak Camp
description: Another campground within the National Park with plenty of space to camp. Facilities include a drop toilet and a sink. You need to book on line at https://www.npsr.qld.gov.au/parks/inskip-peninsula/camping.html  As it is part of the National park, there is a flat rate of 6,50AU$ pp

name: Wongai Camping
description: Part of the Zone 1 camping area in Frazer this place is wright on the beach and still offers some shelter from the wind behind a small dune. You can book it through the  https://parks.des.qld.gov.au/parks/kgari-fraser/camping/beach-camping-zone-1. No amenities so come prepared.

name: Murray River falls camp ground
description:
Caml grounds near the Murray River falls, it's in an aboriginal community so be respectful.

Costs $6.60 per person. per night need to book online with parks

name: Waychinicup
description:
Inlet campground $11 per night 
beautiful views

name: Marloo Beach Camping Zone 8
description: Another beautiful beach camp on this side of Fraser Island. No amenities but stunning views. You meed to book it through  https://findapark.npsr.qld.gov.au/parks/fraser/beach-camping-zone-eight-camping. Great for a couple of days. A bit exposed to the wind

name: Nobby Beach Holiday park
description: Part of the Gday group this is a center located caravan park just a couple of blocks away from the beach. Very clean with a heated swimming pool and all the high standards of Gday parks amenities. A bit of road noise but quite at night. Plenty of shops around for all your supplies. Only powered sites are available.

name: Meckering Rose Garden
description: Overnight stay area, right next to road.  Across from Shell servo, and toilets are available and clean. There is water at the rv dump site but it's non-potable (meaning don't drink it).

name: Dalyup
description:
Behind Main Roads  gravel storage area next to Dalyup Nature Reserve.
Enter off highway gravel road 150m east of Dalyup Rd and South Coast Highway. Enter gravel storage area and behind is informal track to area private from road and sheltered from road noise. Very suitable for overnight motorbike tent camp stay. Cars and vans not suitable as is area where the vegetation is regenerating.

name: Martn's Bend Reserve
description: Beautiful free camping with toilets,  BBQ, Picnic facilities, green grass, on the Murray River. Can stay here up to 21 days. Peaceful and relaxing amongst the birds and wildlife.

name: Noosa River Holiday Park
description: Great location on the river with all facilities present and in great condition. A bit on the expensive side as we paid for unpowered site 44AU$. Shops and restaurants close by. All facilities are modern and in great condition. Kitchen has the best view to the river.

name: Rest stop
description: A convenient rest stop on the way Northwest. A bit of road noise from passing road trains.The toilet and showers are clean. Perfect for an overnight.

name: Lake Douglas Recreation Reserve
description: Only a quick 10km drive from Kalgoorlie, Lake Douglas is an excellent camping spot with all the amenities but close enough to town in case you need to make a supply run! There are toilets, BBQs and campfires. Dogs are allowed and since it is so close to town, you can also get cell reception. The lake is a perfect way to cool down or get some exercise in if you have a kayak. You may even want to try your luck and catch some yabbies for dinner. This camping spot is free.

name: Riverview Holiday Park
description: A well establish campground with all the necessary amenities present and in good working condition. Bathrooms and kitchen are very clean and the small pool is a bonus. A short walk to the thermal springs as well

name: NRMA Caravan Park Jindabyne
description:
Established Caravan park, w/ Cabins, powered sites, unpowered sites. Very advanced camp kitchen, two blocks of toilets and showers. Beautiful lakefront sites, boardwalk around Lake Jindabyne. 

Walking distance to Nuggets Crossing shopping centre, movie theatre, pharmacy and food takeout shops.

name: Marble Bar Holiday Park
description: Lovely grassy campground with an open air camp kitchen. Nice warm showers that dont run out!

name: LPG gas cylinder refill
description: 9kg $18 2kg $10 at the metro service station. they do refills most if not all the time

name: last free stop before canberra
description: flat overnight parking just off the highway. a bit noisy but not too bad inside a vehicle. there's a toilet. good reception. I slept well

name: fenced off leash dog area
description: fenced off leash dog area. only 1 area for dogs of all sizes. benches to sit at and parking at the front

name: Upper Colo
description: space for parking many rigs in the carpark. At low water levels the river is easy to cross in shorts. Toilets, cold showers, paid designated camping on the other side of the Colo River 1.6km from the bridge. (Vehicle access from North via Hulbert Rd.) or toilets and paid camping at wheeny creek 20 mins away.

name: Eumundi Markets Car Park
description:
Allows RVs to park for up to two nights. $30.00per night. $5 for electric hook up.
Showers and dump site.

name: Kendall Showground
description: Great, cheap little campsite. $20 cash per night for a site. there's power and water hookup, toilets and showers, and even a dump site.

name: Kendall Showground
description: small dump station near the camping at Kendall Showground. there is water to rinse but there is no potable water

name: Split Rock Dam
description: Lovely place to camp on the banks of a large dam. Many places to set up depending on the water level.  we camped in an open area near the boat ramp at the end of the road.  No facilities but there is a toilet at the picnic day use area on the way in.

name: Number One Beach (Seal Rocks)
description: Spent three nights parked in front of the beach without a problem. A very quiet area, calm beach (not patrolled). Toilets close by with cold outside shower and dumping point.

name: Tenbury Hunter Reserve
description: 500m from Swan Reach Ferry.   West side of river, windy and dusty but nice area for an overnight stop.  Had toilet as well as RV dump area.

name: Banskia Camp 4WD only
description: 8 allocated camp sites; $11 per adult; $ 15 park entry fee; beautiful spot, 4WD only, reduce tire pressure

name: Tozers Bush Camp
description:
48 unpowered bays surrounded by native bushland. Large open plan country style kitchen for cooking and entertainment. super clean bathroom with hot showers!
$15 per person / night

name: Camden Haven Laundry Service
description: washer and dryers take $1 coins only. small laundromat so it can get busy, but it's the only one in town.

name: Mendooran
description: Free camping within walking distance to the pub. Toilets and cold water shower. Dump point.

name: Gilgandra Bowls Club
description: Free camping out the rear of the bowls club. No toilets available when the club is closed. The bowls club has amazing Chinese food and WiFi available. Free water and dump point available behind the Gilgandra Information Centre.

name: Coonabarabran Golf Club
description: Free camp. No amenities, must be fully self contained. Can visit golf club for beverages.

name: Camp Cypress - Baradine Showground
description: Paid campsite with cabins also available. Very quiet, water, showers, toilets and washing machine available.

name: Paceway Showground
description: Paid camping, power and unpowered sites. Old but clean amenities

name: Freedom Camp
description: Free camp but visitors are encouraged to make a donation. Pretty grassy area near river. Pet friendly but no amenities apart from a dump point.

name: Bulga Free Camp
description: Free camping on a grassy field. short walk to local pub, a beautiful old graveyard across the road. Flushing toilets, picnic shelter, tennis courts and kids playground on site.

name: Sails Holiday Park
description: Nice clean campground, sites are large, close to the Lake and shopping is only 7mins walk away

name: Albury Showgrounds
description: Camping at the showground big sites  with lots of room, you must prebook. Has power ,water and toilets. It is dog friendly. Call 0448452545

name: Nigretta Falls Reserve
description: Stunning waterfalls (if enough water), otherwise still impressive rock face with waterfall drizzle. Large deep swimming area above the falls accessed from the second carpark (otherwise an easy walk) on Wannon River. Free gas powered BBQs, toilets with wheel chair access.

name: The Granites
description:
Carpark which allows free camping.  No facilities.  Big bitumen carpark right next to the most magnificent beach.
You can drive on to the beach with 4wd.  
Good phone service with Telstra/Optus.
Good television service.

name: Staffys  Corner
description: A simple little clearing in the pine forest not far off the Highway

name: Dimboola Public Toilets
description: Nice clean showers and toilets behind the library

name: Queenstown Cabin & Tourist Park
description:
28 places for recreational vehicles 
11 garden places
5 cabins full equiped to rent
6 shelters 
Laundry, camp kitchen, BBQ
Very clean place

name: South Melbourne Market
description:
The South Melbourne Market was established in 1867 and is the oldest continuing Market in Melbourne.

Open Wednesday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, from 8am to 4pm.

Park on roof, or (less than 2m) in nearby Spotlight Centre.

name: City Jeep
description:
Service, repairs and spare parts for Jeep and all Mopar vehicles.

https://www.cityjeep.com.au/service/m/service/

name: Policemans Point
description:
Free campground with pit toilet. About 25 sites right near stunning beach/mouth of river. 
Busy on holidays.
2bars of Telstra.

New toilets, but no other facilities - you must bring your own water and firewood, and remove all rubbish
