name: Lagoons Beach Campground
description: Free campground with many huge flat sites, plenty of room. Ok Telstra reception in the right spots, Telstra signal variable between 1-2 bars

name: Glendambo South Rest Area
description: Red sandy, scrubby area in behind basic rest area (picnic table and shelter), may be a watering hole. Drive in on road behind rest area 200m+ for lots of level ground and some shade. 3bars of Telstra.

name: Pembina spuds roadhouse camp
description: By donation ($5 per vehicle 2022), flat gravel campground, beside roadhouse restaurant. Flush toilets, fuel, Telstra service. Showers closed for renovations , some covered exercise equipment and picnic tables. Near highway.

name: Roadside
description:
Parking close to the road. No services.
.....
Parking proche de la route. Aucuns services.

name: Banksia reserve
description:
3 picnic tables available. Parking 24h max. Very quiet and beautiful sky
.....
3 tables de piques niques mises  disposition. Stationnement 24h max. Trs calme et ciel magnifique

name: Lockwood Canvas
description:
Lockwood Canvas provides made to order custom canvas solutions.
Everything from a duffel bag to a caravan awning.
Tent repairs and custom items of all sizes.

name: Warren Gorge
description: Well organized camp in stunning gorge. Small 5k hike is great, you will see yellow footed rock wallabies. No phone signal.

name: Chambers gorge
description: Follow a creek bed down into a Beautiful gorge and sacred site for the Adnyamathanha Peoples. Four official free campsites available alongside the gorge. 4x4 recommended, high clearance and a bit rocky for regular cars

name: Copley hotel and pub
description: Six slab sites beside the pub are available for patrons of the pub. There is also a grassy beer garden, and a friendly publican.

name: Farina historic township campground
description:
Really nice campground with flush toilets, shade and some grass. 
$10 per person or $20 per vehicle.
Shower hot if you light the donkey, you can buy fire wood here or BYO
No service

name: Edagee rest area
description: Wc, space, legal. Big aera for all vehicules

name: Clark Rubber
description: Rubber, foam, matting, pipe fittings, custom sizing and fitting.

name: Rose bay
description: 4 places with wc and shower. No problems with policemen

name: Owen Springs Waterhole
description: Follow a 4x4 road about 5km down to a waterhole along the (sometimes dry) river. Variety of spots to camp alongside. No facilities or reception.

name: Stuarts Well free camping
description:
Dirt lot behind the pub/servo. Free, Telstra phone reception.
Pub has cold beer and camel pies!! Yum.
Also has paid campground for $10

name: Mt. Dare Hotel & Campground
description:
Pub, restaurant, rooms for rent, camping , petrol, diesel, all the things.
Camping $25 per vehicle with two people. Hot showers, flush toilets.
Im told you might be able to get the very slow wifi password if you have something urgent like letting someone know you made it out of the Simpson alive

name: Madigan Camp 5
description: Madigan camp 5 crossing the Simpson. Nothing and nobody. Some shade, flat spots

name: Madigan Camp 1a
description:
Officially the first camp on the Madigan line. Nothing here, a little shade, flat spots and a Madigan marker post.
From here go to camp 5, the others have been closed

name: Madigan camp 6
description: Flat spot between dunes, no shade. Madigan sign for camp 6. Wouldnt recommend camping here.

name: Madigan camp 7
description: Flat open space, almost no shade. Some wind protection from the dunes.

name: Madigan camp 8 (alternate w/trees!)
description: A large stand of coolibah trees offer shade and wind protection. Tracks on north side lead into several nice flat areas perfect for camp

name: Madigan Camp 9
description: Official post of Madigans camp 9. No shade, but flat. Windy at the time of our visit. Not great.

name: Madigan Camp 10
description: Small turnout at the official marker, little shade, not much space. No firewood.

name: Madigan Camp 11
description: Official spot where he watered his camels in a clay pan. No water around now. Flat, large area. No shade

name: Madigan camp 12
description: Another official camp with marker. Small, no shade, barely room for one vehicle

name: Madigan Camp 13
description: Massive open flat spot at the marker for madigans camp 13. No shade, but tons of space for many vehicles

name: Madigan Camp 14
description: Small turnout at the official camp 14. No shade. No firewood.

name: Madigan Camp 15
description: Camp and junction with the haha River track. A few gum trees, wind protection as you are in a bit of a dry river bed.

name: Madigan Camp 16
description:
Official camp 16 with the tree containing madigans carving - cant read now.
Large area with trees in nice dune valley

name: Madigan Camp 17
description: Nicest official camp so far! Tons of space, tons of trees for shade, really nice spot between bigger dunes, highly recommend!

name: Madigan Camp 18
description: Another great campsite at the official post. Plenty of space, lots of beautiful trees and firewood. Lots of birds too!

name: Madigan Camp 19
description: Overlooking big clay plan, flat and shady spots, very nice.

name: Madigan Camp 20
description: Beautiful spot on dry waterhole. Lots of birds, tons of firewood and big old gum trees for shade. Open with a great view

name: Madigan Camp 21
description: Slightly off the main track, dirt clearing, some small trees but not much shade. Plenty of firewood

name: Eyre creek campsite
description: A number of smaller, flat sites are nestled up along the bank of the sometimes flowing sometimes dry Eyre Creek. Eucalyptus and coolibah trees offer nice shade and abundant bird life. Dunes provide good wind protection and nice sunset viewing.

name: Birds like caravan park
description:
Big caravan park with all the facilities. Very clean, hot and dusty.
Unpowered $20 per night two people

name: Port Julia
description: Relaxed open camp ground in reach of beach. Small town on the South Australian Coast. Camp ground has basic toilets and shaded grassy areas. $10au per night or $60au per week. Height restriction of 4.1m so suitable for most trucks. Generators allowed during day.

name: Mullumbimby Leagues Club Camp Grounds
description:
Local Council run grounds. 
Power and unpowered sites. 
Suitable for RVs, Caravans and tents. 
Toilets, showers and Hot Water available. 
Communal cooking facilities available also.
Clean site and friendly staff.

name: The Mucka Pub
description: Free Camping and Hot Shower so long as you by a drink at the pub.

name: The Red Lizzard Campgrounds
description: Clean site, good Amenities, fires allowed.

name: The Pelican Rest Tourist Park
description:
Good Clean Park with good ammenities. 
Close to town.

name: Peterborough Truck Parking Area
description: Roadside flat hard surfaced area designated for truck parking. No camping restrictions. Accessible for small and larger recreational vehicles. No services available.

name: Narrabri Showground Camping Area
description:
Well Maintained grassy area, clean but old amenities, close to town. 
Newel highway can be a bit noisy.

name: Glen Villa Resort Campground & cabins
description:
Cheapest around Byron. Very nice facilities, pool, wifi, powered and unpowered sites. Cabins and stuff too. Very short walk to town.
Unpowered site $40 per night

name: Wahba campground
description: Beach camping up behind dunes, variety of pullouts along the beach, inaccessible at high tides.

name: Ocean Lake Campground, Zone 8
description:
Official wild camp in the dunes for zone 8. Book and pay online.
Lake in behind is worth a look and swim, 500m north on beach is a fresh water creek to swim in!
Perfect Telstra 4g

name: City Lights Caravan Park
description:
Well Maintained, with grassy camp areas. 
Fires allowed in fire pits. 
Clean amenities

name: Speers Point park
description:
Big parking with water taps, toilets, bbq, and rest area. 
Slept here 3 nights without any problems.

name: Terrigal dog park
description: Car park close to boat ramp, scenic view and amazing whales watching tour.  We were so happy to stay here. Public toilets in 500 meters, Bbq areas and tables.

name: Hat head surf live saving club
description: Parking without any signs, access to the off leash dog beach, toilet.

name: Georgetown Memorial Park & Playground
description: Parking area adjacent to the town's park/playground that is also made suitable for overnight camping. Clean toilets, clean shower ($1 for 2 min), coin operated BBQ's and a water tap. Facilities are provided by the town of Georgetown.

name: Smoko Campground
description: Spacious campground with about 15 to 20 camp sites scattered around the area. Pit toilet and fire pits. Heads up: the turnoff to the campground is called Miley Ln. There's no road sign that indicates the turnoff to the campground. Free. Good cell service.

name: Karuah Golf Club parking area
description: Large parking area for approx 50 cars for the Karuah Golf Club. No signs that forbid camping but there is a no trespassing sign for the golf course itself. Onsite toilets that belong to the golf club were locked. No golf activity when we camped. May be different in summer time.

name: Parham Camping Reserve
description: Campground next to beach. Free toilets, cold shower, barbecue and a book swap.

name: Tea Gardens Lions Club
description: Parking with 6 picnic tables, sanidump station, toilets and water. No camping.

name: Hervey Bay Visitor Information Center
description: Free overnight camping behind the Hervey Bay Visitor Information Center. Approx 20 parking spaces. Free wifi close to the building, free grey/black water drain, toilets inside building.

name: Benaraby Public Campgrounds
description: Public campground (rest area) with 7 concrete pads, multiple campsites (approx. 25), additional large parking area, picnic tables, toilets, water and dumpsite. All free. The 'no camping' sign is so people don't block the driveway of the farmer that lives there, but the main sign says stays allowed up to 20 hrs.

name: Acher Creek Rest Area
description: Large, grassy area with shade & rest rooms along side highway next to creek. Free, maximum stay 48 hours. Walks 7 some tracks in area. Several quite folks camped here.  Would definitely stay here if we were later in the day.

name: Elliot River Park Guthalungra
description: Roadside campsite around a small park next to the Mobil gasstation. Toilets, picnic tables, water tap available. Overnight stay up to 20 hrs allowed.

name: Bathers Paradise Caravan Park
description: Great place to stay! Clean and big spaces. Free WiFi and hot showers.

name: Water
description: shady spot with free water tab... not sure if suitable for drinking. Must boil water before use according to sign.

name: Kingoonya
description:
Was a busy town on the east-west railway line but now a bit deserted. Was the main road to Darwin before the road was bypassed and bitumened through glendambo.
Camping sites, great pub meals and credit card petrol bowser

name: Career Campground Zone 9
description:
Zone 9 official camping, must book online and book ahead, its popular!
Easily most stunning place on the island, breathtaking sunsets, very isolated and peaceful!

name: Bajool Hotel
description:
Free camping on the grass over the road from the hotel/pub.
Buy a beer or a delicious meal to support the super friendly and quirky pub too!!
Public toilets 300m down road.
Road and train a bit noisy.

name: Car Mills Beach Camping
description:
Government site, $12.50 per site per night.
Stunning, right on the beach.
Separate spots in the area for tent camping, camper trailers and caravans.

name: Lions Den Pub & Camping
description:
Iconic Aussie pub with camping in the huge grass area. Always busy and a good time, cold beer, great food, live music.
Camping $15 per person, hot showers, toilets.
Always a good time and plenty of people to talk about the cape.

name: Isabella Falls
description:
Camping allowed at these stunning falls! No crocs, fantastic swimming.
About 5 distinct camp spots each with room for a few vehicles.
No phone service

name: Musgrave Roadhouse
description:
Outback roadhouse with good fried food at cafe, petrol and diesel and camping on green grass for $15 per person.
Showers and toilets.
No phone signal, but free wifi

name: Rainforest Camping
description: Rainforest camp sites 1 & 2 in National Forest. Basic clearing in forest with space for three vehicles. No facilities. Must be prebooked online. No phone service

name: Riverside
description: Right on the river, great swimming, big space for 4 or 5 vehicles. Plenty of firewood. Even better waterfall for swimming just upstream- turn right at the fork just before here. Secluded.

name: Cockatoo Creek
description: Plenty of large sites on both sides of beautiful river. Great swimming, plenty of firewood

name: Nolans River
description:
Infamous as usually the deepest crossing on the tele with a soft sandy bottom.
Great camping both sides, amazing crystal clear swimming and swing ropes!

name: Jardine River
description: Camping right on the river where the old crossing used to be. Nice high bank so crocs no too much of a worry. Absolutely NO swimming. Good fishing!

name: Jardlne River Crossing
description:
Ferry is $110 per vehicle, runs 8am to 9pm.
Camping here if you arrive late is &10 per person. Dirty and run down, dont stay unless you have to.

name: Alau Campground
description:
Right on the beautiful beach.
$14 per adult unpowered.
A bit windy, but plenty of options either on beach or in away from wind. Two bars 4g Telstra

name: Hamelin Bay Holiday Park
description:
Nice place next to the sea! Toilets and showers are a bit old but works well. No WiFi or cell. 

Nice place to enjoy the area.

name: Roper Bar Store
description:
Fuel, frozen meat, bread and others things you may need. Attached motel. 
Here you pay for the near by campground, 10$ pppn

name: Margaret River Tourist Park
description: Great place! Very clean and very helpfully staff. At walking distance from shops and the Main Street of Margaret river.

name: Bulahdelah Golf Club
description:
Really great free camping at a golf course, plenty of space and fairly popular as a overnight rest stop. RV and campers allowed as well as tents and car camping. Big rig access as well. 
Unsure of official fire rules but someone was having a fire whilst there. 
Toilets free and showers for $5. Great mobile phone reception and pets allowed. 48 hours max at one time for a stay.
Nice and quiet and safe.

name: Leichhardt Falls Campsite at riverside
description: During dry season perfekt place for free. Officially recommended as a campsite.  Bring everything by your own, nothing there but sunset and stars.

name: Copperfield Lodge and Caravan Park
description:
Nice little campground with shade, 500m walk to Copperfield Gorge, 15$ for 2ppn unpowered. 
Historic Savannahlander train stops in town.

name: Overflow parking
description: Stayed here for one night. Quiet the whole night and morning

name: Campground shower
description: Campground showers can be used for 6$ if you are not staying at the campground

name: Bitter Sweet Cafe & Wine Bar
description: Great food and drinks, nice atmosphere Great Staff

name: Wonarah Bore Rest Area
description: Free camping, 24 hrs, lots of areas to camp, for tents, vans, caravans, motorcycles, trucks

name: Punsand Bay Campground
description:
Not cheap, but very nice place right on the beach. Pool, wifi for $5, great bar and food at restaurant. Wood fired pizza is awesome.
$50 unpowered site, $80 powered for one night.
Telstra has 2 bars 3G, but does nothing.

name: Platypus Bay Campground
description:
Wild gov campsite, must book online $6.85 per person per night.
Stunning spot right on lake. Sites 16 - 10 are best. Telstra 4g perfect

name: Kauri Creek Campsite
description:
Government campsite on the stunning lake. Book online, $6.85 per person per night.
Sheltered and lakeside.
Telstra two bars 4g

name: Innot Hot Springs Campground
description:
Large campground with all the facilities- hot showers, laundry, etc. Book ahead, its busy.
$37 for two people unpowered.
Can day swim for $10 per person.
Also possible to soak in the hot creek bed for free. Telstra 4g one bar

name: Norman River Wildcamp
description:
Turn off just West of bridge, cross train tracks and follow your nose. Rough track.
Tons of sites near river the further you go, flat and shade. Plenty of firewood.
Telstra 4G two bars.
Salties and Freshies spotted in and around the river!! Be careful

name: Gregory River free camp
description: VERY busy and beautiful spot on the river. Great camping, tons of vans. Telstra 4G one bar

name: Dry clearing
description: Good enough for a night, plenty of space for multiple vehicles, away from road enough to just not be seen. Plenty of firewood.

name: Hells Gate Roadhouse
description:
Great outback roadhouse. Camping on nice green grass with shade, melas, fuel , water.
Everything you need, super friendly people!
Telstra 4G full bars, but its slow.

name: Robinson Creek
description:
Great pull out off the road and far enough from creek.
Space for multiple vehicles, firewood, shade.
Creek is stunning and clear, but undoubtedly full of crocs!!

name: Nudie Hot Spring in Lorella
description: Nudie Hot Spring is a must visit inside the private Lorella Springs. Great camping with shade here, and of course the spring!!

name: Southern Lost Cities Campground
description:
Nation Park campground, very basic but great. The walk is amazing!
Must be pre booked online, $7 per person

name: Roadside Rest stop
description: Large flat roadside rest area with established metal fire pit, picnic table, shelter (space for tent underneath), water cistern, toilets, rubbish bins and several medium sized gum trees. Lots of bird life.

name: Bitter Springs Cabin and Campground
description:
Huge campsite walking distance to stunning warm spring you float down. They dont take reservations and fill up by midday in the high season so arrive early!
$35 unpowered, $40 powered
Bring a pool noodle to float the warm spring!
Telstra 1 bar 4G

name: Central Valley Campground 1
description:
Stunning campsites on the bank of a flowing rocky creek you can swim in. Each of 10 sites gets its own private swimming hole.
Must be prebooked online on gov website for $20, and you MUST collect a key from the parks office in Darwin which requires a $250 deposit. Yes, really.
Road in said 4x4 only but was just a little rough. Good for a Subaru.

name: Purple Mango Camping, brewery & restaurant
description:
Great little brewery where you can camp for $10 per person.
Great beers on tap any night, only fri and sat restaurant does great pizzas for reasonable price.
Camping is nothing too special, but its a really fun place!

name: Big Horse Creek Campground
description:
NT gov campground with tons of sites and stunning Boabab trees!
Pull through sites for caravans and a tent area too. $6 per person per night, book online.
Telstra 3G 3 bars

name: Salt Pan edge with stunning view
description:
Great spot sheltered near the trees on the edge of a dry salt lake. Very quiet overnight. A few spots to choose from.
Telstra 4G one bar

name: Stunning wild camp above Pentecosr River
description:
Stunning elevated spot above the river with views all around. A few fire pits and room for multiple vehicles.
Drive through the gravel pit on the Easy side at top of hill and keep going. Track is very rocky, I used low range.
View incredible at sunset!!
Telstra 4G 1 bar just works

name: Munuruu campground
description: Aboriginal managed campground in the banks of Munuruu (king Edward) river. Picnic tables, some shade, swimming 2km off main road.

name: Mitchell Falls Campground
description:
Great campsite you use to access Mitchell falls. Its a 4km hike one way, so you want to leave early!!
Campsite is big and well maintained 
Campground is $11 per adult, cash in drop box. Also requires the $45 per person 5 day access permit.

name: Barnett Gorge free camp
description:
Great free camping right by the gorge with swimming and hiking. Plenty of places for many vehicles, people even bring caravans in, though the access road is a bit rough.
Really nice spot.

name: Top of waterfall camp
description:
Plenty of great spots on the river near mighty boabs along this track. Unfortunately River was dry in early sept, but this would be epic camping right next to swimming earlier in season.
Plenty of room here for 5 vehicles, need high clearance to get in

name: Peace Gorge
description: Free camp just outside town amongst very interesting granite boulders. Must be fully self contained camper.

name: Lake Wallace Camping
description: I spent a good night here with my tent and motorbike. Beautiful place with bathrooms, and a nice lake. A lot of RV here, but very quiet. Nice people. Completely free, and without bookings.

name: Construction site
description: I didnt camp here, but looks very nice to camp for the night. No water, some trees and a fireplace. Just for the night.

name: Abercrombie River National Park
description: Nice place to camping, a lot of places to put the tent, and to have a fire. Toilets and water. Next to the river.

name: Caboolture Showgrounds
description: Showgrounds has site with power and water and site with just water and then site with nothing. Good clean and cheap

name: Port Augusta Free Campground
description: As in Google maps, there is a blue caravan sign to the left about 15km from Port Augusta on the Caroona Rd. No facilities with some rubbish but easily accessible and a number of sheltered tent spots. A good track following the fence allows nicer open Bush sites around some trees. The road is close for passing cars but there wasnt many. Beautiful views and birds.

name: End of Mason Point Road (be discreet)
description: Park in the cul de sac at the end of this road. No facilities, just an over night spot for those in need. We did not get harassed but we also just pulled up here, did not get out and walk around, we hopped straight in the back to sleep and then took off about 7:30am in the morning.

name: Spring Bay Hotel (Donate for stay please)
description: This business is super kind to offer the land at the back for people to park up and stay for the night. Ask the staff inside for finer details. A donation is highly recommended but not essential, but to support such a lovely offer, its always great to give a little back.

name: Des Streckfuss Rest Area
description:
Rest area that officially allows 24 hour stay.
Toilet and dump station.
Picnic tables, very little shade.
Good enough for a night

name: Carawine Gorge Free Camp
description: Free camping on a stunning gorge. Some shade, no facilities at all. People swim and kayak here.

name: Skull Springs River Camp
description:
Great gravel camping on the elevated banks of the river. Shade and firewood a plenty, windy when we visited.
No services

name: Running Waters
description:
Great warm spring and swimming hole with tons of camping. Shade and firewood. 
Road till about :300m before spring is fine, and there is a good large camping space if you stop there. Last 300m is low range 4x4 only, you can camp right on the waters edge.
No services

name: Skull Springs on Davis River
description:
Great gravel sites on the creek. Flowing water but not really enough for a swim.
Huge paperbarks give plenty of shade.
Really nice quiet place
No facilities

name: Wanna Munna Gorge
description:
Small spot in a stunning rocky gorge.
Can still hear highway, but stunning spot.
There are petroglyphs on the rocks here
No services

name: Cheers Plains Station
description:
Fantastic station stay with camping, meals and the facilities.
Even if you dont camp, stop in and get the famous carrot cake!
Camping $20pp

name: Drinking water fill at dump station
description: Free signed drinking water tap right at free dump station.

name: Free water tap
description:
Water tap on the nice park. You can park right next to it, public toilet walking distance.
No camping.

name: Roadside Dump Station
description: Dump station at public drop toilet on side of road. No water.

name: No Camping in Mullumbimby!
description: Sign posted on road entering Mullumbimby. No camping on streets or in car parks.

name: Sandy Bay - Horrocks
description: A remote beach camp with several camping areas and drop toilets just north of the town of Horrocks. A 4WD is required to get in here as it is sand driving. Big rigs (2.4m wide and 8m long) will fit if you know what you are doing. $15 per night per vehicle. A local ranger will come around, take details and $$.

name: boranup drive
description: Beautiful drive north or south through the forest, untarred but fine for 2WD.  lovely place to stop and chill if you were so inclined.

name: Coolgardie RV Rest Stop.
description: Free 48hr self-contained Caravan or RV rest stop. Away from main road so quiet at night. Located beside old railway station. Plenty of room for big rigs. There is a dump station further up the road headed east.

name: Forest camp near tower
description: Tons of small 4x4 tracks going in here, fire rings and space for camping in view of massive transmission tower. Not super scenic, but fine for a night. Good Telstra 4G

name: Paynes Find Roadhouse and Tavern
description: Great outback roadhouse that offers camping out the back for $10pp. Great meals and beer. Also fuel and has toilets and showers. A bit of road noise and a generator all night

name: Canning Well 2A
description: Well 2A on the CSR. Small well with plenty of stagnant water, not suitable to drink or swim. Plenty of flat space to camp, lots of firewood and fire rings in stone.

name: Canning Well 2
description: Big sign, visitor info panel and huge empty water tank. There was a little water at the bottom of the deep old well, unlikely drinkable. Plenty of space to camp for many vehicles

name: Canning Well 4A
description: Old well, no water. Plenty of camping space for many vehicles and plenty of firewood. Extremely quiet.

name: Winding Springs on CSR
description: Famous springs, often have water. Beautiful spot with huge tees for shade , picnic tables, signs and a clean drop toilet. Great camping

name: Canning Well 4B
description: Another small, mostly broken well. No water. Tons of space for camping and shade

name: Canning Well 5
description: Well five has a great shade shelter, picnic table. Well itself is a deep shaft with bucket, some water visible at bottom. Nice place, plenty of space to camp

name: Canning Well 8
description: Crumbling remains of old well 8. No water here, not much shade, but plenty of space and firewood for camping if you need

name: Canning Well 12
description: Big space in the sand between dunes. Big trees for shade and a drop toilet, very nice camping here

name: Canning Well 15
description: Big camping area, fire pit and toilet. Some shade, tons of noisy birds!!

name: Canning well 16
description: Run down, but has a turnaround, shade a space for multiple vehicles. Plenty good enough for a night

name: Canning Well 24
description:
Clearing and shade by a muddy pool, nice place to camp away from main road. Different times of year might be clear water.
Two dingoes here.

name: Canning Well 34
description: Off the main track, plenty of sandy spaces spread out around the low trees. A nice quiet place

name: Canning well 35
description: Lots of open sandy spaces in tee tree. Very nice spot to camp

name: Barbour Park
description:
Council campground for tents and RVs.

Nice flat ground along the river, pretty quiet as its away from the main road.

Toilet block with hot showers, BBQ facilities, tables and benches.

Quick walk over to the pub if you're so inclined.

RVs can stay a maximum of 2 nights.

There is also a public swimming pool (admission fee) open 11am to 6pm

name: cassillis Park rest area
description: rest area with compostable toilets, firepits and much space to park.

name: Quiet spot near Boat Ramp
description: I found this spot by chance, its quiet and private. There is a park and boat access here. There are no signs saying no overnight parking. At the back there is a parking spot tucked away, perfect for a van. There are outdoor BBQs close by.

name: Newtons Crossing
description:
6 or 7 spots on a free camp site on forestry land.
Clean pit toilet and fireplaces plus benches. But no water or showers.
Lovely creek where you can go for a swim.

name: Foxglove oval
description: Big park where locals come to walk their dog or do some exercise.

name: Coochin Creek
description: Queensland Parks site on the river. Well presented site with good spacing between sites and peaceful. Although you are near the river there is not much of a view and it is not advised to swim (bull sharks?!). Fishing and boating popular. Flushing toilets and a water tank only. Quite a few mossies! Handy for the Glasshouse Mountains with easy access for 2WD vehicles

name: Parking lot near public bathroom
description:
4 parking lots near a public  bathroom.
Perfect for overnight  staying.

name: parking lot on highway service stop
description: I spend here a night. it is a big service parking for trucks. you  can find a corner a bit away from noisy trucks. there is a McDonalds,  a gas station. public bathroom inside  McDonalds  building. good optus coverage. free wifi inside  McDonalds

name: Wescloud Lodge
description: Large field for camping with more cleared bush areas further back. Feels out on the country with lots of trees and birds - just pick your spot. 2 nice clean loos and showers. Friendly hosts. Very handy for Bruce Highway and 2 nice areas of North brisbane : Redcliffe and Sandgate (good beaches). Good value at $20 a night. Rec!

name: Service Center on motorway
description: a big parking lot for trucks  and cars. gas station. McDonalds with fast free wifi. Due to trucks it is noisy, but you can park somewhere away of trucks. a good place for overnight stop

name: Tweed Holiday Parks
description: Nice handy campground on the river (not that you actually see it much from camp). Clean, plenty of space and lots of birdlife. Swimming pool. $41 a night unpowered site

name: Station Street
description:
Street side of Station Str (parkside) is free for 24h parking.
you will always find a parking place. check for parking on both parallel streets, Station and Evans Streets (around the park). There is a tramp station. 10 minutes into City Center. I spent one night here. it is very quiet in the night.

name: 24h free parking for staying overnight
description: close to tramp station, perfect  for overnight staying

name: 24h free parking
description: for one or more nights overnight staying

name: 16 A$ a day parking near to green tramp zone
description: I slept here on parking lot a night, the whole parking area  was almost empty, nobody bothered  me in night.

name: Murwillumbah Showground
description: Nicely situated small showground with good views of the mountains. Only 25 spaces so phone to book or turn up early, caretaker knocks off at 5 pm so cannot check in after that. Other campground in town now closed. Nice little town and Art Museum excellent. $20 unpowered for 2 or $25 powered. Maximum stay 2 weeks

name: Street Parking
description: for  overnight staying, near  tram station, every 10 minutes tram 109 intimate City Center. 3 stop stations until green tram zone for free

name: Flat Rock Tent Park
description: Spacious grassy sites next to nice (unshaded) beaches. Good location just north of Ballina with cycle path along coast. Good facilities. $45 for 2 on unpowered site. Reception closed between 3-4 pm

name: truck stop with hot showers
description: KFC, McDonalds are here. for shower, you need to ask the cashier on the gas station. you let him car keys and get the key for shower room, it is for free, you need towels  and soap. I spend here the whole  night. nobody  bothered  me. it is a truck stop.

name: rest area on motorway
description: hunggry jack, bathroom, wi fi, perfect  for overnight   stop

name: Free campsite. must be self contained
description: gravel patch where you can stay up to 48h. there is no toilet or water but there is a water tap and a dump for caravans very close (see Wikicamps Au for coordinates). Dark and calm at night, amazing place to see the stars.

name: 24h free parking with public bathroom
description: good for overnight  staying. public  bathroom

name: walhalla campaign for free
description: A free, grassy site located right in the centre of walhalla Accessed by a bitumen road with flushing toilets and running water

name: Rest area on freeway with bathroom
description: good place for overnight staying, a big parking  lot on highway

name: free parking slots on the road side
description: you can stay on the parking  line along  the street. near to gas station, with bathroom

name: rest area with bathroom
description: good place  for overnight staying,  bathroom

name: rest area with bathrooms
description: large trucks cars rest area on A1 motorway, convinient for overnight  staying. no drinkable  water, bathrooms, cell phones optus-net good  coverage.

name: rest area with bathroom
description: good place  for overnight staying, bathroom is available, optus cell phone  coverage

name: camp for free at the moment
description: it is camping site,  at the moment it is for free, bathroom and cold showers are available, big shady parking  area

name: Yuraygir National Park/Grey Cliff
description: Fabulous camping right above the beach with gorgeous views - best camps 62, 63 (picnic table), 64 & 65 for views. Lots off handy hammock trees.and friendly kangeroos. Last km or so on dirt but not a problem. Long drops only andd no water but some fireplaces (bring wood) $25 & day use fee $8. Highly recommended!

name: Woolomombi Campground
description: About 2km off the Waterfall Highway on a good dirt road. Pleasant spread out big campsites in the bush. Long drop toilets, free firewood and water taps. Near a lookout and various short walks in the park. $7 each.

name: Hot shower, 6 A$
description: clean, Hot water, washing  machine, dryer. a good place, for paying ask information

name: Albert Theaker Park
description:
can stay for one night.
nice grassy area
lots of room
trees

name: beautiful place rest area
description: a very beautiful  place for overnight with gorgeous view

name: big parking, free for night
description: a large  parking  area, with  public  bathroom, McDonalds with fast wi-fi is close. good for overnight staying

name: rest area with bathroom
description: good place for overnight staying, on beautiful smal lake.

name: rest area with bathroom
description: good place for overnight staying. good optus cell phone net coverage.

name: rest area with bathroom
description: good for overnight staying, bathroom, barbecue, good optus net coverage

name: Street Parking
description: from 10:30 p.m to 8:30 a.m free. I spent here my last night. you can go out in the night. bathrooms  are available in restaurants  around or Canberra shipping center, 300m away

name: Street Parking
description: parking for 13 $ a day,  middle  ln Canberra, perfect  for strolling in city center, bathroom  in Canberra shopping  center, WI fi in shopping center  too

name: public bathroom 24/7 open
description: middle  in a beautiful  park. for emergency  pooping

name: free parking for night
description: from 5 p.m. till 8 a.m. the parking  is free, near park

name: beautiful place on the beach
description: shadow parking lot, portable water and beautiful  beach, what do you need more :-) Equipped with BBQ cooktop and well maintained toilet

name: parking lot with public  bathroom
description: only a big parking  area with bathroom, nothing  else, good 4G coverage

name: parking 24/7 free, gas station with bathroom
description: shadow parking,  24/7 free, near two gas station, with bathroom

name: 24/7 free parking, Clifton bridge
description:
directly close to Clifton Bridge, 10 place for car, of course in the day full with tourists, but in the nights  it is empty. in the evening  8-9 p.m. you need  to wait 15-30 minutes until  you get a free place.
nobody  bothered  me in the night.

name: Street Parking
description: street parking with bathroom, cold shower, and swimming pool . near Clifton Bridge, along the street you can stay overnight, in the morning go into the swimming pool :-)

name: Street Parking
description: Quiet  street, for overnight  staying. I stayed here for three days. I read this place will be not controlled. a nice small park is near

name: Freemans campground
description: Nice campground, you should book in advance. BBQ, tables, toilets, showers, and parking. Not too much shade, just a little bit. Nice.

name: Gloryvale reserve
description: Nice free campground, toilets, tables and the river. There is shade, grass and bins for the trash. Some fireplaces, bring your own wood.

name: Rest Area
description:
I found the sign "single night stay is permitted" so I will stay here for a night.
The place has bathrooms and good  4G coverage.

name: Rest area on A1
description: a bit noisy, because  of highway,  but anyway,  good  for overnight  staying

name: Rest area with bathroom
description: Cool nice place for overnight  staying, enough  shadows

name: rest area with bathroom
description: for overnight staying this place is very  good, menu car lots

name: Free cold showers on horseshoe bay park
description: 3 cabins with cold shower, nothing else,  very convenient

name: Near gas station and restaurants
description: Gas station with bathroom in night, hungry Jack's, something about 10 parking lots, I stayed the night here, nobody bothered me

name: rest area on highway
description: bathroom,  big parking area, good  place to overnight  staying

name: Beechworth Station
description: Fresh water tap outside the toilets at Beechworth station, on the rail trail. There is another tap at the end of the goods shed.

name: Service Center on highway with hot shower
description: A lot of car slots, KFC, McDonalds, gas station, there is trucker lounge here, you have to ask the gas station cashier for the key of hot shower inside of lounge

name: Edi cutting
description: Free camp by the river. Crowded during the holidays.

name: unlimited parking on street side near to beach
description: Locals told me: this side of street has unlimited  parking  time. Other side of street has paying parking  lot :-) Take a look on pictures to know which side I mean. Near to paying parking lot you have cold showers and bathrooms. Directly  on Clarke's Beach, a beautiful place. I got a place on street after 10 minutes  waiting.

name: rest area, no camping, but overnight staying
description: rest area on highway, nothing  else, bathrooms, in the day, coffee shop

name: free cold showers on budds beach
description: Free cold showers, potable water, bathrooms, free parking unlimited, no camping.

name: Benalla Recreation Reserve
description: Located at both ends of the buildings overlooking the footy oval.

name: Caravan Hotspot
description: Free Camp on the side of the road. Max 72h, free public clean toilets and dumping points.

name: Wangaratta Merriwa Park Showers and Toilets
description: Nice clean toilets and showers. In both the ladies and gents accessible toilets

name: Mudgee Showground
description: Lovely grassy spacious camping in this great little town. Excellent value at $15 for an unpowered site with good clean amenities, laundry and small camp kitchen. Friendly caretaker who comes around about 5pm to collect fees. Highly rec!

name: Glacial Rocks (Rocky Creek)
description: Beautiful drive through hills and vallies between Narrabri and Bingara on sealed road - and this campsite is bang en route. Just off the bitumen, gravel access , touch rough but doable in 2WD. Wonderfully wild creek and mountains. Easy access for wallowing & swimming (follow path downstream from camp for big swimming hole in river). Basic loos and (overflowing) bins. Fairly tight space, you could turn a big rig round but limited parking

name: Severn River Restt Area
description: Wide open grassy area just north of Ashford on the river - limited spots with water view but good swimming holes on other side to north, turn right other side of bridge (limited space so cars only). Smelly long drop with no lock (stone supplied) and bins. Pleasant enough parklike setting otherwise.

name: Bonshaw Weir
description: Grassy space above the river and large weir - very scenic! Shady trees and a couple of picnic tables but that's it (so please don't add to litter/loo paper on edges!) Not huge but a reasonable amount of room.

name: Foxbar Falls
description:
This place grows on you! At first it seems a little scrappy, a vegetable farm in the bush with lots of dams. However, there is some lovely waterfront camping if you get a front spot and pleasant strolls and walks around the place with good viewpoints. Lots of space. Great sunsets!  Scattered loos and good showers, free kayaks around and friendly staff
 $32 for 2 in a tent unpowered. Firewood for sale and small shop.

name: Louis Lookout
description: Good spot close to main road. Picnic tables, bins and good shade coverage. Nice views in the wheatfields and of Stirling Ranges. Great cell reception.

name: Jim Bexhill Park, Dalveen
description: Small park just off the Highway offering free 24 hour stops. Grassy, some trees, flushing loo, dump point and bins. Tap not working at present. Great location and clean.

name: Manna Gum, Main Range National Park
description:
Spacious grassy camping with scattered trees, very quiet and peaceful. Lots of birdlife and song. Near a creek but this is small and not accessible bar a couple of small paths through thick bush. Some walking tracks leave from here. Clean long drops, water taps and fireplaces (no firewood supplied). $14 a night for 2. Lots of commercial campsites in Goomburra Valley before national park and can get on river banks. Dirt for last section and a bit rough but OK with 2WD slowly.
Has a sister campsite very similar which is 300 m before it: Poplar Flat - choice campsite probably there: turn left down the track as you turn into the flat for a secluded shady site with direct access to stream, about the only place that does!

name: Dalrymple Park, Allora
description: Nice small grassy reserve above a hidden creek. Free 24 hours stop with picnic tables and loo. Some bright lights so pick your spot. Quite a lot off road noise too. Nice little town with Mary Poppins House where author grew up.

name: Girraween National Park - Castle Rock
description: Spacious campsite handy for the southern walks in the park. Lots of big areas for trailers and tent sites to edges and middle. Flushing toilets, scattered fireplaces, ropes in showers to hang your own bag. Shady trees. Wonderful walking and great swimming hole by day use area. Easy access on sealed road.

name: Big 4 Campsite, Warick
description: Handy stop for town with grassy sites, good toilet blocks, well equipped camp kitchen and small unshaded swimming pool. $40 for unpowered site for 2.

name: Lake barrington campground
description:
Great spot. Lots of shade. Boat launch, toilets, bbqs, 200m from lake. Take your trash with you.
Free

name: Kalbar Showground
description: Useful stop between Warick and the coast. Quiet showground with just toilets and good hot showers. Tent area rather unshaded. $20 for 2 unpowered.

name: Riverside
description:
there are many camping spots along the river, it may be hard to get to in the rainy season. the spot is amazing for a swim, there are flushing toilets up in the entrance (not working today though). 
fire pits.
free.
ALDI reception

name: O Reilleys Green Mountains
description: Lamington Park campsite but dolled up by private operators. Bit of a mish mash -   tent sites shared with safari tents and all a bit close. Good camp kitchen with fabulous view from outside terrace. Great walking in the area. O reilleys has lodges next door with restaurants, excursions andd excellent rainforest skywalk which is free. $40 unpowered for 2. Long steep windy road in, no caravans allowed

name: Wild camping
description: Dirt road with loads of camping pullouts

name: The Log. Cabin
description: Run by 7th adventists so no alcohol but lovely camp at edge of the lush rainforest andd perfectly positioned for natural bridge. Green and peaceful, great facilities

name: Red Devils Football Ground
description: Simple no frills football club camping, perfectly pleasant spot and great value for Byron at $30 a night unpowered for 2 adults. 5 minutes drive to town. Caretaker will find you.

name: Clarence Camping
description: Fairly informal reserve with just a couple of clean portaloos, a big field and a big wooden open shelter. Heaps of room and nice drive along the river to reach it. Beautiful and quiet. Some spots right on the river. $10 each.

name: kosciuszko road
description: small road loop next to the main road has place for cars or tents on the road (no no camping sign)

name: beachport
description: good place near the beach hiden in the bush with a good road acces. multiple places for cars and/or tents

name: Diamond Head, Crowdy Bay National Park
description: Nice spacious grassy camping with lots of trees for shade;  gorgeous wild sandy beach and dramatic split rock to one end (not much shade on beach). Good walking round headlands. Road in 5km of dirt, quite corrugated in a 2WD

name: Old Ford Reserve
description:
Nice official FREE campground. Next to the river, long drop toilets, no drinking water, firerings, rubbish bins, big rig friendly, Telstra reception.

Run by city council, NO need to book in advanced.

name: Baloney Minor Camp Bridge
description: Right on the river. Can swim. Quiet, dogs ok. Free

name: Wooldridge fossicking and recreation area
description: Clean site and drop toilets, picnic tables and flowing creek, goo for a swim

name: Bayswater
description: Huge parking lot next to hotel and railway station

name: Bonadio Nature Reserve and Caravan Park
description:
Private campground at a farm with large tracts of rainforest along the Barron River. Trails through forest & along river (where you can see platypus!).  Lots of sites with power & hookups but also many sites for self contained camping those are $20 Australian per night (20220624).  Large showers with great hot water.  Two washing machines & a drier (all coin operated).  Stayed two nights & didnt walk all the trails so hope to return.
Reasonable Telstra coverage.

name: Kurrajong Campground
description: Beautiful national parks campsite -$11 per person per night. Must book on national parks website. Note no reception here. All sites less 2 min walk to beach. No shade or water - bring your own. Loads of wildlife in the water: dolphin, shovel nose shark, range of fish. Few mice about picking up scraps after dinner but werent a problem - good post dinner sport watching them.

name: Kinbombi Falls Free Camp
description: Designated overnight spot. Max. 72 hours. Easy access for all rigs. Gumtrees, but not that much shade. Just a bit. Free. Very quiet. Bush feel.

name: Rainbow Reserve Free Camp
description: Designated bush camping. Free. No amenities. Max. 14 nights (yes, two weeks). Quite a few spots at the lake. Some trees provide shade. Very quiet. Bush feel. Easy access for all rigs. Allowed to pitch a tent.

name: Bohena Free Camp
description: Just behind the Bohena Creek Rest Area. Take the red  track from the south west parking corner. Enough places with shade to be found there. A bit less highway sound. At this time the tracks were dry, firm and 2wd easy. The rest area provides drop-off toilet, water (no drinking) and dustbins. We enjoyed a pretty quiet night

name: Muttama Recreation Area Free Camp
description: Free campground. Grassy with some pretty good shades under the big trees. No toilets. Only a fireplace and a few dustbins. No no signs. Entrance opposite the Memorial Hall over the narrow cattle grid.  Easy access for all rigs.

name: Henry Angel Flat Free Camp
description: Free campground. Large grassy area. Sunny places or shade under big trees. Hot water for doing your dishes. No shower. Toilets and bbq places not that clean. If you wanna stay longer than 5 days, you need to apply for an also free permit. Easy access for all rigs.

name: Greenrise Lake Free Camp
description: Free grassy campground for overnight max 48 hours. Complete self-contained vehicles only. Public toilet and bins 300 metres away on rest  area. Easy access for all rigs. Some tree shade. Far enough from highway. Easy vehicle access to non-potable water fosset at the southern cross windmill near the toilets. The lake itself is dry.

name: Poocer Swamp Free Camp
description: Poocer Swamp Rest Area has a gate to the park. While we where there, the gate was closed, but not locked. No no signs at all. Pass through the gate and within 100 metres you'll find already a spot. 2WD ok when dry. Follow the track for more spots. Great spot to stay. Free. Awesome view on nature. We enjoyed a quiet night. When the track is too much for your rig, park on the rest area itself.

name: SA/Vic Border Free Camp
description: Huge red soil area. Great bush feel. Wild camp and flies for free. No amenities. No National Park. No no signs. Entrance from the A20 southern rest area in Victoria. Traffic noise: Depends how far you go in. At night hardly no traffic on the main road. No need for ground clearance. Maybe it gets boggy when wet or soft after long draught I don't know. Area is the backyard of the rest area so it is pretty easy to check it out by foot when y're not sure what to expect.

name: Kimba Free Camping Area
description:
Free city council campground very well maintained and spotless clean. Hot shower 2 minutes for $1. Toilets, picnic table, playground, rubbish bins, FREE public WiFi. 

Roora Walking Trail- 6km in native bush - starts near the campground.

name: Tcharkuldu Rock
description:
Basic campground with a long drop toilet and shelded picnic table. Just us and one other camper, kangaroos and parrots. Nice rocks.
Weak Telstra reception, good Optus.

name: Small parking in the forest
description: Small parking area in the forest, nearby the road heading to the beach, but a bit hidden. 50m from the beach, where you can also access toilets, a sink with water, and outdoor shower, and a fountain with drinking water. From the spot start some of the walking trails. Network available with Optus. Very quiet.

name: Car park by the beach
description: Car park next to the beach, with very clean toilets and outdoor shower. Very good network with Optus. There is also potable water, bins, and a bbq space with tables. Everywhere else around the area says no overnight parking, but this car park did not say anything and we spent a night very quietly. No noise or people, and kangaroos around us at night!

name: Wentworth Falls Parking
description: The parking lot to access the walks around the Wentworth Falls is very quiet at night. There are toilets, water and a picnic site. All the walks leave from here.

name: Nice little bush clearing
description: Nice clearing accessible by 2wd (in March, bone dry underfoot) by taking a 'lil turn off from ridge road. Far enough off the road to not be seen, enough room for a few cars/4x4 + tents, and a little slice of bush to yourself! Decent Telstra coverage.

name: Parking by the lake
description: Car park with lake view. Just outside Port Kembla Sailing Club. Talked to the owners and it was ok to stay overnight at the car park outside the premises. They also have toilets.

name: Free COLD showers
description: Showers and toilets for free next to the laundromat, picnic tables and FREE outdoor swimming pool.

name: Laundromat Norseman
description: Clean New machines. $5 per one load, $2 pet 10 minutes of drying.

name: Free swimming pool Norseman
description: Free outdoor swimming pool. Closed on Mondays.

name: Scaddan Rd Old Stockpile Site
description: Flat gravelled area with no facilities. Good for a night before going to Esperance. Some Telstra reception.

name: Parsley Bay Reserve
description: Showers with curtains where the toilets and changing rooms are. The water is not too cold. Just be aware that the parking closes at 6pm.

name: Drinking water
description: Facet with drinking water just next to the information centre.

name: Hidden place next to trasmitter
description: Nice hidden place for a van or two. Close to trasmitter. Lots of ants. No rubbish. Great Telstra reception.

name: Bunnerungee Bridge Free Camp
description: Huge flat bush area with trees for some shade close to the river. Entrance through the gate on the (no trucks) rest area. Easy access for all rigs. Garbage bins and pit toilet on the rest area. We enjoyed 2 peaceful nights.

name: Glenhope Free Camp
description: Huge area free camp. Designated camping and free. Well signed from the main road. Feel free to leave a donation. No amenities, only one pit toilet (green shed). Easy access for all rigs. Very quiet. Open spots and shade.

name: Collarenebri Primitive Free Campground
description: Campground just behind te rest area. Free. Also hot showers for free available. Designated spots with some shade. Easy access for all rigs. From the campground a track leads to the river als a few spots to be found there.

name: Shellharbour Village Motel
description: Rooms are good, all Motel services available

name: Passmore  Reserve Free Camp
description: Huge grassy area with trees for shade. Max stay 3 days. Tents allowed. No aminities, except dustbins and covered picknicks. Easy access for all rigs. Very quiet.

name: Kilkoy Free Hot Showers
description: Free hot showers and toilets at the Kilkoy Anzac Memorial Park. Very nice, thanks.

name: big secluded car park
description: Big car parks at the end of shopping/restaurant street. No time limit, no sign of no-overnight and a lot of space at night. No facilities. Discrete and quiet at night, there were a couple of vans when we stayed, and we had no issues leaving early in the morning. Telsra free-wifi reaches the parking lot.

name: Cape Northumberland  Lookouut
description: Basic site, no facilities but lots of room and sign saying its ok to stay. Five campers here today and 3 others nearby. Great views and nice sunsets. Quiet and seems very safe. Strong Telstra signal

name: Rest area on Cooryong
description: Flat, clean with trash can. Quiet with little traffic. No no camping signs. Good Telstra signal.

name: The Big Axe, Kew
description:
Dump station and public toilets available at this rest stop. 
Also if you're self-contained you can stay the night. 
Also great little info centre with gift shop. Lots nearby such a delicious food at the Kew Corner Store, The Squeaky Gate, or The Royal Hotel.

name: Jenolan State Forest, NSW
description: Nice camping spot next to a dam. Suits vehicle camping only as ground is rocky.

name: Rest area
description: Just a rest area directly next to the road. Outside of the natinal park. No 'no camping' sign. No traffic during the night. Telstra reception.

name: Quiet Parking
description: Quiet parking area at night, it is dark and almost no cars or people pass around at night, and just a few pass by in the morning. There are no restrictions for parking time and there arent no overnight signs. There are no amenities, but there are picnic tables and drinking water a bit further down the road. We stayed 3 nights, arriving at night and leaving early in the morning and we had no issues.

name: Stony Creek Cottage
description:
Nice Campesite with fireplace and cottages. Very friendly owners. 
15 AUD p.P. 

Horseriding ist also possible. Good and healthy horses. Trail riding with a nice view.

name: Panoramic Parking
description: There is a small parking with a viewpoint on the way to Wallaman Falls that is very quiet (we spent one night and did not see any car). There are picnic tables and there is an nice view where you can catch a nice sunrise. There are no other amenities and there is no sign of no-overnight. Good phone reception with Optus.

name: CMCA Camping
description: One of the many excellent low frills CMCA locations across Australia. No services (except a dump station and potable water), but flat, safe, central and cheap ! $7 for members, $14 if not ( covers vehicle +2 people ). Coles in a mall right behind, auto parts store across the street and 15 mins walk to town. There is a toilet right inside the rear entrance to Coles just 3 mins walk away. This place is a hidden gem !

name: Free lakeside camping
description: Beautiful site, cold showers, drop toilets

name: Woods Point Campground
description: A beaut quiet spot to free camp in the elbow of a sharp bend in the Snowy River.  Recently reopened after the fires, new drop toilets and picnic tables, long sandy beach, perfect for a swim. Highly recommended.

name: close to Perth bush camp
description: Decent spot, hidden away in the bush and close ish to Perth. nothing yet in this area so i thought i would add to keep this app up to date. it's probably not legal to camp here but if youre there overnight you're fine ;)

name: Gin Gin Rest Area
description: Nice rest area with toilets and picnic tables. Maximum stay 20h.

name: Esplanade Showers
description: Next to the parking lot there are toilets, and outdoor and indoor public cold showers.

name: Tiaro Rest Area
description: Rest area in Tiaro, with toilets (a bit far from the parking areas tho), a sink to wash dishes and drinking water. There are some picnic tables nearby the park next to the rest area. Very chilled.

name: White Beach Public access
description: Parking by the public toilet. No signs, except a no camping on the way to the beach. Good for a overnight parking.

name: White Trees, Myall Lakes National Park
description: Gorgeous location on the edge of the lake with grassy clearings and tall trees. Fabulous sunsets. Small campground (myall lakes campground get crowded) set back 150 m with just pit toilets, BBQs and picnic benches. Very peaceful - one of my favourites!

name: Crystal Brook Caravan Park
description: Nice park, good showers, laundry and nice staff. Lots of permanents here but no problems. Overlanders are usually put in the back corner with each other. Nice pool, we paid $28 for unpowered but it will increase a bit in May.

name: Woolshed Flat Rest Area
description: Small rest area with a picnic table. No amenities. No network with Optus.

name: Streaky Bay South Rest Area
description: Small rest area with two picnic tables and no other facilities. Nearby Murphy's Haystack, so this can be a free alternative to the campsite, as we heard that now it costs 10AU$.

name: Peterman Ranges
description: An old quarry set approximately 1.5kms off of the Great Central Road with magnificent views of the ranges and amazing sunrises. Set in between Docker River and Warakurna Roadhouse.

name: Cabbage Patch
description: Grocer, good value seasonal fruit & Veg.

name: Borden Rest Area
description: Quiet parking/rest area with picnic tables, bins and toilets. The town is very quiet and we just saw a couple of cars passing by. No network with Optus.

name: Bush tracks behind telegraph station
description: Some nice little tucked away camp sites down the right fork just before the old telegraph station carpark. More spots down the 4wd track to the beach.

name: Bromus Dam Campground
description: Located about 36 miles south of Norseman, WA on the west side of the road  is a really nice established campground with picnic tables, dispersed, camping fire rings water in the water catchment system and a drop toilet. Its well laid out easy to find secluded spots and covers a vast area.

name: Lake Cowan campground
description: This is an established campground 26 km north of Norseman, WA it has dispersed camping garbage bins, fire pits, but it is  close to the train tracks and they are active train tracks so you will get two trains minimum per night

name: Lake view
description: This is a dispersed, wild camping spot off of the goldfields highway around 104 km north of Kalgoorlie its fairly close to the road but theres not a lot of truck traffic at night. The train tracks are on the other side of the road and there are very few trains. Its well hidden enough. It looks like its been used by a few people on many occasions, no rubbish, bins, or toilets, and no water.

name: Coach Road Rest Area
description: A rest area for Trucks and Cars&Caravans (its two separate parking spots). There are some picnic tables with roofs. No showers, only bathrooms with non drinkable water

name: Public Toilets Lake Entrance Rotunda
description: There are toilets available 24/7, there is even a little room with a counter and a sink (to maybe wash some dishes). There is a water fountain on the side of the building and you can fill your water bottle there. I dont know if you can spend the night there, but I saw two vans parked overnight!

name: Dianella Playspace
description: Big parking lot within the park and sport areas. We parked at the end, where the Scout Hall is, as it was darker at night. We slept here 3 nights and had no problems. There arent signs prohibiting camping and there are toilets (open 6am-9pm) and picnic tables. It is a bit busy until late in the evening as most of the parking lot is illuminated and it is a space where people come to do activities, but none bothered us. During the last night there was another car next to us also staying overnight.

name: Booyeembara Park
description: Quiet parking lot between the park and road. Cars pass frequently but there is not too much noise and none bothered us. The parking lots are in the dark. There are also toilets (open 7am-7pm). There is also drinking water in the skate park.

name: Free Parking without time limit
description: Free parking spots on both sides of the road with no time limit. The fill up fast.

name: Rest Area
description: Rest area on the road with no amenities. There is no prohibition sign for camping and there was another van overnighting too. Very close to Pinnacles Desert.

name: Murrabit Country Market
description:
Murrabit District Market on Saturdays.

Public Toilets.

name: Arcadia Beach
description:
Arcadia Surf Club and beach!
One of only a handful of beaches in NQ you can swim and not wear a stinger suit. 
Beautiful calm Bay, crystal clear water and a beautiful rock surround. Get off the bus at Arcadia and walk 50m to beach. Club with food and drink nearby, parking available and toilets on site.

name: Barham Caravan & Tourist Park
description: Powered and unpowered sites on Murray banks.

name: Super Wash & Dry
description: Supa Wash Laundromat open to 10pm. Has books to read.

name: Mulberry Bend
description:
Bush camp with beach and firewood.
4x4 access easy in dry, but river to cross in wet.
Clean and beautiful. Take everything out to keep it so.

name: Parking Space
description: Parking space near Exmouth with no no-camping sign, we arrived in the late evening and left early morning. We also had some other vans parking there at night. We had no problems and it was very quiet.

name: Wanberra Rd Wayside
description: Nothing else around here, so a reasonable place to stop and overnight.

name: Karijini Bush Camp
description: There is another spot with the same name but we could not fond it at the location given, instead we found this bush camp closer to the entrance of the road. Nice place, quiet and spaces for camping divided by the bushes. No facilities but it is not in the National Park so you can camp. No network with Optus.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: In the toilets for people with disabilities of the shell gas station there are showers with hot water.

name: The Old Wharf
description:
Caf at the site of the Old Wharf, with excellent food and beverage.

Sells Redgum Firewood.

name: Wyangan Campsite
description: Free Campsite by the lake. Clean toilets, bbq area and tables. Just 10km from Griffith and completely free. Amazing!

name: YHA Central Hostel
description:
Nice hostel with parking ($15 a day for car/van or $10 for motorcycles) at the back.
Convenient location to explore the city.
Dorms are $40 night and private are $80. Get the YHA membership for free and save 10% 
Not a party hostel so nights are usually quiet.

name: behind Dunes
description: Nice sheltered spot behind the dunes. Not far from the ocean. Dolphins and whales can be spotted in the right season. Access via small, sandy track. 4x4 is an advantage.

name: Lamington Nationalpark O'Reilly
description: Good place with camping kitchen and a lot to look around.

name: Tenterfield caravan park
description: Good place to explore surroundings national parks.

name: Sculpture in the scrub campground Timmallallie National Park
description: Campground in the bush of central New South Wales in the Pilliga Forest. Wonderful walking site into the Dandry Gorge with sculptures on the way. Good facilities for a bushcamp with toilet and a BBQ-site.

name: Hawker Hotel
description:
Right before the Flinders. $120 per night. It s overpriced for the quality of the rooms but everything really is, this part of town. 
The pub is ok and food seems to be good. It was full because of public holidays. Wifi doesnt reach the rooms unfortunately.

name: Arkaroola Village
description:
Nice Little Village from where you can explore the area. Tents are $45 but there are small cabins motel style with shared kitchen and common areas for $90.
Gas station available and small shop with basic goods.
Sanctuary for endangered yellow tail wallabies which get fed every day at 5pm.
Nice and strong wifi.

name: Edith Falls Showers
description: Public showers at Edith Falls. With hot water and locking doors.

name: Mt. Polhill Rest Area
description: Small rest area by the highway, with toilets, bins, and picnic tables. 24h stay allowed. Not network with Optus.

name: Kings Creek Station Rest Area
description: Gravel road rest area next to the road, nearby Kings Creek Campground. we arrived when it was dark and saw some other cars and rigs parked and we left before sunrise.  so couldnt see much of the place but it seems there was no no camping sign. good connection with Optus. no facilities.

name: Coward Springs Campground
description: Cute campground just off the Oodnadatta track. 8-10 spots. Small hot tub at the back and woodfire hot showers. Better to camp here than in Williams Creek for sure. $15 night. $3 date scones available in the cafe which the owners run. Open for visitors as well for coffee from 8-4pm. $2

name: Radeka Backpackers
description:
Hostel/Motel with real underground rooms and dorms. $40 a night for a room with 4beds but the dorms are really all in the same cave.
They also have private rooms with a shared bath for $80 and a private room with ensuite for $120.
Secured parking. 
They are moto friendly.
Close to everything.
Very informative and helpful hosts Hellen and Gary.

name: Little Nobby
description: Free cold public showers, toilets and drinking water taps by coast to refill

name: Mathesons Bore Campspot
description: Very big rest area at the end of a gravel road with a lot of space for cars, tents and big rigs. No facilities, some litter bins and space for fire. A bit far away from highway, so not too noisy. No Optus network.

name: North Tent Hill Rest Area
description: Nice gravel rest area next to the highway with few litter bins and a sheltered picnic table. A lot more space at the back of the rest area entering from a good gravel road just after the rest area which can be more silent. no facilities and good connection with optus. only few kms from port augusta gardens.

name: Tumbling Waters
description: Great camp site with cabins, power, restaurant and bar.

name: Free showers
description: Great little spot. Next to a great library are free but cold showers. Not a big deal with the temperatures around here.

name: Showers
description: Free showers with good pressure. Some what cold, but not too bad. Mens shower stalls have no doors.

name: The Shed B&b
description:
Cute granny flat In nice family backyard. Has AC and parking for motorcycles. Family has 2 cute dogs which are very friendly but you probably have to be pet friendly to stay here. Wifi is not the best and it gets turned off at 10pm unfortunately but the rest is top.
Lots of utensils, pots, pans, and lots of extras. 
Paid $90 a night with is better than most places here.

name: ww2 airstrip
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No airstrip visible on satellite pictures. Please confirm GPS coordinates.

free camping, no toilets, long airstrip, lots of bush and privacy, off the road, great for pets

name: Ampol gas station
description: Free fast wifi at this gas station. No login requirements

name: Overlanders motorcycle tyres
description: Moto tyre shop run by two awesome guys Rob and Wayne. Plenty of choices of tyres chains sprockets brake pads and air filters. Great place also to grab some great knowledge about local riding spots as the owners are 2 ex-pro bikers. Check hours of operation as they close Monday and Tuesday too, but they live next to the shop so they may be able to help you in any case.

name: Skinnys Moto Garage
description:
THE place to go and hang out if you love bikes and you are in Brissie. Local club where you can hire your own space and work on your bike at night. 
Cool people. Experts in their field.

name: Drovers camp
description: Nice and rural campsite on a farm, close to the Hunter valley wine region. Very friendly owner (Neil), you must call/sms in advance for a booking (0476 940 829). $25 for 2 persons per night. Basic amenities (toilets and washing basins). Campfires are allowed (when there is no danger of wildfires).

name: Lions Apex Park - Lakes Entrance
description: Public reserve with plenty of parking. Public toilets are clean and a cold shower is available.

name: mountain lagoon trail
description: good unpaved road with lots of stoping bays along the way and not much traffic... there is a spot for every car or tent setup

name: Challenger Beach
description: Challenger Beach has a small parking but on the road next to it you can pull over. Plenty of space. Toilets / water / trash. No one will harass you there

name: Public Toilets Paynesville
description: Hot showers for free, just press the bouton

name: Rollingstone Bushy Park
description:
Wide open space, free campground managed by townsville council.
Lots of locals, next to creek for swimming and fishing, has couple of fire pits, its a nice place!
There is freshwater and toilets. 
Trains comes by ever once in a while.
Far enough away from the highway to not be bothered by the noise.

Its free but you should still book here, apparently someone from the council checks who is there in the morning sometimes. Cant say what happens if you didnt book since the place is for free

https://townsville.bookable.net.au/#!/search?venueTypeId=1&amp;showMoreSearch=false&amp;showMoreAttribute=false

name: Congelin Campground
description:
Campsite within the Dryandra Forest en maintained by the NP. It's in a beautiful natural setting. About 6 caravan sites, 3 individual campsites and 3 group sites. Toilets and BBQ-kitchens available. No water, no power. AUD 11 p.p.p.n (adults), AUD 7 p.p.p.n. (kids >6). First come, first serve, no reservations being made.
Woylies and Brush-Tailed Possums visit the campsite.

name: Quaalup Homestead
description: Lovely place in a natural setting. Route via a gravel route, app. 45 min drive from Bremer Bay within the Fitzgerald River NP. Circa 7 campsites, a few cabins, toilet and hot showers normally available (although hot water currently not). No generators allowed, no dogs allowed. Kangaroos on the property. 2 km nature walk within the NP. Circa AUD 30-40 per night (family with tent).

name: Cheynes Beach Caravan Park
description: Great place, directly next to the beach and beautiful nature reserve. Grassy campsite with some high trees for shade. Ablution blocks with hot showers and laundry facilities. Playgrounds for the kids. Office with shop and fuel, take-away restaurant open untill 2:30 pm. Price is AUD 75 p.n. for an unpowered site (for the family with 2 kids). Also cabins available. As I understand it is very crowded during holidays, but certainly not during our visit.

name: Porongurup Range Tourist Park
description: Lovely, cosy quite small campsite, not as big as it's name suggests. Very green, grassy sites, large trees, opposite the main entrance of Porongurup NP. Toilets, hot showers, laundry service, large communal kitchen all available. Friendly host. Also very recommendable cafe around the corner, with some homemade foods. AUD 16 p.p. (kids AUD 10).

name: Coalmine Beach Holiday Park
description: Great place under the trees and right at the beach of Nornalup inlet. All facilities present, very kind owner. AUD 15 p.p.

name: Green Island Campground
description: Small basic campground in the middle of the forest. About 20 sites, some with a fire pit, some with a wooden bench, some only for campers, all situated around an open grassy area. To get there follow Graphite Rd out of Manjimup for about 22 km, turn north at Donelly Drive and after 1 km take a right turn on a unsealed dirt track for about 2 km. Signs present from Graphite Rd. Long-drop toilet present, no other facilities. AUD 11 p.p.p.n.

name: Dalwallinnu Caravan Park
description: A somewhat boring caravan park, mainly focussing on campers/caravans with a lot of split sites. Just a few grassy areas for tents. Just a few trees to green up the place just a little bit. It does however has all facilities in order (including camp kitchen) and the ablution block is spacious and clean. Friendly staff. It is situated between the towns industrial area and the highway, causing quite some noise from passing road trains. Town centre is a 7 minutes walk. Unpowered site for 2 is AUD 27, with the family (2 kids) AUD 37.

name: Camel Soak
description: A free campsite with sites scattered around a beautiful rockformation with some sinkholes filled with water. Long-drop toilet and picknick sheds provided, otherwise must be self-suficient.

name: Nallan Station
description: Great place! A full running station, lovely Homestead and large camping ground with all facilities available. Campkitchen with cooler, fridge, plates, microwave, games; outside area with bbq and communal firepit, hot showers and laundry (no dryer). Near de campsite are the pigs, sheep (and the 1 donkey), cattle is at the other side. 12km north of Cue. There you can be some groceries. Highly recommended!

name: Wooramel River Station Retreat
description: Great place! The 14 grassy sites (AUD 36) are a bit packed into each other, but the river sites (AUD 40) are more spacious. Also cabins available. All facilities available. The place is known for the 4 warm artesiam baths (36C), which are free to use 24/7 (you can watch the sunrise out of a hot tub). Communal campfire and dinner - bring your own plate (AUD 30 p.p.). Really nice atmosphere.

name: Jurrien Bay Caravan Park
description: Just another caravanpark, at least with some specifically tent sites (grass!) and good facilities, right next to the beach. Laundry facilities available. IGA around the corner and a restaurant & pizzaria (recommendable!) around the other. AUD 46 for an unpowered site with the family (2 kids).

name: Goulburn river tallarook camp area 1
description: Informal camp ground on Great Victorian Rail Trail

name: Killy bay car park
description:
Car park with a great view to the lake Illawarra. Should be self contained as there are no facilities. 
Road is close but at night is wasnt very busy or noisy. 
Anytime fitness 24/7 is across the road. Very convenient if you have a membership.

name: Public toilets and water
description: Small park with water facilities (15 meters), public toilets, BBQ, playground

name: Rocky Point Car Park
description: This is the location of one of the car parks that permits a 48hr stay. The location above is in an upscale residential neighborhood - unsure if we would have problems there! Anyways, easy rules posted at the car park about self contained vehicles. You can go to the visitors center to obtain a permit, or complete the online form for a permit. The online form took 5 mins! https://visitbunburygeographe.com.au/plan-your-stay/accommodation/ or Google search Bunbury rest area permit and youll quickly find your way. Happy travels!

name: Parking Pull-out
description: This is a parking pull out on the side of the road thats mostly covered from view by forest. Theres a picnic table and enough room for several vans or a few caravans. The ground is soft enough to pitch a tent. Lovely scent from the forest, and not much traffic from the road. No amenities, so keep the forest clean (: There are a few pull-outs similar to this one along this stretch of the SW Highway - none have posted restrictions, currently. Happy travels!

name: Robin Falls
description: Many campsites along the creek. Campfires are allowed, but with caution. Some swimming in some spots. Aboriginal land; respect the environment, no soap, detergent or grey water within 50 meters of the creek.

name: East Bay Campground
description: Free campground alongside an idyllic beach and bay. This site is linked with the citys recreation service with a pit toilet, but no other amenities. Pack in and pack out. Great spot! Highly recommend. There were a couple of other campers here, but we parked at site 1 and had lots of privacy. Signs prohibit campfires and trailers - due to a steep hill at the entrance. Worth checking out to make your own judgment. Photos are from the site we chose, but theres an open road along the beach with space and views as well. Enjoy!

name: Public Shower & Toilet
description: Public toilet and showers at Emu Point. Nice little promenade with a place to wash in the bathrooms, also an outdoor shower. Not sure the water temp. Free and to the side of a cafe

name: Emu Point
description: Theres an outdoor shower, foot rinse, and spout. We used it to fill up our water in the middle of a small park.

name: Nanarup Beach
description: Nice large beach and inlet connection with vehicle access onto the beach for 4wd. The parking area has a restroom. Fishing, surfing, and dogs permitted. Soft sand and turquoise waters. No camping signs, but nothing specifically mentions caravans/self-contained, so Im not sure! There are no showers and only a trickle of running water in the bathroom, so pack in and pack out! Regardless, its a nice place to spend a day if youre looking for something to do!

name: Hidden near the dunes
description:
There are a few tracks off the road leading to Wylie Beach and the dunes. This is one of them, and the only one we noticed with packed dirt for our 2WD. There is no camping at Wylie Beach, but this road seems okay! We met two girls who have camped out here for a couple of weeks without issues.

Its a narrow road with bush on both sides - not suitable for big rigs. Vans, roof tents, tents, maybe a small trailer. Theres space for 3-4 vans, a couple of which can park on harder ground. Its an okay place to stay near town, and a bit more interesting than a rest stop! 

The mosquitos in the evening are relentless, but theres access to a beach if you continue on the track and walk over the hill.  Pack in and pack out (: Happy travels!

name: Roadside Tree Stop
