description: Just a normal pull over along the highway. There are some tracks within the open trees where we parked for the night. I doubt anyone would have an issue with a tent. Nice sounds of birds in the morning. Okay for a night! No amenities, but there are public restrooms 300m from here in the town of Salmon Gums

name: Lake Macdonnell
description: Pink lake separated from a blue lake by the road. We could see the lake had a pinkish hue, but the skys reflection was most prominent from the road. Perhaps, an aerial shot, cloudy day, or different time of year can capture the color better. The cement road out here is not maintained which calls for a few swerves around potholes. Theres a beach at the end of the road and some dunes and roos. Happy travels!

name: Ampol Station
description: 5 Aus pp for a hot shower. Okay bathrooms. Pay the cashier. Theres a slow wifi network here as well.

name: Ampol Station
description: Slow network, but youll be able to send and receive basic messages. No images

name: Quarantine Bio Security Check Point
description: Quarantine check point both directions. No fruits or vegetables can pass. Eat up!

name: The Bush
description: Hidden from the road bush camping with a few sites once you drive away from the highway. Its an okay place to rest for a night. Perhaps suitable for larger rigs, but youll have to be the judge. Ill air on the side of caution and say vans, small campers, and tents. No amenities.

name: Free Hot Showers
description: Free hot showers attached to the yacht club. Showers lock at 5:30pm

name: Jaycee Park Street Parking
description: A small dirt parking lot for a maximum of five cars right next to a park and marina. This parking area is free with no time restrictions posted, and is suitable for vans < 7.5m long as you must park perpendicular to the park. The park is nice with public bathrooms and an outdoor gym, and there is a boardwalk around the marina. Dogs must be kept on a leash at the park. The night was decently quiet. There are a few dirt parking areas like this along this road that could suit larger rigs. Pack in and pack out to keep the locals happy :-) Happy Travels!

name: Street Parking Seacliff Esplanade
description: Free 90 degree street parking towards the beach. There are a few spots here and parallel parking just north. This location is right across from a hotel bar that played music until midnight and light traffic picked up in the morning, so the sleep was okay but the beach is family friendly and dog friendly during the day. Toilets, open wifi from the pub, outdoor shower & spout - not sure if its potable. If you can fit in a regular parking space, youll be all good here. Happy travels!

name: Wita Wirra Park
description:
Free 10hr street parking (M-F). No hourly limit on Saturday and Sundays. The spots are 90 degree angle facing the park. Some noise, but mostly quiet at night. There are parallel spots along South Terrace street with varying hourly limits on weekdays. Its a nice park with a drinking fountain and a public bathroom within walking distance. We saw a few other vans overnighting here, as well. All good!  

Im not sure about the city rules for big rigs and parallel parking! If someone has info on this, please update! (:

name: Copper mine Creek Freedom Camping
description: Great spot beside bridge on your way in from the west. Ignore no camping sign, information office in town approves of this location. Water supply and garbage cans near big tree.

name: Eagle Mountain Bike Park
description: Parking lot slightly removed from the street. It was very quiet throughout the night! There are a few mosquitoes, but its manageable. Decent spot on the outskirts of the city. No amenities, but there is cell service. The parking lot is used during the day by bikers, but there is room for a big rig if you park along the edges of the lot. The cement is uneven in spots. I dont see why you couldnt pitch a tent here, but theres limited privacy. Happy travels! Pack in and pack out!

name: Grimleys Reserve
description: Nice place to wild camping. Good river and shade. Grass and sand. Good for 4wd and motorbikes. Not good for camper.

name: Eumundi Showgrounds
description: Small car park and grassy spot with about 18 allocated spots. Some with power and water and some without, dogs allowed on leads. Hot showers and toilets next to club rooms. First in best dressed, caretakers collect fees each arvo. Price in pictures

name: Town Rest Area
description: Large parking lot for caravans, vans, and cars. There are toilets, a shaded picnic table, dump station, water refill, and garbage bins. It becomes a bit windy up here, but otherwise very quiet and a fine place for a night. Free Telstra wifi network that comes and goes.

name: Rest Area Dump Station
description: Pull over at the side of the road where you can dump. Theres also water available.

name: bungo beach (easy access, secluded)
description: quiet beach. easy drive in access for 2wd. beach front parking. just don't drive to the left of here on the way in as there is some sand at the end. enjoy the views and the water!

name: South Australias Most Southern Point
description: Inspiring viewpoint with monstrous waves and cliffs! If youre driving near, its worth a stop. The parking lot also allows for one night of camping (self contained), and there are a couple of other parking lots at surfers point allowing the same. Enjoy!

name: Secluded place beside a little dam in the bush
description: When coming from Milmerran slowly drive about 400m past this spot on the map. Turn into a small track and follow this along. Nice quiet and idyllic spot beside a dam, hidden away from view. When I was there, only little water was left in the dam. Don't know the size of the area after rain. Should it be wet, better stay on a wider section of the track. You can find plenty of spots here. If you love it lonely, that's the spot.

name: beerburrum state forest
description:
Get your weekend dose of adventure in these forests, conveniently close to Brisbane. Immerse yourself in pine plantations, open eucalypt forest, coastal wallum
mangrove and rainforest, enjoy spotting a huge variety of wildlife and choose from an even greater variety of experiences on offer here.

name: Marina Carpark
description: Large parking lot without signs prohibiting overnight here. We stayed in our van after realizing that we couldnt stay at the RV campground. No issues! Slept fine and parked out of the way from the boaters. Theres wifi by the tourist center

name: Twelve Apostles
description: Parking lot to see the Twelve Apostles rock formations. Its a very busy spot - even off season! There are restrooms and a restaurant up the road. Its a short and accessible walk to the viewing platforms. I recommend coming before noon or 1 to get the best lighting.

name: Smythe Creek Pull Off
description: A small gravel parking lot tucked into the bend of the road - 8 cars could fit comfortably. Its visible from the road, but it feels decently private and comfortable. There are no signs limiting parking and camping here - except a sign prohibiting fires. If youre coming from Otway NP, the turn may be a be tight depending on your vehicle. Its large enough for a big rig, but if youre trailing a large motor home, you may have troubles turning around in the space. No facilities, so pack in and pack out! Happy travels!

name: Beachside Parking
description: One of the only parking areas without signs prohibiting camping directly in front of a very nice beach. We had no issues staying one night and parking so other cars could pull in beside us during the day. This may be different during peak season, not sure! Lovely beach and the sound of waves by night. The road quieted down around 10pm and awoke around 6am. Not ideal for trailers or tents, but great for stealthy vans. There are restrooms 6km down the road and the Great Ocean Drive wooden arch is about 500m from this point. Enjoy!

name: Darling River North Bourke
description: secluded and accessible via gravel road, right by the river with access through public roads, no private property

name: Good overnighter
description: Great spot for a a night. Plenty of space, also for bigger rigs. Trees divide the space a bit for more privacy. No amenities. Good Telstra reception. We camped alone here. Leave no trace.

name: showers
description: BP Service station, 24 hrs, hot, clean showers for $5, showers free for truckers, Is also a truck stop rest area, about 30 mins from Melbourne central

name: Mountain Bike car park
description: Gravel pit close to the road. No signs of no camping. Spent here one night with no problems. The road is a bit busy from early morning to late evening. In the morning many people arrive to do some sports.

name: Brisbane Mount coot tha
description:
excellent bathrooms, water wifi beautiful view of the sunrise
------
excelente banheiros ,gua wifi linda vista  do nascer do sol

name: Botanic garden
description: indescribable place contact with nature was incredible, I felt part of the place

name: Lac Leschelles Campsite Free
description:
Free authorized campsite all around the lake. One part is powered (24$ a night).
Drinking water / toilets / cold shower

name: Shark bay picknic area
description: Rest Area, no signs that camping is not allowed. Bbq and picknick tables availabe. direct access to a wild lonley beach. You will need to camp on a paved road

name: guthalungra
description: stop with bathrooms and water good for resting

name: Tjilbruke secluded scenic view
description:
Tjilbruke secluded overnight spot with scenic view 

Small car park next to the Tjilbruke monument. You have a 180 scenic view over the coast. Close walking distance from the beach and the coffee place.

Toilets and water are available in the park just next to the place.

It was quiet at night and not much traffic passing by.

name: Boonooroo golf course & tavern
description:
very quiet spot. you will stay on a grassy parkling area. Flushing toilets available. Nice spot for a short stayover. 

For Check in go to the tavern. I guess you can either have a drink there or pay 10 dollar

name: Korrumburra Rest Area
description: A small rest area by the side of the main highway leading into town. Includes sheltered picnic table and flat terrain suitable for parking self-contained vehicles.

name: Leanganook Camp Area - Mount Alexander
description: Free Campground in the Mount Alexander Regional Park, just south of Castlemaine. Has toilets and rainwater tanks. Also has fire pits

name: Kerang
description: Nice shower, toilets, bbq and park. Clean

name: Mamanga campground
description: NSW parks established campground $6 night. Nice river side spots clean toilets lots of wildlife and quiet

name: Balranald info centre
description: Clean water taps near the charging for evs and mens shed has a tap too.

name: Lookout
description: Lookout over the vast emptiness of WA. Take 5 mins to have a look!

name: Branxton Park
description: RV overnight parking provided by the local council on a flat site beside a sporting oval. Water, dump site and toilets close by; this place is right in the town. Nice quiet place to rest up and close to all Wineries.

name: Sports and Recreational Park
description: Large park with various club sports centers, walking paths, and ample parking. Parking spaces vary between P1-P3 and are all paid from 8-9pm. We had no troubles staying over night, and we saw a couple other vans doing the same. Its nice and quiet at night. Cheers!

name: Pyengonq Recration Area
description: Free campsite with donation box, very quiet at night. Hot shower 3 minutes 2 dollars.

name: Dunalley hotel
description: Overnight camping parking in large paddock (free or gold coin donation). Toilets available in pub when open (outside portaloo tends to be locked),access to beach, bins available, No showers, No water.

name: Four Mile beach
description: End of road beautiful views and easy beach access from parking. Spent a night here no one bothered us.

name: Macquarie Heads Campground, Strahan
description: Camping close to the waters edge, Parks run campsite, 2 toilets, one at main parking and another further down the beach track near a traffic circle, fee: $25 per car per night

name: Teds Beach Campground
description: National Parks free camp area with National Parks Pass displayed, clean toilets, undercover, electric, bbq area. Parking either in front of beach or around back of the facilities, no shower, Telstra 4G  1 bar-unusable for me, suits tents, car/van campers as well as caravans, bring your own water as water not drinkable.

name: The pines campground
description: Free campground close to the beach, a couple of flat areas with a drop toilet. Shade, wind protection and a lot of kangaroos. Be careful when you are driving.

name: Gordon Foreshore Reserve
description: Gordon Foreshore Reserve provides a day use area and over night rest area. There is a maximum stay of 24 hours. Sites are suitable for caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, public phone, boat ramp and  picnic tables. There is fishing in the area. Pets are allowed.

name: Victoria Park
description:
This is a sports field with changing room style facilities (including toilets and showers). I arrived there at 6:30pm and the site was still open and the building with the amenities was unlocked. 
6 showers available all with clear running water ( !may not be potable!).

name: Sutton Forest Inn
description:
Camping area next to Pub, no camping facilities, must be self sustained. Beautiful views, flat grassy area. Lots of wildlife. Not far from town.
Free camping

name: Gilhams Beach Campground
description: Free campground next to the beach, water tap, drop toilet, shade and grass. Perfect to spend a couple of days and do the walks of crackle creek. No 4wd requiered. Telstra working a bit.

name: Poverty bay
description:
Great spot, beautiful sea view and amazing sunrise, easy accessible by a gravel road (not sandy). Suitable for Vans. 
No Permit required

name: Crown Land
description: Nice place close to the river, part of the crown land. No sign of No camping.

name: Arve River Campground
description: Free campground with flush toilet, water tap, shade, fireplaces and a beautiful river. Beautiful place.

name: Tyenna river wild camping
description: Nice place close to the river, only accesible with 4wd, motorbikes or bicycle. Very quiet, some fireplaces, grass and shade. Just follow the 4wd track and explore. And there are trouts jumping in the river.

name: Freycinet Campground
description: Really huge, wide lawn area with  hot showers($2), toilet, wifi, hosts friendly, $15 pm, no powered sites but have charging stations in the lounge area, I didnt use this so cannot verify tho host mentioned it

name: camping outside of the national park
description: there are lots of spots in the national park along the roads where you could stop for the night, as well as paid camping at wheeny creek. this spot is however outside of the national park so issues with park rangers it's next to a stock pile and there appears to be a motorbike track out the back so don't block it. very flat and wheeny creek is a great place to hang out during the day around 20 mins away. no facilities. pets shouldn't be an issue, but it is in the park a few metres away

name: Truck Stop
description:
Truck stop located off Mitchell Highway- Large open space and people often spend nights here on their road trips. 
There is a Cafe and a Pub on the otherside of the road which are great for refreshment breaks/stop off's- The bacon and egg rolls from the cafe are top teir!

name: Beautiful sunset
description: No one disturb us great for a night! Sunset was amazing!

name: Pool of Siloam
description: Parking lot beside the pool, with bathrooms and outdoor shower. 1 bar of service. No one bothered us.

name: Quamby Corner Caravan Park
description: Fairly large, $10 single unpowered, $20 single powered, clean hot showers and laundry, no additional cost for showers and laundry, friendly family-run grounds, can accommodate tents, campers, caravans, powered and unpowered, 3,4,5g 1 bar only at a specific area, 2 bars at utility block, other then Telstra signal, its a beautiful slice of heaven, quiet and made easier with welcoming, helpful and accommodating hosts

name: Rufus River Lake Victoria showers
description: Nice clean warm showers by the river. Also has camping and toilets.

name: bird hide putt town nature reserve
description: parking at the end of a residential street. 5 min walk to the hide. on a good day, some interesting birds on the lake. free

name: Derwent wild camping
description: Nice place close to the river, there are two fireplaces and some flat surfaces. I camped here one night, and it was beautiful. Excellent for tents, car tent, camper and maybe little truck. Not for big rigs. There are other spots along the river.

name: Mining lookout
description: Lookout into a massive open cast mine. Worth a quick stop.

name: Broken hill aquatic center
description: No through road between the aquatic center and a park. No one bother us. Good for 1 night!

name: Rest area campsite
description: Rest area campsite, well off of the road and off of the rest area!

name: Wheeny Creek Campground
description: Nice camping on the creek. You have to book on the national park website. A nice place to hang around for the day, even if you're not camping. The section behind the toilets is permanently closed, which is a shame!

name: cabarita beach skatepark
description: really quiet. skatepark and rugby ground. no sign for forbidden overnight parking.

name: Public warm shower
description: Nice place to stop and have a good warm shower. It is free and lasts 2.30 min, after that you need wait 30 seconds without movement and you can press again the warm button. Enjoy.

name: Nowra Showgrounds
description: Nice spot for self contained campers. There may be toilets (will have to scout) and can't see water anywhere. Otherwise, clean place, and free

name: Stockton Lake campground
description: A few toilet buildings around the place but thats it as amenities go. Me and my partner paid $11 each for 1 night and got a beautiful spot on the water with toilets not to far away. Ranger is always around to collect money

name: Eyre Hwy Parking
description: Basic rest area. No amenities. No trees so will hear trucks and passing cars.

name: Lake brockman tourist park
description: Powered campsites or chalets. Showers & toilets. Cafe as well.

name: Logue brook dam camp grounds
description: Camping on the water, away from caravan park. Quite and tranquil. $30 per car, per night. Nice flushing toilets with lots of toilet paper. Ranger will come around, can pay by card. Dogs welcome

name: Coolangatta lookout point
description: Small parking at lookout. One spot which is fairly level. Nice and quiet in the mountains on Bruny Island.

name: Barwon Junction Camping Ground
description: Free place close to the river. Very quiet not too much people, plenty of spots to camp. Trees and a bit of grass. Fires not allowed. I camped with my tent and motorbike.

name: Maleny showground
description: It's a country place. With all the facilities. 30 a night is cheaper than many campsites in the area.

name: yankilila
description: Dump point and also separate tap for portable water. Laundromat right beside it as well.

name: Yankilila
description: Dump point in centre of town. nice and clean well maintained

name: Little River Hotel
description: Great spot behind the pub- flat and grassy. You donate $10 to a local charity and can stay the night. Awesome for coming from/going to the Tasmania ferry in Geelong ( 20 mins away ). Trains during day but quite overnight.

name: Fitzroy River
description: Great little spot plenty of room for big rigs. Fees are low during summer season.

name: shady area at recreational lake
description: Council RV Park. 10$/night at self-pay station. Park with Lake access, no swimming allowed. Even though I was here during Christmas period, it only pleasantly little occupied. Nice, shady parking spots. Sound from highway was not disturbing. Max stay permitted is 3 days. Nice spot for families and people with dogs.

name: Amenity rooms
description: Nice warm shower, it is free and there are toilets. Enjoy!

name: Dry creek campground
description: Nice place to camping, toilet, bbq, trees and rubbish bins. There is a place to put boats on the river.

name: Mount Barker Showgrounds
description: Dump-Ezy grey and black water disposal at mount Barker showgrounds

name: parking Burleigh town hotel
description: quiet place for the night. a bit of trafic begining at 5am. We parked as far away from the building as possible.

name: Motorbike shelter
description: Nice place on the road to wild camping. I camped with my bike there is wind protection, a bit noise but ok .

name: dump station
description: free dump at the park. drive through on left hand side as you drive out of the park. you have to pull in 100m before this point see google maps.

name: free dump
description: Free dump could be hard to pull up as there are parking spots next to it. Only rinse water. U might have luck across the street

name: free camp near river
description: signposted rest area. there were a few other campers. next to nice park on the river

name: emerald caravan fill up free water
description: In a loading zone for this purpose outside the visitor centre. Checked inside and filling up caravans is fine. Look for yellow post

name: Fuel Bakehouse
description:
Great local place to buy on the go food.
They even do great jacket potatoes which is a rarity in Australia.
Friendly owner.
Give it a go!

name: balgal beach tent only free water front
description: you must book on Townsville council website. 48hrs in a week max. free and waterfront. potable water, flushing toilets and an outdoor cold shower. lots of picnic tables and some are covered. you have to sleep in a tent. it's a great opportunity to get out of your van. much nicer than the van/caravan site nearby. when I lived near here, I came here at least once per month.

name: free dump at visitors center
description: free dump with rinse water. no drinking water. also has rubbish and recycling but can't fit big bags in rubbish bin

name: Cardwell spa pool
description: blue pools for swimming wet season (November to March approx) only as dry in dry season. about 10 mins from the highway the first 5 minutes is on a sealed road, then 5 mins unsealed road. nice and cool and also some shade if your lucky. free! worth a stop

name: Fruit bat roost
description: Lovely place to stand and watch zillions of fruit bats roosting in the trees. Even during the day there is loads of activity.

name: babinda boulders
description: great swimming spot also nice walks to see the rapids. make sure you read the sign as to where it's safe to swim. there it's pretty safe

name: speewah camping area
description: Qld national park camping. has put toilets and a tank water shower. around $7.50 p/P P/n. there's only 3 sites suitable for vehicle camping. the tent area only has 4 parking spots and they aren't very flat. lots of birds and fairly quiet at night. 20 mins from Kuranda. I took photos of the map the tent parking and the vehicle camping areas so you can see. apparently it's hard to book the vehicle spots in the dry / cool season. non potable water available from taps

name: curtain fig
description: you can't miss this giant tree if your in the area. free

name: swimming in lake eacham (crater lake)
description: fresh water crater lake. amazing views and swimming. parking can get full so arrive early or late. no pets allowed it's a national park. free. highly reccomended

name: Turpentine Camping Area
description:
Turpentine, Onley State Forest, is a very small tent-based, 4x4 car camping campsite set among pines close to other campsites in the forest. It's free

A little scruffy no facilities toilets or water, however, there are a few other campsites nearby with these. Can be busy & noisy on holiday times, popular with 4x4 and bikers but accessible by car as long as the ground is dry.

Great Bird and reptile wildlife and marked treks into the state forests, and Only 1 hour from Gosford and all the shops you need,

name: bilyana park/rest area
description: nice park with big picnic shelters and flushing toilets. non potable water available. not too much highway noise. shelters have space for a 3 man tent if your on a bike and stuck in the rain. 15 min drive from Tully or Cardwell. there's a train line at the back but not too many trains. lots of grass for tents but don't get too close to the train line (fenced). decent Telstra 4g internet coverage

name: BP Gas Statiom
description: Large, clean, and on the quieter side of gas stations. There are a few 24hr fast food restaurants here. We parked to the right of the truck parking by the picnic table. Well worth it to enjoy the beaches during the day and hideaway here by night - no knocks or disturbances.

name: Greenpoint Camp Ground-Free
description: Almost on the beach, campsite shielded by hedge grow, small, can take all vehicles , first in best dressed, cold shower, barbecues and toilets with soap and loo paper, water needs to be boiled, exquisite place, can get quite full, friendly locals, surf and snorkel location, clean soft sand beach, great telstra signal

name: 5 mile creek swimming hole
description: swimming hole 5 mins from highway. has toilets and changerooms. should wear shoes or be very careful not to touch bottom due to bullrout toxic fish otherwise great place popular

name: dog park behind the big mango
description: hidden behind the big mango look for the small sign on the gate

name: Advanced Auto Repairs & Servicing
description: Fantastic experience with Finn and Ashleigh. Theyre a younger couple who know their stuff and give an honest price. Highly recommend. They helped diagnose our steering/breaks issues in our our Chevy Express and gave us a freebie installation of an idler bracket (a part we desperately needed and fortunately had in our trunk). They dont sell parts, but they have contacts. If you need to import parts, check out RockAuto online - theyd very likely let you deliver to their address. Also, there are nice breweries and a cafe close to the shop while you wait.

name: Between eucalyptus
description: Nice place to wild camping, a bit noise from the road, but I had a beautiful night. No amenities. Just follow the dirt track. Enjoy!

name: Horse track wild camping
description: Nice place to wild camping, there is a horse track close to this place. No amenities and no water. Please keep clean this place. Shade and  wind protection.

name: Log Crossing Campground (free)
description: Lovely free campground in the forest. Pack in and pack out (: The sign says it permits a 1 night stay, not sure how or if its tracked. Some signal with Vodafone and Optus. Its a very peaceful spot that smells heavenly. There are fire pits, picnic tables, unfiltered water, and toilets up the hill. We shared it with a couple of other campers and some day walkers came by the morning after. There are some trails around!

name: Side road dead end
description: Old sideroad which has a dead end. there is a Small junction where there is an open place to camp. No noise from the road, nice and secluded. Gravel surface, so not suitable for tent pegs. Road in is narrow and a bit overgrown.

name: Deloraine Rest Area
description:
Free camping rest area, good Telstra signal, dump point available.  Area has ppl camping, big rigs and vans, free and close to town.  Public toilets about 500m away at train display
[Self-contained only.]

name: Wangaratta caravan park
description: $29 per night for unpowered. concrete slabs on some unpowered sites. pool. not many other facilities. toilets were clean. very minimal camp kitchen with no undercover seating. there are around 7 caravan parks in this town so you can shop around. I didn't go to the caravan park in the middle of town for $25 as it had bad reviews

name: Wagonga Beach
description: Large park with ample parking and beach access. Many vans down here, but people have their own space. Spoke with some locals and there are zero issues with staying in this area in your van. We stayed two nights! Theres a place to refill water and toilets. Signal with Optus

name: port of Brisbane shorebird roost
description: free entry to bird hide and also one 100m north of here. should be unlocked but you can call security on 0732584888 to check if you wish. lots of speed cameras on the way in

name: Brou Campground
description: Beautiful forest camping at the merge of lake and ocean. Toilets available, but pack in and out trash! You can register online and the site is fairly cheap. Some locals said that they havent come across forest service, but they camp their bus here every night. I highly recommend this spot if youre looking for some solitude as is not very busy - even over this holiday weekend! No animals permitted as they use poison in the area and its a NP. Enjoy & happy travels (:

name: River rest area
description: Just a place next to the road. There is shade and a couple of tables. I spent a good night with my tent!

name: Taylor inlet wild camping
description: Nice place close to the water, there si a flat surface for maybe 2 cars. Shade and a bit of grass. Nice place, please keep clean this spot.

name: Creek shelter
description: Nice place next to the river, seems that is a 4w track. I spent a good night here, and nobody was around. Trees, a bit of grass and the creek. Please bring back your rubbish and keep clean this place.

name: Public shower and toilet
description: Nice hot showers with toilets. Free. Open until 20:00. Really good!!

name: Western shelter
description: Nice flat surface of gravel close to the river. Very far from the road and very quiet. Accesible by motorbike or a tiny car through a dirt track from the western hwy. It is clean and there is shade. Please keep clean this place.

name: Marsden Weir Park
description:
Small park next to river, toilets, could park a campervan here overnight. 
there's a free sanitation dump site!

name: Just a place behind the bush (motorbike/bike)
description: Just a place behind a bush. There is a little track to enter this place, and it is a bit visible from the road. It is only a spot to spend the night and continue.

name: Wild camping on the track
description: Just a place in the track to do wild camping. Available for 2wd. I spent a good night here. Very quiet.

name: Bikers shelter
description: A hidden spot from the road, only accesible by motorbike or bycicle through a track with some pieces of wood. There are some flat surfaces, shade and It is clean. Lot of animals during the night. Only noise from the road but it is ok. Please keep clean this place, no toilet paper.

name: Large pull off
description: Flat spot off the road. A spot for one night when theres nothing available on the coast. Overnight traffic is minimal. Enjoy forest birds and trees. Larger rig would be fine. Telstar cellular good

name: Nice indoor and outdoor showers
description: Nice showers indoor and outdoor. Beautiful!

name: Bussell old road
description: A bit hidden from the road. Noisy but clean and with shade. Nice place to spend a night. Good place for motorbikes, bicycle or maybe a small camper. There is a dirt track accesible from 40 meters to north.

name: Parramata Creek Rest Area
description:
Established rest area with cctv, toilets, bbqs, 6 picnic tables, bins, great telstra signal, also part of local highway patrol circuit.
Marginal highway noise at night as the road quietens down, great respite when exhausted and needing rest.  Cannot see any water taps.

name: Between trees
description: Nice place to wild camp. There is shade and some flat surfaces of sand /soil mix. Noisy from the road (use earplugs), but nobody around. There is a sand track to enter to this place, you need 4wd, motorbike or bicycle.

name: Public parking
description: I spent one night here, a bit dirty and noisy but it was ok. There are some flat surfaces and trees. Ok for a night.

name: Bilpin Rest Area
description: Slept really well here. Decently quiet road noise, no signage restricting overnight stays. Not a place to set up camp, but a night here is no issue! Large grass area, picnic tables with cover, small playground, grill, and toilets. The only downside is the decent sized parking lot is a tad sloped. We found a level spot in the far left corner (from the entrance) by the picnic table.

name: Ellis beach  ocean front holiday park
description: Good clean and quiet next to Ellis beach

name: Roadside Beach Parking
description:
Here is a line of rentals homes. On the opposite side of the road is a wide parallel parking bay where we stayed without issues. On either side of this stretch are parking lots with prohibiting signs, but this roadside stretch is fine for an overnight! We werent alone, but of course, respect the neighborhood & try not to crowd the place.

Theres a huge grass field (dogs welcome) and a few swimming spots/beach access points, a childrens park, and promenade. Great spot!

name: Free Self-Contained only Camp
description: Nice grass area with zero amenities, but allows self-contained vehicles to camp overnight. Theres also a large day use area that prohibits camping, but this marker is where its okay to camp. Enjoy!

name: Bingil Bay campground
description: Toilet running water shower and barbecue facilities

name: Honeycomb Caves
description:
Free camping with National Parks Pass, has toilet, campsite borders a stream, other side faces cows in the field, small campground, limited caravan space, rangers come around to check pass or fine without.  Tranquil, no water, showers or dump point. I think its better suited to all bar big rigs personally - if full would be nearly impossibly to turn- but for the very first space.
Telstra limited closest to the camp entry itself 3g 2 bars os what i got, its slightly better in the day use area.

name: Buckley's hole bird hide
description: free entry and parking in adjacent residential streets. lots of birds. there can be strong light at sunset so morning would be better

name: Gadds Bend Camping Area
description:
Grassed area beside river, may have cows in area and could flood if river is high level.
Also known as "Walwa Camping Reserve with Cows" on Google maps.

name: Burrowye Reserve
description:
Riverside reserve with cows at times and may flood if river is up high.
Also known as "Free Camp Vic 163" in Google Maps

name: Smalleys Beach Campground
description: Great NP campground right next to the beach! Plenty of shade from the trees and each camp spot is spacious and decently private. 11 sites available and up to 8 people per site. Toilets and drinking water here. Calm beach, but as were here during stinger season we didnt hop in. Mozzies around, but we still recommend. Limited cell signal. 7.5 Aus pp / night. Book ahead online!

name: Ray Brabham Gardens Car Park
description:
Car park close to Bell Train station.  There is a water tap nearby, and toilets.  Bell train station is a 3 minute walk away, where there are more toilets and power to charge devices.  There is a very nice park directly in front of the car park.

This is a short term stop only.  Anything more than overnight will attract attention, but its safe and there are technically no time limits limits on parking.

name: Sand track
description: Just a place outside from the road, nice to spend a quiet night.

name: Clearing next to John Forrest Road
description: Clearing beside John Forrest Road. Large enough for a few vans. Note: road becomes very slippery after rain!! Please take all your rubbish with you.

name: Kershaw Gardens Free Campground
description: Free large campground / dirt lot for self-contained vehicles. There are public bathrooms 700m from here in the park with toilets, outdoor shower, and a water bottle refill / drinking fountain. Max stay 2 days. We stayed two days and on the second morning (6:45am) counsel knocked to make sure we were self-contained. They didnt insist on checking, but rumor has it that sometimes they do? During peak season this place is said to get crowded. Overall, it was a very nice stay with access to the park!

name: Woodenbong Campground
description: Just at the end of the small country town of Woodenbong is this well maintained little camp ground. $5 for non powered, $15 for powered with a couple of shelters you can pitch up next to, a very well maintained bathroom & shower facilities with showers $1 a pop. $15 you can buy some firewood and use their raised fire pits or BYO. Whole camp area is flat and accessible to vans, caravans, etc. CASH ONLY.  Caretaker on site who looks after the place very well. Night was nice and quiet even though there were plenty of us camping at the time.

name: Jarrahdale RV Rest Area
description:
A beautiful location set aside by the town of Jarrahdale. Many flat areas to choose from. Must be self contained, no rooftops tents.

3 day max stay, with potable water available and a dump spot for black and grey water.

No toilets onsite.

name: Childers
description: rest area in childers, public bathrooms near by and access to shops.

name: Rossendale Park Free Camp
description:
48 hour parking permitted for fully self-contained
caravans, motorhomes & RV's only.
No service dependant campers, caravans, tents
or swags permitted.
No sleeping in passenger vehicles.
All dogs must be under control at all times.
Clean up after your dog.
Leave the site as you found it.
People caught littering will be fined.

name: Paruna Campground
description:
Small informal council campground run by locals, charged on per vehicle basis, showers, toilets and power at some spots available if required and include in price $15 per night. 

Very very quiet, with small general store and a tiny pub if you need it.

name: potable water hose and dumping point
description: nice place with potable water hose and dumping point

name: Butts Reserve
description: Small free campsite near Maldon, has basic toilets and rain water available.

name: Burke and Wills Campground
description: Free camp ground near weir and lake. Very quiet long drop toilets.

name: Werrimul Campground
description: Basic donation campground, with basic clean toilet and d cold shower, opposite pub, near the silo art.

name: Mount Crozier Campground
description:
This is a free campground that is in the Murray-Sunset national park and has long drop toilets etc. 
This is 4wd access only, as the campground access includes several kilometres of very soft sand. This is good because it keeps the place quiet. Not suitable for caravan, trailers or motor homes/RV

name: Underbool rest stop
description: Simple rest stop behind the toilets. Donation based with clean warm showers.

name: Snowdrift Campground
description: In the Wyperfeld National Park at the base is some large sand dunes. Has pit toilets and rainwater. Very quiet and no booking required. 4wd access only.

name: Memorial Park (Devonport Cenotaph)
description: An open tap that can be used to freely fill water tanks etc. Left hand side of the car park when one is facing water view. Next to a picnic table.

name: Mount inkerman
description: Quiet place on the top of the mount with very nice view. toilet and bbq available. There's no sign of "no parking overnight" walking trail also available

name: Parking lot near local houses and dog park
description:
Nice little parking area away from local houses, nice view of water and no traffic passing. Many locals walking dogs in the early morning but aside from that it was very peaceful. There were no signs indicating you cant stay here overnight. 
Nice to use the bbq area and hot showers in town then drive out of town a bit to spend the night here. Just leave early!

name: Great Lake
description: silent over night parking close to great lake

name: blueys event hire
description: party shop that refills propane tanks. very friendly service

name: Hampton State Forest
description:
Pull out on a dirt road in the forest. Quiet, free, heaps of mushrooms to pick in the season. Aside from a few dirt bikers we saw no one whilst out there on a long weekend. 

Fox poison in the area so inadvisable for dogs. 

No services. Pease pack out your trash.

name: rest area with toilets
description: Carpark with toilets open all the time. Allowed to stay the night because it is a rest area.

name: Wild Camp
description: small silent camp ground about 3km off the highway.

name: Logan, south of Brisbane
description: difficult to spot. threaded water tap next to sport Park

name: Torquay Beach Surf Drive public toilet
description: Clean toilets and two awesome hot showers. No doors to close though. Beautiful area as well for a walk (or surf).

name: Showers in public toilets- $2 for 3 mins
description: Showers in public toilets. Very clean and worth a visit!

name: Pyegana Dairy and Caf
description: Excellent dairy where they make their own cheese on site in the creamery. There is a viewing gallery to watch the cheesemaking process. The cheese is available on the menu and individually in the adjoining cafe. Cheese tasting also available. A recommended visit if you are passing through!

name: Sivs Auto - European car mechanic
description:
Superb mechanic, Michael the owner is very knowledgeable and helpful. Mostly works on European vehicles but can work on everything.

We have a Land Rover defender, we needed to do an engine swap and in 2 weeks we got all the parts shipped in and engine was swapped. Michael knew where ever bolt went, worked late evenings and let you come in and help and walk around the garage.

100% recommend it.

name: Bulahdelah Showgrounds Dump Point
description: Standard blue dump point. Washing water only. Drinking water elsewhere.

name: Baalbek Lebanese restaurant
description: affordable, home style lebanese food in a basic setup. platters for 2 are about $23 each. if your in to middle eastern food this may be the most affordable place to get it in Brisbane and the gold coast

name: Free Campground Irvinebank
description: very quiet free campground of the village. A black water dump site is said to be near by.

name: Normaton campground
description: at the entrance of the Rodeo Ground and Racecourse the is a big parking area with a clean and free hot shower. The ground also has a campground but only for cattle buyers and sellers. We stayed there for one night without trouble.

name: Lake Tyers Beach
description: Nice site with pittoilets. Allowed to camp overnight, free no fees, no bookings. Beautiful beach, lots of wallabies. Gravelroad, quite bumpy at the end.

name: Free campsite closest to Uluru
description: First site outside to the national park where it is allowed to camp over night. Good Telstra 4G, 3 bars.

name: Charleston wire
description: Plenty of room. No facilities. Close to road. Great spot for overnight.

name: Tanunda public showers
description: Public and free showers. Close to the visitor center. Toilets as wel

name: free water
description:
20m hose needed to reach the car
2 tabs a t a toilet building

name: Roadside freecamp
description:
Freecamping along the great Northern highway. Large open areas with mostly hard ground. Plenty of firewood and a lot of firepits around. 
You can still hear the road, but it is not that bad. Great place for stargazing!

name: Fenced dog park
description: Fenced dog park. Has free parking next door and poo bags available. Also water for dogs. Gets busy with small dogs. Large dogs are permitted just make sure they get along.

name: free hot and cold showers
description:
together with toilet
together with toilet
together with toilet

name: Whyndham Lookout
description: at the lokout above the bay is a bigparking lot. For sunset many people enjoy the scenery.  30min later we were alone. perfect site. 4 free gas grills avaliable.

name: Tailor Bay Camp
description: Beautiful spot next to the sea. Although very close to the road, not too noisy since the road was not busy when we were there. It's very narrow and we could turn with bit of effort but definitelt only for smaller rigs (our ute with slide on is 6.5 m). No bins so take your trash and no amenities.

name: Broome Visitor Center
description: free drinking water and black water dump

name: Free private cold showers
description:
Free private cold showers
Inside toilet block across from rainbow beach. 4x private stalls in male and female toilets. Had a cold shower in middle of winter, was worth it. Not that cold! Lots of free parking here

name: The laundry tub
description: Wash starts at $3 dry starts at $1 for 6 mins. Free parking and IGA BWS and fish and chips next door

name: For filling containers free
description: Between BBQs and picnic shelter a two for filling water containers. Too for for a hose and no thread. Go to water filling station for that

name: Free dump at water fill station
description: Free dump at water fill station behind green fence

name: Bulk water station
description: Coin or card options on different machines $1.30 for 200 litres BYO own hose

name: SS Dorrigo campground
description: $7.50 per night per person must book online. Limited reception Telstra Ok. Most of the campsite is sandy and needs 4x4 however is quieter times you can navigate the road in the campsite which is parallel to the road for a short while and find a spot with firm ground. I made it with a 2wd and so did others. Otherwise U can park on the road next to campsite and camp with tent over the fence. Amazing beach, which is 4x4 accessible. A much cheaper and easier than Fraser. Although if you have a 4x4 Fraser island is highly recommended. Dog on lead friendly pit toilets nothing else

name: Water at the stadium
description:
fresh water
you need your own hose
fresh water
you need your own hose
fresh water
you need your own hose

name: Tom Price Water, Dump and Waste disposal
description:
Drinking water and dump site
Drinking water and dump site
Drinking water and dump site
Drinking water and dump site

name: Fenced dog park
description: Fenced dog park, at the back of the visitors information center

name: Ashton Park Rest Area
description: Free drinking water in rest area, right across the road from free hot showers
